4775 style sheet widgets (handled differently) and windows that don't enable
4776 window propagation. \a implicitMask is the union of all ancestor widgets'
4777 font request masks, and determines which attributes from this widget's
4778 font should propagate.
4779*/
4780void QWidgetPrivate::updateFont(const QFont &font)
4781{
4782 Q_Q(QWidget);
4783#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
4784 const QStyleSheetStyle* cssStyle;
4785 cssStyle = extra ? qt_styleSheet(style: extra->style) : nullptr;
4786 const bool useStyleSheetPropagationInWidgetStyles =
4787 QCoreApplication::testAttribute(attribute: Qt::AA_UseStyleSheetPropagationInWidgetStyles);
4788#endif
4789
4790 data.fnt = QFont(font, q);
4791
4792 // Combine new mask with natural mask and propagate to children.
4793#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
4794 if (!q->parentWidget() && extra && extra->proxyWidget) {
4795 QGraphicsProxyWidget *p = extra->proxyWidget;
4796 inheritedFontResolveMask = p->d_func()->inheritedFontResolveMask | p->font().resolveMask();
4797 } else
4798#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
4799 if (q->isWindow() && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WindowPropagation)) {
4800 inheritedFontResolveMask = 0;
4801 }
4802 uint newMask = data.fnt.resolveMask() | inheritedFontResolveMask;
4803 // Set the font as also having resolved inherited traits, so the result of reading QWidget::font()
4804 // isn't all weak information, but save the original mask to be able to let new changes on the
4805 // parent widget font propagate correctly.
4806 directFontResolveMask = data.fnt.resolveMask();
4807 data.fnt.setResolveMask(newMask);
4808
4809 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
4810 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: children.at(i));
4811 if (w) {
4812 if (0) {
4813#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
4814 } else if (!useStyleSheetPropagationInWidgetStyles && w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_StyleSheet)) {
4815 // Style sheets follow a different font propagation scheme.
4816 if (cssStyle)
4817 cssStyle->updateStyleSheetFont(w);
4818#endif
4819 } else if ((!w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WindowPropagation))) {
4820 // Propagate font changes.
4821 QWidgetPrivate *wd = w->d_func();
4822 wd->inheritedFontResolveMask = newMask;
4823 wd->resolveFont();
4824 }
4825 }
4826 }
4827
4828#ifndef QT_NO_STYLE_STYLESHEET
4829 if (!useStyleSheetPropagationInWidgetStyles && cssStyle) {
4830 cssStyle->updateStyleSheetFont(w: q);
4831 }
4832#endif
4833
4834 QEvent e(QEvent::FontChange);
4835 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
4836}
4837
4838void QWidgetPrivate::setLayoutDirection_helper(Qt::LayoutDirection direction)
4839{
4840 Q_Q(QWidget);
4841
4842 if ( (direction == Qt::RightToLeft) == q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_RightToLeft))
4843 return;
4844 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_RightToLeft, on: (direction == Qt::RightToLeft));
4845 if (!children.isEmpty()) {
4846 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
4847 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: children.at(i));
4848 if (w && !w->isWindow() && !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLayoutDirection))
4849 w->d_func()->setLayoutDirection_helper(direction);
4850 }
4851 }
4852 QEvent e(QEvent::LayoutDirectionChange);
4853 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
4854}
4855
4856void QWidgetPrivate::resolveLayoutDirection()
4857{
4858 Q_Q(const QWidget);
4859 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLayoutDirection))
4860 setLayoutDirection_helper(q->isWindow() ? QGuiApplication::layoutDirection() : q->parentWidget()->layoutDirection());
4861}
4862
4863/*!
4864 \property QWidget::layoutDirection
4865
4866 \brief the layout direction for this widget.
4867
4868 \note This method no longer affects text layout direction since Qt 4.7.
4869
4870 By default, this property is set to Qt::LeftToRight.
4871
4872 When the layout direction is set on a widget, it will propagate to
4873 the widget's children, but not to a child that is a window and not
4874 to a child for which setLayoutDirection() has been explicitly
4875 called. Also, child widgets added \e after setLayoutDirection()
4876 has been called for the parent do not inherit the parent's layout
4877 direction.
4878
4879
4880 \sa QApplication::layoutDirection
4881*/
4882void QWidget::setLayoutDirection(Qt::LayoutDirection direction)
4883{
4884 Q_D(QWidget);
4885
4886 if (direction == Qt::LayoutDirectionAuto) {
4887 unsetLayoutDirection();
4888 return;
4889 }
4890
4891 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetLayoutDirection);
4892 d->setLayoutDirection_helper(direction);
4893}
4894
4895Qt::LayoutDirection QWidget::layoutDirection() const
4896{
4897 return testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_RightToLeft) ? Qt::RightToLeft : Qt::LeftToRight;
4898}
4899
4900void QWidget::unsetLayoutDirection()
4901{
4902 Q_D(QWidget);
4903 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetLayoutDirection, on: false);
4904 d->resolveLayoutDirection();
4905}
4906
4907/*!
4908 \fn QFontMetrics QWidget::fontMetrics() const
4909
4910 Returns the font metrics for the widget's current font.
4911 Equivalent to \c QFontMetrics(widget->font()).
4912
4913 \sa font(), fontInfo(), setFont()
4914*/
4915
4916/*!
4917 \fn QFontInfo QWidget::fontInfo() const
4918
4919 Returns the font info for the widget's current font.
4920 Equivalent to \c QFontInfo(widget->font()).
4921
4922 \sa font(), fontMetrics(), setFont()
4923*/
4924
4925
4926/*!
4927 \property QWidget::cursor
4928 \brief the cursor shape for this widget
4929
4930 The mouse cursor will assume this shape when it's over this
4931 widget. See the \l{Qt::CursorShape}{list of predefined cursor objects} for a range of useful shapes.
4932
4933 An editor widget might use an I-beam cursor:
4934 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 6
4935
4936 If no cursor has been set, or after a call to unsetCursor(), the
4937 parent's cursor is used.
4938
4939 By default, this property contains a cursor with the Qt::ArrowCursor
4940 shape.
4941
4942 Some underlying window implementations will reset the cursor if it
4943 leaves a widget even if the mouse is grabbed. If you want to have
4944 a cursor set for all widgets, even when outside the window, consider
4945 QGuiApplication::setOverrideCursor().
4946
4947 \sa QGuiApplication::setOverrideCursor()
4948*/
4949
4950#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
4951QCursor QWidget::cursor() const
4952{
4953 Q_D(const QWidget);
4954 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetCursor))
4955 return (d->extra && d->extra->curs)
4956 ? *d->extra->curs
4957 : QCursor(Qt::ArrowCursor);
4958 if (isWindow() || !parentWidget())
4959 return QCursor(Qt::ArrowCursor);
4960 return parentWidget()->cursor();
4961}
4962
4963void QWidget::setCursor(const QCursor &cursor)
4964{
4965 Q_D(QWidget);
4966 if (cursor.shape() != Qt::ArrowCursor
4967 || (d->extra && d->extra->curs))
4968 {
4969 d->createExtra();
4970 d->extra->curs = std::make_unique<QCursor>(args: cursor);
4971 }
4972 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetCursor);
4973 d->setCursor_sys(cursor);
4974
4975 QEvent event(QEvent::CursorChange);
4976 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &event);
4977}
4978
4979void QWidgetPrivate::setCursor_sys(const QCursor &cursor)
4980{
4981 Q_UNUSED(cursor);
4982 Q_Q(QWidget);
4983 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: q, force: false);
4984}
4985
4986void QWidget::unsetCursor()
4987{
4988 Q_D(QWidget);
4989 if (d->extra)
4990 d->extra->curs.reset();
4991 if (!isWindow())
4992 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetCursor, on: false);
4993 d->unsetCursor_sys();
4994
4995 QEvent event(QEvent::CursorChange);
4996 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &event);
4997}
4998
4999void QWidgetPrivate::unsetCursor_sys()
5000{
5001 Q_Q(QWidget);
5002 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: q, force: false);
5003}
5004
5005static inline void applyCursor(QWidget *w, const QCursor &c)
5006{
5007 if (QWindow *window = w->windowHandle())
5008 window->setCursor(c);
5009}
5010
5011static inline void unsetCursor(QWidget *w)
5012{
5013 if (QWindow *window = w->windowHandle())
5014 window->unsetCursor();
5015}
5016
5017void qt_qpa_set_cursor(QWidget *w, bool force)
5018{
5019 if (!w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
5020 return;
5021
5022 static QPointer<QWidget> lastUnderMouse = nullptr;
5023 if (force) {
5024 lastUnderMouse = w;
5025 } else if (lastUnderMouse) {
5026 const WId lastWinId = lastUnderMouse->effectiveWinId();
5027 const WId winId = w->effectiveWinId();
5028 if (lastWinId && lastWinId == winId)
5029 w = lastUnderMouse;
5030 } else if (!w->internalWinId()) {
5031 return; // The mouse is not under this widget, and it's not native, so don't change it.
5032 }
5033
5034 while (!w->internalWinId() && w->parentWidget() && !w->isWindow()
5035 && !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetCursor))
5036 w = w->parentWidget();
5037
5038 QWidget *nativeParent = w;
5039 if (!w->internalWinId())
5040 nativeParent = w->nativeParentWidget();
5041 if (!nativeParent || !nativeParent->internalWinId())
5042 return;
5043
5044 if (w->isWindow() || w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetCursor)) {
5045 if (w->isEnabled())
5046 applyCursor(w: nativeParent, c: w->cursor());
5047 else
5048 // Enforce the windows behavior of clearing the cursor on
5049 // disabled widgets.
5050 unsetCursor(w: nativeParent);
5051 } else {
5052 unsetCursor(w: nativeParent);
5053 }
5054}
5055#endif
5056
5057/*!
5058 \enum QWidget::RenderFlag
5059
5060 This enum describes how to render the widget when calling QWidget::render().
5061
5062 \value DrawWindowBackground If you enable this option, the widget's background
5063 is rendered into the target even if autoFillBackground is not set. By default,
5064 this option is enabled.
5065
5066 \value DrawChildren If you enable this option, the widget's children
5067 are rendered recursively into the target. By default, this option is enabled.
5068
5069 \value IgnoreMask If you enable this option, the widget's QWidget::mask()
5070 is ignored when rendering into the target. By default, this option is disabled.
5071
5072 \since 4.3
5073*/
5074
5075/*!
5076 \since 4.3
5077
5078 Renders the \a sourceRegion of this widget into the \a target
5079 using \a renderFlags to determine how to render. Rendering
5080 starts at \a targetOffset in the \a target. For example:
5081
5082 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 7
5083
5084 If \a sourceRegion is a null region, this function will use QWidget::rect() as
5085 the region, i.e. the entire widget.
5086
5087 Ensure that you call QPainter::end() for the \a target device's
5088 active painter (if any) before rendering. For example:
5089
5090 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 8
5091
5092 \note To obtain the contents of a QOpenGLWidget, use QOpenGLWidget::grabFramebuffer()
5093 instead.
5094*/
5095void QWidget::render(QPaintDevice *target, const QPoint &targetOffset,
5096 const QRegion &sourceRegion, RenderFlags renderFlags)
5097{
5098 QPainter p(target);
5099 render(painter: &p, targetOffset, sourceRegion, renderFlags);
5100}
5101
5102/*!
5103 \overload
5104
5105 Renders the widget into the \a painter's QPainter::device().
5106
5107 Transformations and settings applied to the \a painter will be used
5108 when rendering.
5109
5110 \note The \a painter must be active. On \macos the widget will be
5111 rendered into a QPixmap and then drawn by the \a painter.
5112
5113 \sa QPainter::device()
5114*/
5115void QWidget::render(QPainter *painter, const QPoint &targetOffset,
5116 const QRegion &sourceRegion, RenderFlags renderFlags)
5117{
5118 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!painter)) {
5119 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::render: Null pointer to painter");
5120 return;
5121 }
5122
5123 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!painter->isActive())) {
5124 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::render: Cannot render with an inactive painter");
5125 return;
5126 }
5127
5128 const qreal opacity = painter->opacity();
5129 if (qFuzzyIsNull(d: opacity))
5130 return; // Fully transparent.
5131
5132 Q_D(QWidget);
5133 const bool inRenderWithPainter = d->extra && d->extra->inRenderWithPainter;
5134 const QRegion toBePainted = !inRenderWithPainter ? d->prepareToRender(region: sourceRegion, renderFlags)
5135 : sourceRegion;
5136 if (toBePainted.isEmpty())
5137 return;
5138
5139 if (!d->extra)
5140 d->createExtra();
5141 d->extra->inRenderWithPainter = true;
5142
5143 QPaintEngine *engine = painter->paintEngine();
5144 Q_ASSERT(engine);
5145 QPaintEnginePrivate *enginePriv = engine->d_func();
5146 Q_ASSERT(enginePriv);
5147 QPaintDevice *target = engine->paintDevice();
5148 Q_ASSERT(target);
5149
5150 // Render via a pixmap when dealing with non-opaque painters or printers.
5151 if (!inRenderWithPainter && (opacity < 1.0 || (target->devType() == QInternal::Printer))) {
5152 d->render_helper(painter, targetOffset, sourceRegion: toBePainted, renderFlags);
5153 d->extra->inRenderWithPainter = inRenderWithPainter;
5154 return;
5155 }
5156
5157 // Set new shared painter.
5158 QPainter *oldPainter = d->sharedPainter();
5159 d->setSharedPainter(painter);
5160
5161 // Save current system clip, viewport and transform,
5162 const QTransform oldTransform = enginePriv->systemTransform;
5163 const QRegion oldSystemClip = enginePriv->systemClip;
5164 const QRegion oldBaseClip = enginePriv->baseSystemClip;
5165 const QRegion oldSystemViewport = enginePriv->systemViewport;
5166
5167 // This ensures that all painting triggered by render() is clipped to the current engine clip.
5168 if (painter->hasClipping()) {
5169 const QRegion painterClip = painter->deviceTransform().map(r: painter->clipRegion());
5170 enginePriv->setSystemViewport(oldSystemClip.isEmpty() ? painterClip : oldSystemClip & painterClip);
5171 } else {
5172 enginePriv->setSystemViewport(oldSystemClip);
5173 }
5174
5175 d->render(target, targetOffset, sourceRegion: toBePainted, renderFlags);
5176
5177 // Restore system clip, viewport and transform.
5178 enginePriv->baseSystemClip = oldBaseClip;
5179 enginePriv->setSystemTransformAndViewport(xform: oldTransform, region: oldSystemViewport);
5180 enginePriv->systemStateChanged();
5181
5182 // Restore shared painter.
5183 d->setSharedPainter(oldPainter);
5184
5185 d->extra->inRenderWithPainter = inRenderWithPainter;
5186}
5187
5188static void sendResizeEvents(QWidget *target)
5189{
5190 QResizeEvent e(target->size(), QSize());
5191 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: target, event: &e);
5192
5193 const QObjectList children = target->children();
5194 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
5195 if (!children.at(i)->isWidgetType())
5196 continue;
5197 QWidget *child = static_cast<QWidget*>(children.at(i));
5198 if (!child->isWindow() && child->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent))
5199 sendResizeEvents(target: child);
5200 }
5201}
5202
5203/*!
5204 \since 5.0
5205
5206 Renders the widget into a pixmap restricted by the
5207 given \a rectangle. If the widget has any children, then
5208 they are also painted in the appropriate positions.
5209
5210 If a rectangle with an invalid size is specified (the default),
5211 the entire widget is painted.
5212
5213 \sa render(), QPixmap
5214*/
5215QPixmap QWidget::grab(const QRect &rectangle)
5216{
5217 Q_D(QWidget);
5218 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent) || !testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
5219 sendResizeEvents(target: this);
5220
5221 const QWidget::RenderFlags renderFlags = QWidget::DrawWindowBackground | QWidget::DrawChildren | QWidget::IgnoreMask;
5222
5223 const bool oldDirtyOpaqueChildren = d->dirtyOpaqueChildren;
5224 QRect r(rectangle);
5225 if (r.width() < 0 || r.height() < 0) {
5226 // For grabbing widgets that haven't been shown yet,
5227 // we trigger the layouting mechanism to determine the widget's size.
5228 r = d->prepareToRender(region: QRegion(), renderFlags).boundingRect();
5229 r.setTopLeft(rectangle.topLeft());
5230 }
5231
5232 if (!r.intersects(r: rect()))
5233 return QPixmap();
5234
5235 const qreal dpr = devicePixelRatio();
5236 QPixmap res((QSizeF(r.size()) * dpr).toSize());
5237 res.setDevicePixelRatio(dpr);
5238 if (!d->isOpaque)
5239 res.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
5240 d->render(target: &res, targetOffset: QPoint(), sourceRegion: QRegion(r), renderFlags);
5241
5242 d->dirtyOpaqueChildren = oldDirtyOpaqueChildren;
5243 return res;
5244}
5245
5246/*!
5247 \brief The graphicsEffect function returns a pointer to the
5248 widget's graphics effect.
5249
5250 If the widget has no graphics effect, \nullptr is returned.
5251
5252 \since 4.6
5253
5254 \sa setGraphicsEffect()
5255*/
5256#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5257QGraphicsEffect *QWidget::graphicsEffect() const
5258{
5259 Q_D(const QWidget);
5260 return d->graphicsEffect;
5261}
5262#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5263
5264/*!
5265
5266 \brief The setGraphicsEffect function is for setting the widget's graphics effect.
5267
5268 Sets \a effect as the widget's effect. If there already is an effect installed
5269 on this widget, QWidget will delete the existing effect before installing
5270 the new \a effect.
5271
5272 If \a effect is the installed effect on a different widget, setGraphicsEffect() will remove
5273 the effect from the widget and install it on this widget.
5274
5275 QWidget takes ownership of \a effect.
5276
5277 \note This function will apply the effect on itself and all its children.
5278
5279 \note Graphics effects are not supported for OpenGL-based widgets, such as QGLWidget,
5280 QOpenGLWidget and QQuickWidget.
5281
5282 \since 4.6
5283
5284 \sa graphicsEffect()
5285*/
5286#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5287void QWidget::setGraphicsEffect(QGraphicsEffect *effect)
5288{
5289 Q_D(QWidget);
5290 if (d->graphicsEffect == effect)
5291 return;
5292
5293 if (d->graphicsEffect) {
5294 d->invalidateBackingStore(rect());
5295 delete d->graphicsEffect;
5296 d->graphicsEffect = nullptr;
5297 }
5298
5299 if (effect) {
5300 // Set new effect.
5301 QGraphicsEffectSourcePrivate *sourced = new QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate(this);
5302 QGraphicsEffectSource *source = new QGraphicsEffectSource(*sourced);
5303 d->graphicsEffect = effect;
5304 effect->d_func()->setGraphicsEffectSource(source);
5305 update();
5306 }
5307
5308 d->updateIsOpaque();
5309}
5310#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5311
5312bool QWidgetPrivate::isAboutToShow() const
5313{
5314 if (data.in_show)
5315 return true;
5316
5317 Q_Q(const QWidget);
5318 if (q->isHidden())
5319 return false;
5320
5321 // The widget will be shown if any of its ancestors are about to show.
5322 QWidget *parent = q->parentWidget();
5323 return parent ? parent->d_func()->isAboutToShow() : false;
5324}
5325
5326QRegion QWidgetPrivate::prepareToRender(const QRegion &region, QWidget::RenderFlags renderFlags)
5327{
5328 Q_Q(QWidget);
5329 const bool isVisible = q->isVisible();
5330
5331 // Make sure the widget is laid out correctly.
5332 if (!isVisible && !isAboutToShow()) {
5333 QWidget *topLevel = q->window();
5334 (void)topLevel->d_func()->topData(); // Make sure we at least have top-data.
5335 topLevel->ensurePolished();
5336
5337 // Invalidate the layout of hidden ancestors (incl. myself) and pretend
5338 // they're not explicitly hidden.
5339 QWidget *widget = q;
5340 QWidgetList hiddenWidgets;
5341 while (widget) {
5342 if (widget->isHidden()) {
5343 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Hidden, on: false);
5344 hiddenWidgets.append(t: widget);
5345 if (!widget->isWindow() && widget->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout)
5346 widget->d_func()->updateGeometry_helper(forceUpdate: true);
5347 }
5348 widget = widget->parentWidget();
5349 }
5350
5351 // Activate top-level layout.
5352 if (topLevel->d_func()->layout)
5353 topLevel->d_func()->layout->activate();
5354
5355 // Adjust size if necessary.
5356 QTLWExtra *topLevelExtra = topLevel->d_func()->maybeTopData();
5357 if (topLevelExtra && !topLevelExtra->sizeAdjusted
5358 && !topLevel->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Resized)) {
5359 topLevel->adjustSize();
5360 topLevel->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Resized, on: false);
5361 }
5362
5363 // Activate child layouts.
5364 topLevel->d_func()->activateChildLayoutsRecursively();
5365
5366 // We're not cheating with WA_WState_Hidden anymore.
5367 for (int i = 0; i < hiddenWidgets.size(); ++i) {
5368 QWidget *widget = hiddenWidgets.at(i);
5369 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Hidden);
5370 if (!widget->isWindow() && widget->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout)
5371 widget->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout->invalidate();
5372 }
5373 } else if (isVisible) {
5374 q->window()->d_func()->sendPendingMoveAndResizeEvents(recursive: true, disableUpdates: true);
5375 }
5376
5377 // Calculate the region to be painted.
5378 QRegion toBePainted = !region.isEmpty() ? region : QRegion(q->rect());
5379 if (!(renderFlags & QWidget::IgnoreMask) && extra && extra->hasMask)
5380 toBePainted &= extra->mask;
5381 return toBePainted;
5382}
5383
5384void QWidgetPrivate::render_helper(QPainter *painter, const QPoint &targetOffset, const QRegion &toBePainted,
5385 QWidget::RenderFlags renderFlags)
5386{
5387 Q_ASSERT(painter);
5388 Q_ASSERT(!toBePainted.isEmpty());
5389
5390 Q_Q(QWidget);
5391 const QTransform originalTransform = painter->worldTransform();
5392 const bool useDeviceCoordinates = originalTransform.isScaling();
5393 if (!useDeviceCoordinates) {
5394 // Render via a pixmap.
5395 const QRect rect = toBePainted.boundingRect();
5396 const QSize size = rect.size();
5397 if (size.isNull())
5398 return;
5399
5400 const qreal pixmapDevicePixelRatio = painter->device()->devicePixelRatio();
5401 QPixmap pixmap(size * pixmapDevicePixelRatio);
5402 pixmap.setDevicePixelRatio(pixmapDevicePixelRatio);
5403
5404 if (!(renderFlags & QWidget::DrawWindowBackground) || !isOpaque)
5405 pixmap.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
5406 q->render(target: &pixmap, targetOffset: QPoint(), sourceRegion: toBePainted, renderFlags);
5407
5408 const bool restore = !(painter->renderHints() & QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform);
5409 painter->setRenderHints(hints: QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform, on: true);
5410
5411 painter->drawPixmap(p: targetOffset, pm: pixmap);
5412
5413 if (restore)
5414 painter->setRenderHints(hints: QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform, on: false);
5415
5416 } else {
5417 // Render via a pixmap in device coordinates (to avoid pixmap scaling).
5418 QTransform transform = originalTransform;
5419 transform.translate(dx: targetOffset.x(), dy: targetOffset.y());
5420
5421 QPaintDevice *device = painter->device();
5422 Q_ASSERT(device);
5423
5424 // Calculate device rect.
5425 const QRectF rect(toBePainted.boundingRect());
5426 QRect deviceRect = transform.mapRect(QRectF(0, 0, rect.width(), rect.height())).toAlignedRect();
5427 deviceRect &= QRect(0, 0, device->width(), device->height());
5428
5429 QPixmap pixmap(deviceRect.size());
5430 pixmap.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
5431
5432 // Create a pixmap device coordinate painter.
5433 QPainter pixmapPainter(&pixmap);
5434 pixmapPainter.setRenderHints(hints: painter->renderHints());
5435 transform *= QTransform::fromTranslate(dx: -deviceRect.x(), dy: -deviceRect.y());
5436 pixmapPainter.setTransform(transform);
5437
5438 q->render(painter: &pixmapPainter, targetOffset: QPoint(), sourceRegion: toBePainted, renderFlags);
5439 pixmapPainter.end();
5440
5441 // And then draw the pixmap.
5442 painter->setTransform(transform: QTransform());
5443 painter->drawPixmap(p: deviceRect.topLeft(), pm: pixmap);
5444 painter->setTransform(transform: originalTransform);
5445 }
5446}
5447
5448void QWidgetPrivate::drawWidget(QPaintDevice *pdev, const QRegion &rgn, const QPoint &offset, DrawWidgetFlags flags,
5449 QPainter *sharedPainter, QWidgetRepaintManager *repaintManager)
5450{
5451 if (rgn.isEmpty())
5452 return;
5453
5454 Q_Q(QWidget);
5455
5456 qCInfo(lcWidgetPainting) << "Drawing" << rgn << "of" << q << "at" << offset
5457 << "into paint device" << pdev << "with" << flags;
5458
5459 const bool asRoot = flags & DrawAsRoot;
5460 bool onScreen = shouldPaintOnScreen();
5461
5462#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5463 if (graphicsEffect && graphicsEffect->isEnabled()) {
5464 QGraphicsEffectSource *source = graphicsEffect->d_func()->source;
5465 QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate *sourced = static_cast<QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate *>
5466 (source->d_func());
5467 if (!sourced->context) {
5468 const QRegion effectRgn((flags & UseEffectRegionBounds) ? rgn.boundingRect() : rgn);
5469 QWidgetPaintContext context(pdev, effectRgn, offset, flags, sharedPainter, repaintManager);
5470 sourced->context = &context;
5471 if (!sharedPainter) {
5472 setSystemClip(paintEngine: pdev->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: pdev->devicePixelRatio(), region: effectRgn.translated(p: offset));
5473 QPainter p(pdev);
5474 p.translate(offset);
5475 context.painter = &p;
5476 graphicsEffect->draw(painter: &p);
5477 setSystemClip(paintEngine: pdev->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: 1, region: QRegion());
5478 } else {
5479 context.painter = sharedPainter;
5480 if (sharedPainter->worldTransform() != sourced->lastEffectTransform) {
5481 sourced->invalidateCache();
5482 sourced->lastEffectTransform = sharedPainter->worldTransform();
5483 }
5484 sharedPainter->save();
5485 sharedPainter->translate(offset);
5486 setSystemClip(paintEngine: sharedPainter->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: sharedPainter->device()->devicePixelRatio(), region: effectRgn.translated(p: offset));
5487 graphicsEffect->draw(painter: sharedPainter);
5488 setSystemClip(paintEngine: sharedPainter->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: 1, region: QRegion());
5489 sharedPainter->restore();
5490 }
5491 sourced->context = nullptr;
5492
5493 if (repaintManager)
5494 repaintManager->markNeedsFlush(widget: q, region: effectRgn, topLevelOffset: offset);
5495
5496 return;
5497 }
5498 }
5499#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5500 flags = flags & ~UseEffectRegionBounds;
5501
5502 const bool alsoOnScreen = flags & DrawPaintOnScreen;
5503 const bool recursive = flags & DrawRecursive;
5504 const bool alsoInvisible = flags & DrawInvisible;
5505
5506 Q_ASSERT(sharedPainter ? sharedPainter->isActive() : true);
5507
5508 QRegion toBePainted(rgn);
5509 if (asRoot && !alsoInvisible)
5510 toBePainted &= clipRect(); //(rgn & visibleRegion());
5511 if (!(flags & DontSubtractOpaqueChildren))
5512 subtractOpaqueChildren(source&: toBePainted, clipRect: q->rect());
5513
5514 if (!toBePainted.isEmpty()) {
5515 if (!onScreen || alsoOnScreen) {
5516 //update the "in paint event" flag
5517 if (Q_UNLIKELY(q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_InPaintEvent)))
5518 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::repaint: Recursive repaint detected");
5519 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_InPaintEvent);
5520
5521 //clip away the new area
5522 QPaintEngine *paintEngine = pdev->paintEngine();
5523 if (paintEngine) {
5524 setRedirected(replacement: pdev, offset: -offset);
5525
5526 if (sharedPainter)
5527 setSystemClip(paintEngine: pdev->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: pdev->devicePixelRatio(), region: toBePainted);
5528 else
5529 paintEngine->d_func()->systemRect = q->data->crect;
5530
5531 //paint the background
5532 if ((asRoot || q->autoFillBackground() || onScreen || q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_StyledBackground))
5533 && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_OpaquePaintEvent) && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NoSystemBackground)) {
5534 beginBackingStorePainting();
5535 QPainter p(q);
5536 p.setRenderHint(hint: QPainter::SmoothPixmapTransform);
5537 paintBackground(painter: &p, rgn: toBePainted, flags: (asRoot || onScreen) ? (flags | DrawAsRoot) : DrawWidgetFlags());
5538 endBackingStorePainting();
5539 }
5540
5541 if (!sharedPainter)
5542 setSystemClip(paintEngine: pdev->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: pdev->devicePixelRatio(), region: toBePainted.translated(p: offset));
5543
5544 if (!onScreen && !asRoot && !isOpaque && q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_TintedBackground)) {
5545 beginBackingStorePainting();
5546 QPainter p(q);
5547 QColor tint = q->palette().window().color();
5548 tint.setAlphaF(.6f);
5549 p.fillRect(toBePainted.boundingRect(), color: tint);
5550 endBackingStorePainting();
5551 }
5552 }
5553
5554#if 0
5555 qDebug() << "painting" << q << "opaque ==" << isOpaque();
5556 qDebug() << "clipping to" << toBePainted << "location == " << offset
5557 << "geometry ==" << QRect(q->mapTo(q->window(), QPoint(0, 0)), q->size());
5558#endif
5559
5560 bool skipPaintEvent = false;
5561 if (renderToTexture) {
5562 // This widget renders into a texture which is composed later. We just need to
5563 // punch a hole in the backingstore, so the texture will be visible.
5564 beginBackingStorePainting();
5565 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_AlwaysStackOnTop) && repaintManager) {
5566 QPainter p(q);
5567 p.setCompositionMode(QPainter::CompositionMode_Source);
5568 p.fillRect(r: q->rect(), c: Qt::transparent);
5569 } else if (!repaintManager) {
5570 // We are not drawing to a backingstore: fall back to QImage
5571 QImage img = grabFramebuffer();
5572 // grabFramebuffer() always sets the format to RGB32
5573 // regardless of whether it is transparent or not.
5574 if (img.format() == QImage::Format_RGB32)
5575 img.reinterpretAsFormat(f: QImage::Format_ARGB32_Premultiplied);
5576 QPainter p(q);
5577 p.drawImage(r: q->rect(), image: img);
5578 skipPaintEvent = true;
5579 }
5580 endBackingStorePainting();
5581 if (renderToTextureReallyDirty)
5582 renderToTextureReallyDirty = 0;
5583 else
5584 skipPaintEvent = true;
5585 }
5586
5587 if (!skipPaintEvent) {
5588 //actually send the paint event
5589 sendPaintEvent(toBePainted);
5590 }
5591
5592 if (repaintManager)
5593 repaintManager->markNeedsFlush(widget: q, region: toBePainted, topLevelOffset: offset);
5594
5595 //restore
5596 if (paintEngine) {
5597 restoreRedirected();
5598 if (!sharedPainter)
5599 paintEngine->d_func()->systemRect = QRect();
5600 else
5601 paintEngine->d_func()->currentClipDevice = nullptr;
5602
5603 setSystemClip(paintEngine: pdev->paintEngine(), devicePixelRatio: 1, region: QRegion());
5604 }
5605 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_InPaintEvent, on: false);
5606 if (Q_UNLIKELY(q->paintingActive()))
5607 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::repaint: It is dangerous to leave painters active on a widget outside of the PaintEvent");
5608
5609 if (paintEngine && paintEngine->autoDestruct()) {
5610 delete paintEngine;
5611 }
5612 } else if (q->isWindow()) {
5613 QPaintEngine *engine = pdev->paintEngine();
5614 if (engine) {
5615 QPainter p(pdev);
5616 p.setClipRegion(toBePainted);
5617 const QBrush bg = q->palette().brush(cr: QPalette::Window);
5618 if (bg.style() == Qt::TexturePattern)
5619 p.drawTiledPixmap(rect: q->rect(), pm: bg.texture());
5620 else
5621 p.fillRect(q->rect(), bg);
5622
5623 if (engine->autoDestruct())
5624 delete engine;
5625 }
5626 }
5627 }
5628
5629 if (recursive && !children.isEmpty()) {
5630 paintSiblingsRecursive(pdev, children, index: children.size() - 1, rgn, offset, flags: flags & ~DrawAsRoot,
5631 sharedPainter, repaintManager);
5632 }
5633}
5634
5635void QWidgetPrivate::sendPaintEvent(const QRegion &toBePainted)
5636{
5637 Q_Q(QWidget);
5638 QPaintEvent e(toBePainted);
5639 QCoreApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
5640
5641 if (renderToTexture)
5642 resolveSamples();
5643}
5644
5645void QWidgetPrivate::render(QPaintDevice *target, const QPoint &targetOffset,
5646 const QRegion &sourceRegion, QWidget::RenderFlags renderFlags)
5647{
5648 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!target)) {
5649 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::render: null pointer to paint device");
5650 return;
5651 }
5652
5653 const bool inRenderWithPainter = extra && extra->inRenderWithPainter;
5654 QRegion paintRegion = !inRenderWithPainter
5655 ? prepareToRender(region: sourceRegion, renderFlags)
5656 : sourceRegion;
5657 if (paintRegion.isEmpty())
5658 return;
5659
5660 QPainter *oldSharedPainter = inRenderWithPainter ? sharedPainter() : nullptr;
5661
5662 // Use the target's shared painter if set (typically set when doing
5663 // "other->render(widget);" in the widget's paintEvent.
5664 if (target->devType() == QInternal::Widget) {
5665 QWidgetPrivate *targetPrivate = static_cast<QWidget *>(target)->d_func();
5666 if (targetPrivate->extra && targetPrivate->extra->inRenderWithPainter) {
5667 QPainter *targetPainter = targetPrivate->sharedPainter();
5668 if (targetPainter && targetPainter->isActive())
5669 setSharedPainter(targetPainter);
5670 }
5671 }
5672
5673 // Use the target's redirected device if set and adjust offset and paint
5674 // region accordingly. This is typically the case when people call render
5675 // from the paintEvent.
5676 QPoint offset = targetOffset;
5677 offset -= paintRegion.boundingRect().topLeft();
5678 QPoint redirectionOffset;
5679 QPaintDevice *redirected = nullptr;
5680
5681 if (target->devType() == QInternal::Widget)
5682 redirected = static_cast<QWidget *>(target)->d_func()->redirected(offset: &redirectionOffset);
5683
5684 if (redirected) {
5685 target = redirected;
5686 offset -= redirectionOffset;
5687 }
5688
5689 if (!inRenderWithPainter) { // Clip handled by shared painter (in qpainter.cpp).
5690 if (QPaintEngine *targetEngine = target->paintEngine()) {
5691 const QRegion targetSystemClip = targetEngine->systemClip();
5692 if (!targetSystemClip.isEmpty())
5693 paintRegion &= targetSystemClip.translated(p: -offset);
5694 }
5695 }
5696
5697 // Set backingstore flags.
5698 DrawWidgetFlags flags = DrawPaintOnScreen | DrawInvisible;
5699 if (renderFlags & QWidget::DrawWindowBackground)
5700 flags |= DrawAsRoot;
5701
5702 if (renderFlags & QWidget::DrawChildren)
5703 flags |= DrawRecursive;
5704 else
5705 flags |= DontSubtractOpaqueChildren;
5706
5707 flags |= DontSetCompositionMode;
5708
5709 // Render via backingstore.
5710 drawWidget(pdev: target, rgn: paintRegion, offset, flags, sharedPainter: sharedPainter());
5711
5712 // Restore shared painter.
5713 if (oldSharedPainter)
5714 setSharedPainter(oldSharedPainter);
5715}
5716
5717void QWidgetPrivate::paintSiblingsRecursive(QPaintDevice *pdev, const QObjectList& siblings, int index, const QRegion &rgn,
5718 const QPoint &offset, DrawWidgetFlags flags
5719 , QPainter *sharedPainter, QWidgetRepaintManager *repaintManager)
5720{
5721 QWidget *w = nullptr;
5722 QRect boundingRect;
5723 bool dirtyBoundingRect = true;
5724 const bool exludeOpaqueChildren = (flags & DontDrawOpaqueChildren);
5725 const bool excludeNativeChildren = (flags & DontDrawNativeChildren);
5726
5727 do {
5728 QWidget *x = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: siblings.at(i: index));
5729 if (x && !(exludeOpaqueChildren && x->d_func()->isOpaque) && !x->isHidden() && !x->isWindow()
5730 && !(excludeNativeChildren && x->internalWinId())) {
5731 if (dirtyBoundingRect) {
5732 boundingRect = rgn.boundingRect();
5733 dirtyBoundingRect = false;
5734 }
5735
5736 if (qRectIntersects(r1: boundingRect, r2: x->d_func()->effectiveRectFor(rect: x->data->crect))) {
5737 w = x;
5738 break;
5739 }
5740 }
5741 --index;
5742 } while (index >= 0);
5743
5744 if (!w)
5745 return;
5746
5747 QWidgetPrivate *wd = w->d_func();
5748 const QPoint widgetPos(w->data->crect.topLeft());
5749 const bool hasMask = wd->extra && wd->extra->hasMask && !wd->graphicsEffect;
5750 if (index > 0) {
5751 QRegion wr(rgn);
5752 if (wd->isOpaque)
5753 wr -= hasMask ? wd->extra->mask.translated(p: widgetPos) : w->data->crect;
5754 paintSiblingsRecursive(pdev, siblings, index: --index, rgn: wr, offset, flags,
5755 sharedPainter, repaintManager);
5756 }
5757
5758 if (w->updatesEnabled()
5759#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
5760 && (!w->d_func()->extra || !w->d_func()->extra->proxyWidget)
5761#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
5762 ) {
5763 QRegion wRegion(rgn);
5764 wRegion &= wd->effectiveRectFor(rect: w->data->crect);
5765 wRegion.translate(p: -widgetPos);
5766 if (hasMask)
5767 wRegion &= wd->extra->mask;
5768 wd->drawWidget(pdev, rgn: wRegion, offset: offset + widgetPos, flags, sharedPainter, repaintManager);
5769 }
5770}
5771
5772#if QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5773QRectF QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate::boundingRect(Qt::CoordinateSystem system) const
5774{
5775 if (system != Qt::DeviceCoordinates)
5776 return m_widget->rect();
5777
5778 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!context)) {
5779 // Device coordinates without context not yet supported.
5780 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsEffectSource::boundingRect: Not yet implemented, lacking device context");
5781 return QRectF();
5782 }
5783
5784 return context->painter->worldTransform().mapRect(m_widget->rect());
5785}
5786
5787void QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate::draw(QPainter *painter)
5788{
5789 if (!context || context->painter != painter) {
5790 m_widget->render(painter);
5791 return;
5792 }
5793
5794 // The region saved in the context is neither clipped to the rect
5795 // nor the mask, so we have to clip it here before calling drawWidget.
5796 QRegion toBePainted = context->rgn;
5797 toBePainted &= m_widget->rect();
5798 QWidgetPrivate *wd = qt_widget_private(widget: m_widget);
5799 if (wd->extra && wd->extra->hasMask)
5800 toBePainted &= wd->extra->mask;
5801
5802 wd->drawWidget(pdev: context->pdev, rgn: toBePainted, offset: context->offset, flags: context->flags,
5803 sharedPainter: context->sharedPainter, repaintManager: context->repaintManager);
5804}
5805
5806QPixmap QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate::pixmap(Qt::CoordinateSystem system, QPoint *offset,
5807 QGraphicsEffect::PixmapPadMode mode) const
5808{
5809 const bool deviceCoordinates = (system == Qt::DeviceCoordinates);
5810 if (Q_UNLIKELY(!context && deviceCoordinates)) {
5811 // Device coordinates without context not yet supported.
5812 qWarning(msg: "QGraphicsEffectSource::pixmap: Not yet implemented, lacking device context");
5813 return QPixmap();
5814 }
5815
5816 QPoint pixmapOffset;
5817 QRectF sourceRect = m_widget->rect();
5818
5819 if (deviceCoordinates) {
5820 const QTransform &painterTransform = context->painter->worldTransform();
5821 sourceRect = painterTransform.mapRect(sourceRect);
5822 pixmapOffset = painterTransform.map(p: pixmapOffset);
5823 }
5824
5825 QRect effectRect;
5826
5827 if (mode == QGraphicsEffect::PadToEffectiveBoundingRect)
5828 effectRect = m_widget->graphicsEffect()->boundingRectFor(sourceRect).toAlignedRect();
5829 else if (mode == QGraphicsEffect::PadToTransparentBorder)
5830 effectRect = sourceRect.adjusted(xp1: -1, yp1: -1, xp2: 1, yp2: 1).toAlignedRect();
5831 else
5832 effectRect = sourceRect.toAlignedRect();
5833
5834 if (offset)
5835 *offset = effectRect.topLeft();
5836
5837 pixmapOffset -= effectRect.topLeft();
5838
5839 qreal dpr(1.0);
5840 if (const auto *paintDevice = context->painter->device())
5841 dpr = paintDevice->devicePixelRatio();
5842 else
5843 qWarning(msg: "QWidgetEffectSourcePrivate::pixmap: Painter not active");
5844 QPixmap pixmap(effectRect.size() * dpr);
5845 pixmap.setDevicePixelRatio(dpr);
5846
5847 pixmap.fill(fillColor: Qt::transparent);
5848 m_widget->render(target: &pixmap, targetOffset: pixmapOffset, sourceRegion: QRegion(), renderFlags: QWidget::DrawChildren);
5849 return pixmap;
5850}
5851#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicseffect)
5852
5853#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
5854/*!
5855 \internal
5856
5857 Finds the nearest widget embedded in a graphics proxy widget along the chain formed by this
5858 widget and its ancestors. The search starts at \a origin (inclusive).
5859 If successful, the function returns the proxy that embeds the widget, or \nullptr if no
5860 embedded widget was found.
5861*/
5862QGraphicsProxyWidget *QWidgetPrivate::nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(const QWidget *origin)
5863{
5864 if (origin) {
5865 const auto &extra = origin->d_func()->extra;
5866 if (extra && extra->proxyWidget)
5867 return extra->proxyWidget;
5868 return nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(origin: origin->parentWidget());
5869 }
5870 return nullptr;
5871}
5872#endif
5873
5874/*!
5875 \property QWidget::locale
5876 \brief the widget's locale
5877 \since 4.3
5878
5879 As long as no special locale has been set, this is either
5880 the parent's locale or (if this widget is a top level widget),
5881 the default locale.
5882
5883 If the widget displays dates or numbers, these should be formatted
5884 using the widget's locale.
5885
5886 \sa QLocale, QLocale::setDefault()
5887*/
5888
5889void QWidgetPrivate::setLocale_helper(const QLocale &loc, bool forceUpdate)
5890{
5891 Q_Q(QWidget);
5892 if (locale == loc && !forceUpdate)
5893 return;
5894
5895 locale = loc;
5896
5897 if (!children.isEmpty()) {
5898 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
5899 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: children.at(i));
5900 if (!w)
5901 continue;
5902 if (w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLocale))
5903 continue;
5904 if (w->isWindow() && !w->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WindowPropagation))
5905 continue;
5906 w->d_func()->setLocale_helper(loc, forceUpdate);
5907 }
5908 }
5909 QEvent e(QEvent::LocaleChange);
5910 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
5911}
5912
5913void QWidget::setLocale(const QLocale &locale)
5914{
5915 Q_D(QWidget);
5916
5917 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetLocale);
5918 d->setLocale_helper(loc: locale);
5919}
5920
5921QLocale QWidget::locale() const
5922{
5923 Q_D(const QWidget);
5924
5925 return d->locale;
5926}
5927
5928void QWidgetPrivate::resolveLocale()
5929{
5930 Q_Q(const QWidget);
5931
5932 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetLocale)) {
5933 QWidget *parent = q->parentWidget();
5934 setLocale_helper(loc: !parent || (q->isWindow() && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WindowPropagation))
5935 ? QLocale() : parent->locale());
5936 }
5937}
5938
5939void QWidget::unsetLocale()
5940{
5941 Q_D(QWidget);
5942 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetLocale, on: false);
5943 d->resolveLocale();
5944}
5945
5946/*!
5947 \property QWidget::windowTitle
5948 \brief the window title (caption)
5949
5950 This property only makes sense for top-level widgets, such as
5951 windows and dialogs. If no caption has been set, the title is based of the
5952 \l windowFilePath. If neither of these is set, then the title is
5953 an empty string.
5954
5955 If you use the \l windowModified mechanism, the window title must
5956 contain a "[*]" placeholder, which indicates where the '*' should
5957 appear. Normally, it should appear right after the file name
5958 (e.g., "document1.txt[*] - Text Editor"). If the \l
5959 windowModified property is \c false (the default), the placeholder
5960 is simply removed.
5961
5962 On some desktop platforms (including Windows and Unix), the application name
5963 (from QGuiApplication::applicationDisplayName) is added at the end of the
5964 window title, if set. This is done by the QPA plugin, so it is shown to the
5965 user, but isn't part of the windowTitle string.
5966
5967 \sa windowIcon, windowModified, windowFilePath
5968*/
5969QString QWidget::windowTitle() const
5970{
5971 Q_D(const QWidget);
5972 if (d->extra && d->extra->topextra) {
5973 if (!d->extra->topextra->caption.isEmpty())
5974 return d->extra->topextra->caption;
5975 if (!d->extra->topextra->filePath.isEmpty())
5976 return QFileInfo(d->extra->topextra->filePath).fileName() + "[*]"_L1;
5977 }
5978 return QString();
5979}
5980
5981/*!
5982 Returns a modified window title with the [*] place holder
5983 replaced according to the rules described in QWidget::setWindowTitle
5984
5985 This function assumes that "[*]" can be quoted by another
5986 "[*]", so it will replace two place holders by one and
5987 a single last one by either "*" or nothing depending on
5988 the modified flag.
5989
5990 \internal
5991*/
5992QString qt_setWindowTitle_helperHelper(const QString &title, const QWidget *widget)
5993{
5994 Q_ASSERT(widget);
5995
5996 QString cap = title;
5997 if (cap.isEmpty())
5998 return cap;
5999
6000 const auto placeHolder = "[*]"_L1;
6001 int index = cap.indexOf(s: placeHolder);
6002
6003 // here the magic begins
6004 while (index != -1) {
6005 index += placeHolder.size();
6006 int count = 1;
6007 while (cap.indexOf(s: placeHolder, from: index) == index) {
6008 ++count;
6009 index += placeHolder.size();
6010 }
6011
6012 if (count%2) { // odd number of [*] -> replace last one
6013 int lastIndex = cap.lastIndexOf(s: placeHolder, from: index - 1);
6014 if (widget->isWindowModified()
6015 && widget->style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_TitleBar_ModifyNotification, opt: nullptr, widget))
6016 cap.replace(i: lastIndex, len: 3, after: QWidget::tr(s: "*"));
6017 else
6018 cap.remove(i: lastIndex, len: 3);
6019 }
6020
6021 index = cap.indexOf(s: placeHolder, from: index);
6022 }
6023
6024 cap.replace(before: "[*][*]"_L1, after: placeHolder);
6025
6026 return cap;
6027}
6028
6029void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowTitle_helper(const QString &title)
6030{
6031 Q_Q(QWidget);
6032 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
6033 setWindowTitle_sys(qt_setWindowTitle_helperHelper(title, widget: q));
6034}
6035
6036void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowTitle_sys(const QString &caption)
6037{
6038 Q_Q(QWidget);
6039 if (!q->isWindow())
6040 return;
6041
6042 if (QWindow *window = q->windowHandle())
6043 window->setTitle(caption);
6044
6045}
6046
6047void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowIconText_helper(const QString &title)
6048{
6049 Q_Q(QWidget);
6050 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
6051 setWindowIconText_sys(qt_setWindowTitle_helperHelper(title, widget: q));
6052}
6053
6054void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowIconText_sys(const QString &iconText)
6055{
6056#if QT_CONFIG(xcb)
6057 Q_Q(QWidget);
6058 // ### The QWidget property is deprecated, but the XCB window function is not.
6059 // It should remain available for the rare application that needs it.
6060 if (QWindow *window = q->windowHandle()) {
6061 if (auto *xcbWindow = dynamic_cast<QXcbWindow*>(window->handle()))
6062 xcbWindow->setWindowIconText(iconText);
6063 }
6064#else
6065 Q_UNUSED(iconText);
6066#endif
6067}
6068
6069/*!
6070 \fn void QWidget::windowIconTextChanged(const QString &iconText)
6071
6072 This signal is emitted when the window's icon text has changed, with the
6073 new \a iconText as an argument.
6074
6075 \since 5.2
6076 \deprecated
6077
6078 This signal is deprecated.
6079*/
6080
6081void QWidget::setWindowIconText(const QString &iconText)
6082{
6083 if (QWidget::windowIconText() == iconText)
6084 return;
6085
6086 Q_D(QWidget);
6087 d->topData()->iconText = iconText;
6088 d->setWindowIconText_helper(iconText);
6089
6090 QEvent e(QEvent::IconTextChange);
6091 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &e);
6092
6093 emit windowIconTextChanged(iconText);
6094}
6095
6096/*!
6097 \fn void QWidget::windowTitleChanged(const QString &title)
6098
6099 This signal is emitted when the window's title has changed, with the
6100 new \a title as an argument.
6101
6102 \since 5.2
6103*/
6104
6105void QWidget::setWindowTitle(const QString &title)
6106{
6107 if (QWidget::windowTitle() == title && !title.isEmpty() && !title.isNull())
6108 return;
6109
6110 Q_D(QWidget);
6111 d->topData()->caption = title;
6112 d->setWindowTitle_helper(title);
6113
6114 QEvent e(QEvent::WindowTitleChange);
6115 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &e);
6116
6117 emit windowTitleChanged(title);
6118}
6119
6120
6121/*!
6122 \property QWidget::windowIcon
6123 \brief the widget's icon
6124
6125 This property only makes sense for windows. If no icon
6126 has been set, windowIcon() returns the application icon
6127 (QApplication::windowIcon()).
6128
6129 \note On \macos, window icons represent the active document,
6130 and will not be displayed unless a file path has also been
6131 set using setWindowFilePath.
6132
6133 \sa windowTitle, setWindowFilePath
6134*/
6135QIcon QWidget::windowIcon() const
6136{
6137 const QWidget *w = this;
6138 while (w) {
6139 const QWidgetPrivate *d = w->d_func();
6140 if (d->extra && d->extra->topextra && d->extra->topextra->icon)
6141 return *d->extra->topextra->icon;
6142 w = w->parentWidget();
6143 }
6144 return QApplication::windowIcon();
6145}
6146
6147void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowIcon_helper()
6148{
6149 Q_Q(QWidget);
6150 QEvent e(QEvent::WindowIconChange);
6151
6152 // Do not send the event if the widget is a top level.
6153 // In that case, setWindowIcon_sys does it, and event propagation from
6154 // QWidgetWindow to the top level QWidget ensures that the event reaches
6155 // the top level anyhow
6156 if (!q->windowHandle())
6157 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
6158 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
6159 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: children.at(i));
6160 if (w && !w->isWindow())
6161 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event: &e);
6162 }
6163}
6164
6165/*!
6166 \fn void QWidget::windowIconChanged(const QIcon &icon)
6167
6168 This signal is emitted when the window's icon has changed, with the
6169 new \a icon as an argument.
6170
6171 \since 5.2
6172*/
6173
6174void QWidget::setWindowIcon(const QIcon &icon)
6175{
6176 Q_D(QWidget);
6177
6178 setAttribute(Qt::WA_SetWindowIcon, on: !icon.isNull());
6179 d->createTLExtra();
6180
6181 if (!d->extra->topextra->icon)
6182 d->extra->topextra->icon = std::make_unique<QIcon>(args: icon);
6183 else
6184 *d->extra->topextra->icon = icon;
6185
6186 d->setWindowIcon_sys();
6187 d->setWindowIcon_helper();
6188
6189 emit windowIconChanged(icon);
6190}
6191
6192void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowIcon_sys()
6193{
6194 Q_Q(QWidget);
6195 if (QWindow *window = q->windowHandle())
6196 window->setIcon(q->windowIcon());
6197}
6198
6199/*!
6200 \property QWidget::windowIconText
6201 \brief the text to be displayed on the icon of a minimized window
6202
6203 This property only makes sense for windows. If no icon
6204 text has been set, this accessor returns an empty string.
6205 It is only implemented on the X11 platform, and only certain
6206 window managers use this window property.
6207
6208 \deprecated
6209 This property is deprecated.
6210
6211 \sa windowIcon, windowTitle
6212*/
6213
6214QString QWidget::windowIconText() const
6215{
6216 Q_D(const QWidget);
6217 return (d->extra && d->extra->topextra) ? d->extra->topextra->iconText : QString();
6218}
6219
6220/*!
6221 \property QWidget::windowFilePath
6222 \since 4.4
6223 \brief the file path associated with a widget
6224
6225 This property only makes sense for windows. It associates a file path with
6226 a window. If you set the file path, but have not set the window title, Qt
6227 sets the window title to the file name of the specified path, obtained using
6228 QFileInfo::fileName().
6229
6230 If the window title is set at any point, then the window title takes precedence and
6231 will be shown instead of the file path string.
6232
6233 Additionally, on \macos, this has an added benefit that it sets the
6234 \l{http://developer.apple.com/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/OSXHIGuidelines/XHIGWindows/chapter_17_section_3.html}{proxy icon}
6235 for the window, assuming that the file path exists.
6236
6237 If no file path is set, this property contains an empty string.
6238
6239 By default, this property contains an empty string.
6240
6241 \sa windowTitle, windowIcon
6242*/
6243
6244QString QWidget::windowFilePath() const
6245{
6246 Q_D(const QWidget);
6247 return (d->extra && d->extra->topextra) ? d->extra->topextra->filePath : QString();
6248}
6249
6250void QWidget::setWindowFilePath(const QString &filePath)
6251{
6252 if (filePath == windowFilePath())
6253 return;
6254
6255 Q_D(QWidget);
6256
6257 d->createTLExtra();
6258 d->extra->topextra->filePath = filePath;
6259 d->setWindowFilePath_helper(filePath);
6260}
6261
6262void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowFilePath_helper(const QString &filePath)
6263{
6264 if (extra->topextra && extra->topextra->caption.isEmpty()) {
6265#ifdef Q_OS_MAC
6266 setWindowTitle_helper(QFileInfo(filePath).fileName());
6267#else
6268 Q_Q(QWidget);
6269 Q_UNUSED(filePath);
6270 setWindowTitle_helper(q->windowTitle());
6271#endif
6272 }
6273#ifdef Q_OS_MAC
6274 setWindowFilePath_sys(filePath);
6275#endif
6276}
6277
6278void QWidgetPrivate::setWindowFilePath_sys(const QString &filePath)
6279{
6280 Q_Q(QWidget);
6281 if (!q->isWindow())
6282 return;
6283
6284 if (QWindow *window = q->windowHandle())
6285 window->setFilePath(filePath);
6286}
6287
6288/*!
6289 Returns the window's role, or an empty string.
6290
6291 \sa windowIcon, windowTitle
6292*/
6293
6294QString QWidget::windowRole() const
6295{
6296 Q_D(const QWidget);
6297 return (d->extra && d->extra->topextra) ? d->extra->topextra->role : QString();
6298}
6299
6300/*!
6301 Sets the window's role to \a role. This only makes sense for
6302 windows on X11.
6303*/
6304void QWidget::setWindowRole(const QString &role)
6305{
6306#if QT_CONFIG(xcb)
6307 Q_D(QWidget);
6308 d->createTLExtra();
6309 d->topData()->role = role;
6310 if (windowHandle()) {
6311 if (auto *xcbWindow = dynamic_cast<QXcbWindow*>(windowHandle()->handle()))
6312 xcbWindow->setWindowRole(role);
6313 }
6314#else
6315 Q_UNUSED(role);
6316#endif
6317}
6318
6319/*!
6320 \property QWidget::mouseTracking
6321 \brief whether mouse tracking is enabled for the widget
6322
6323 If mouse tracking is disabled (the default), the widget only
6324 receives mouse move events when at least one mouse button is
6325 pressed while the mouse is being moved.
6326
6327 If mouse tracking is enabled, the widget receives mouse move
6328 events even if no buttons are pressed.
6329
6330 \sa mouseMoveEvent()
6331*/
6332
6333/*!
6334 \property QWidget::tabletTracking
6335 \brief whether tablet tracking is enabled for the widget
6336 \since 5.9
6337
6338 If tablet tracking is disabled (the default), the widget only
6339 receives tablet move events when the stylus is in contact with
6340 the tablet, or at least one stylus button is pressed,
6341 while the stylus is being moved.
6342
6343 If tablet tracking is enabled, the widget receives tablet move
6344 events even while hovering in proximity. This is useful for
6345 monitoring position as well as the auxiliary properties such
6346 as rotation and tilt, and providing feedback in the UI.
6347
6348 \sa tabletEvent()
6349*/
6350
6351
6352/*!
6353 Sets the widget's focus proxy to widget \a w. If \a w is \nullptr, the
6354 function resets this widget to have no focus proxy.
6355
6356 Some widgets can "have focus", but create a child widget, such as
6357 QLineEdit, to actually handle the focus. In this case, the widget
6358 can set the line edit to be its focus proxy.
6359
6360 setFocusProxy() sets the widget which will actually get focus when
6361 "this widget" gets it. If there is a focus proxy, setFocus() and
6362 hasFocus() operate on the focus proxy. If "this widget" is the focus
6363 widget, then setFocusProxy() moves focus to the new focus proxy.
6364
6365 \sa focusProxy()
6366*/
6367
6368void QWidget::setFocusProxy(QWidget * w)
6369{
6370 Q_D(QWidget);
6371 if (!w && !d->extra)
6372 return;
6373
6374 for (QWidget* fp = w; fp; fp = fp->focusProxy()) {
6375 if (Q_UNLIKELY(fp == this)) {
6376 qWarning(msg: "QWidget: %s (%s) already in focus proxy chain", metaObject()->className(), objectName().toLocal8Bit().constData());
6377 return;
6378 }
6379 }
6380
6381 const bool moveFocusToProxy = (QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget == this);
6382
6383 d->createExtra();
6384 d->extra->focus_proxy = w;
6385
6386 if (w && isAncestorOf(child: w)) {
6387 // If the focus proxy is a child of this (so this is a compound widget), then
6388 // we need to make sure that this widget is immediately in front of its own children
6389 // in the focus chain. Otherwise focusNextPrev_helper might jump over unrelated
6390 // widgets that are positioned between this compound widget, and its proxy in
6391 // the focus chain.
6392 const QWidget *parentOfW = w->parentWidget();
6393 Q_ASSERT(parentOfW); // can't be nullptr since we are an ancestor of w
6394 QWidget *firstChild = nullptr;
6395 const auto childList = children();
6396 for (QObject *child : childList) {
6397 if ((firstChild = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: child)))
6398 break;
6399 }
6400 Q_ASSERT(firstChild); // can't be nullptr since w is a child
6401 QWidget *oldNext = d->focus_next;
6402 QWidget *oldPrev = d->focus_prev;
6403 oldNext->d_func()->focus_prev = oldPrev;
6404 oldPrev->d_func()->focus_next = oldNext;
6405
6406 oldPrev = firstChild->d_func()->focus_prev;
6407 d->focus_next = firstChild;
6408 d->focus_prev = oldPrev;
6409 oldPrev->d_func()->focus_next = this;
6410 firstChild->d_func()->focus_prev = this;
6411 }
6412
6413 if (moveFocusToProxy)
6414 setFocus(Qt::OtherFocusReason);
6415}
6416
6417
6418/*!
6419 Returns the focus proxy, or \nullptr if there is no focus proxy.
6420
6421 \sa setFocusProxy()
6422*/
6423
6424QWidget *QWidget::focusProxy() const
6425{
6426 Q_D(const QWidget);
6427 return d->extra ? d->extra->focus_proxy.data() : nullptr;
6428}
6429
6430
6431/*!
6432 \property QWidget::focus
6433 \brief whether this widget (or its focus proxy) has the keyboard
6434 input focus
6435
6436 By default, this property is \c false.
6437
6438 \note Obtaining the value of this property for a widget is effectively equivalent
6439 to checking whether QApplication::focusWidget() refers to the widget.
6440
6441 \sa setFocus(), clearFocus(), setFocusPolicy(), QApplication::focusWidget()
6442*/
6443bool QWidget::hasFocus() const
6444{
6445 const QWidget* w = this;
6446 while (w->d_func()->extra && w->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy)
6447 w = w->d_func()->extra->focus_proxy;
6448#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6449 if (QWidget *window = w->window()) {
6450 const auto &e = window->d_func()->extra;
6451 if (e && e->proxyWidget && e->proxyWidget->hasFocus() && window->focusWidget() == w)
6452 return true;
6453 }
6454#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6455 return (QApplication::focusWidget() == w);
6456}
6457
6458/*!
6459 Gives the keyboard input focus to this widget (or its focus
6460 proxy) if this widget or one of its parents is the \l{isActiveWindow()}{active window}. The \a reason argument will
6461 be passed into any focus event sent from this function, it is used
6462 to give an explanation of what caused the widget to get focus.
6463 If the window is not active, the widget will be given the focus when
6464 the window becomes active.
6465
6466 First, a focus about to change event is sent to the focus widget (if any) to
6467 tell it that it is about to lose the focus. Then focus is changed, a
6468 focus out event is sent to the previous focus item and a focus in event is sent
6469 to the new item to tell it that it just received the focus.
6470 (Nothing happens if the focus in and focus out widgets are the
6471 same.)
6472
6473 \note On embedded platforms, setFocus() will not cause an input panel
6474 to be opened by the input method. If you want this to happen, you
6475 have to send a QEvent::RequestSoftwareInputPanel event to the
6476 widget yourself.
6477
6478 setFocus() gives focus to a widget regardless of its focus policy,
6479 but does not clear any keyboard grab (see grabKeyboard()).
6480
6481 Be aware that if the widget is hidden, it will not accept focus
6482 until it is shown.
6483
6484 \warning If you call setFocus() in a function which may itself be
6485 called from focusOutEvent() or focusInEvent(), you may get an
6486 infinite recursion.
6487
6488 \sa hasFocus(), clearFocus(), focusInEvent(), focusOutEvent(),
6489 setFocusPolicy(), focusWidget(), QApplication::focusWidget(), grabKeyboard(),
6490 grabMouse(), {Keyboard Focus in Widgets}, QEvent::RequestSoftwareInputPanel
6491*/
6492
6493void QWidget::setFocus(Qt::FocusReason reason)
6494{
6495 if (!isEnabled())
6496 return;
6497
6498 QWidget *f = d_func()->deepestFocusProxy();
6499 if (!f)
6500 f = this;
6501
6502 if (QApplication::focusWidget() == f)
6503 return;
6504
6505#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6506 QWidget *previousProxyFocus = nullptr;
6507 if (const auto &topData = window()->d_func()->extra) {
6508 if (topData->proxyWidget && topData->proxyWidget->hasFocus()) {
6509 previousProxyFocus = topData->proxyWidget->widget()->focusWidget();
6510 if (previousProxyFocus && previousProxyFocus->focusProxy())
6511 previousProxyFocus = previousProxyFocus->focusProxy();
6512 if (previousProxyFocus == f && !topData->proxyWidget->d_func()->proxyIsGivingFocus)
6513 return;
6514 }
6515 }
6516#endif
6517
6518#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6519 // Update proxy state
6520 if (const auto &topData = window()->d_func()->extra) {
6521 if (topData->proxyWidget && !topData->proxyWidget->hasFocus()) {
6522 f->d_func()->updateFocusChild();
6523 topData->proxyWidget->d_func()->focusFromWidgetToProxy = 1;
6524 topData->proxyWidget->setFocus(reason);
6525 topData->proxyWidget->d_func()->focusFromWidgetToProxy = 0;
6526 }
6527 }
6528#endif
6529
6530 if (f->isActiveWindow()) {
6531 QWidget *prev = QApplicationPrivate::focus_widget;
6532 if (prev) {
6533 if (reason != Qt::PopupFocusReason && reason != Qt::MenuBarFocusReason
6534 && prev->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_InputMethodEnabled)) {
6535 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->commit();
6536 }
6537
6538 if (reason != Qt::NoFocusReason) {
6539 QFocusEvent focusAboutToChange(QEvent::FocusAboutToChange, reason);
6540 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: prev, event: &focusAboutToChange);
6541 }
6542 }
6543
6544 f->d_func()->updateFocusChild();
6545
6546 QApplicationPrivate::setFocusWidget(focus: f, reason);
6547#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
6548 // menus update the focus manually and this would create bogus events
6549 if (!(f->inherits(classname: "QMenuBar") || f->inherits(classname: "QMenu") || f->inherits(classname: "QMenuItem")))
6550 {
6551 QAccessibleEvent event(f, QAccessible::Focus);
6552 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
6553 }
6554#endif
6555#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6556 if (const auto &topData = window()->d_func()->extra) {
6557 if (topData->proxyWidget) {
6558 if (previousProxyFocus && previousProxyFocus != f) {
6559 // Send event to self
6560 QFocusEvent event(QEvent::FocusOut, reason);
6561 QPointer<QWidget> that = previousProxyFocus;
6562 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: previousProxyFocus, event: &event);
6563 if (that)
6564 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: that->style(), event: &event);
6565 }
6566 if (!isHidden()) {
6567#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6568 // Update proxy state
6569 if (const auto &topData = window()->d_func()->extra)
6570 if (topData->proxyWidget && topData->proxyWidget->hasFocus())
6571 topData->proxyWidget->d_func()->updateProxyInputMethodAcceptanceFromWidget();
6572#endif
6573 // Send event to self
6574 QFocusEvent event(QEvent::FocusIn, reason);
6575 QPointer<QWidget> that = f;
6576 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: f, event: &event);
6577 if (that)
6578 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: that->style(), event: &event);
6579 }
6580 }
6581 }
6582#endif
6583 } else {
6584 f->d_func()->updateFocusChild();
6585 }
6586}
6587
6588
6589/*!\internal
6590 * A focus proxy can have its own focus proxy, which can have its own
6591 * proxy, and so on. This helper function returns the widget that sits
6592 * at the bottom of the proxy chain, and therefore the one that should
6593 * normally get focus if this widget receives a focus request.
6594 */
6595QWidget *QWidgetPrivate::deepestFocusProxy() const
6596{
6597 Q_Q(const QWidget);
6598
6599 QWidget *focusProxy = q->focusProxy();
6600 if (!focusProxy)
6601 return nullptr;
6602
6603 while (QWidget *nextFocusProxy = focusProxy->focusProxy())
6604 focusProxy = nextFocusProxy;
6605
6606 return focusProxy;
6607}
6608
6609static inline bool isEmbedded(const QWindow *w)
6610{
6611 const auto platformWindow = w->handle();
6612 return platformWindow && platformWindow->isEmbedded();
6613}
6614
6615void QWidgetPrivate::setFocus_sys()
6616{
6617 Q_Q(QWidget);
6618 // Embedded native widget may have taken the focus; get it back to toplevel
6619 // if that is the case (QTBUG-25852)
6620 // Do not activate in case the popup menu opens another application (QTBUG-70810)
6621 // unless the application is embedded (QTBUG-71991).
6622 if (QWindow *nativeWindow = q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created) ? q->window()->windowHandle() : nullptr) {
6623 if (nativeWindow->type() != Qt::Popup && nativeWindow != QGuiApplication::focusWindow()
6624 && (QGuiApplication::applicationState() == Qt::ApplicationActive
6625 || QCoreApplication::testAttribute(attribute: Qt::AA_PluginApplication)
6626 || isEmbedded(w: nativeWindow))) {
6627 nativeWindow->requestActivate();
6628 }
6629 }
6630}
6631
6632// updates focus_child on parent widgets to point into this widget
6633void QWidgetPrivate::updateFocusChild()
6634{
6635 Q_Q(QWidget);
6636
6637 QWidget *w = q;
6638 if (q->isHidden()) {
6639 while (w && w->isHidden()) {
6640 w->d_func()->focus_child = q;
6641 w = w->isWindow() ? nullptr : w->parentWidget();
6642 }
6643 } else {
6644 while (w) {
6645 w->d_func()->focus_child = q;
6646 w = w->isWindow() ? nullptr : w->parentWidget();
6647 }
6648 }
6649
6650 if (QTLWExtra *extra = q->window()->d_func()->maybeTopData()) {
6651 if (extra->window)
6652 emit extra->window->focusObjectChanged(object: q);
6653 }
6654}
6655
6656/*!
6657 \fn void QWidget::setFocus()
6658 \overload
6659
6660 Gives the keyboard input focus to this widget (or its focus
6661 proxy) if this widget or one of its parents is the
6662 \l{isActiveWindow()}{active window}.
6663*/
6664
6665/*!
6666 Takes keyboard input focus from the widget.
6667
6668 If the widget has active focus, a \l{focusOutEvent()}{focus out event} is sent to this widget to tell it that it has
6669 lost the focus.
6670
6671 This widget must enable focus setting in order to get the keyboard
6672 input focus, i.e. it must call setFocusPolicy().
6673
6674 \sa hasFocus(), setFocus(), focusInEvent(), focusOutEvent(),
6675 setFocusPolicy(), QApplication::focusWidget()
6676*/
6677
6678void QWidget::clearFocus()
6679{
6680 if (hasFocus()) {
6681 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_InputMethodEnabled))
6682 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->commit();
6683
6684 QFocusEvent focusAboutToChange(QEvent::FocusAboutToChange);
6685 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &focusAboutToChange);
6686 }
6687
6688 QTLWExtra *extra = window()->d_func()->maybeTopData();
6689 QObject *originalFocusObject = nullptr;
6690 if (extra && extra->window) {
6691 originalFocusObject = extra->window->focusObject();
6692 // the window's focus object might already be nullptr if we are in the destructor, but we still
6693 // need to update QGuiApplication and input context if we have a focus widget.
6694 if (!originalFocusObject)
6695 originalFocusObject = focusWidget();
6696 }
6697
6698 QWidget *w = this;
6699 while (w) {
6700 // Just like setFocus(), we update (clear) the focus_child of our parents
6701 if (w->d_func()->focus_child == this)
6702 w->d_func()->focus_child = nullptr;
6703 w = w->parentWidget();
6704 }
6705
6706 // We've potentially cleared the focus_child of our parents, so we need
6707 // to report this to the rest of Qt. Note that the focus_child is not the same
6708 // thing as the application's focusWidget, which is why this piece of code is
6709 // not inside a hasFocus() block.
6710 if (originalFocusObject && originalFocusObject != extra->window->focusObject())
6711 emit extra->window->focusObjectChanged(object: extra->window->focusObject());
6712
6713#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6714 const auto &topData = d_func()->extra;
6715 if (topData && topData->proxyWidget)
6716 topData->proxyWidget->clearFocus();
6717#endif
6718
6719 if (hasFocus()) {
6720 // Update proxy state
6721 QApplicationPrivate::setFocusWidget(focus: nullptr, reason: Qt::OtherFocusReason);
6722#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
6723 QAccessibleEvent event(this, QAccessible::Focus);
6724 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
6725#endif
6726 }
6727}
6728
6729
6730/*!
6731 \fn bool QWidget::focusNextChild()
6732
6733 Finds a new widget to give the keyboard focus to, as appropriate
6734 for \uicontrol Tab, and returns \c true if it can find a new widget, or
6735 false if it can't.
6736
6737 \sa focusPreviousChild()
6738*/
6739
6740/*!
6741 \fn bool QWidget::focusPreviousChild()
6742
6743 Finds a new widget to give the keyboard focus to, as appropriate
6744 for \uicontrol Shift+Tab, and returns \c true if it can find a new widget,
6745 or false if it can't.
6746
6747 \sa focusNextChild()
6748*/
6749
6750/*!
6751 Finds a new widget to give the keyboard focus to, as appropriate
6752 for Tab and Shift+Tab, and returns \c true if it can find a new
6753 widget, or false if it can't.
6754
6755 If \a next is true, this function searches forward, if \a next
6756 is false, it searches backward.
6757
6758 Sometimes, you will want to reimplement this function. For
6759 example, a web browser might reimplement it to move its "current
6760 active link" forward or backward, and call
6761 focusNextPrevChild() only when it reaches the last or
6762 first link on the "page".
6763
6764 Child widgets call focusNextPrevChild() on their parent widgets,
6765 but only the window that contains the child widgets decides where
6766 to redirect focus. By reimplementing this function for an object,
6767 you thus gain control of focus traversal for all child widgets.
6768
6769 \sa focusNextChild(), focusPreviousChild()
6770*/
6771
6772bool QWidget::focusNextPrevChild(bool next)
6773{
6774 QWidget* p = parentWidget();
6775 bool isSubWindow = (windowType() == Qt::SubWindow);
6776 if (!isWindow() && !isSubWindow && p)
6777 return p->focusNextPrevChild(next);
6778#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6779 Q_D(QWidget);
6780 if (d->extra && d->extra->proxyWidget)
6781 return d->extra->proxyWidget->focusNextPrevChild(next);
6782#endif
6783
6784 bool wrappingOccurred = false;
6785 QWidget *w = QApplicationPrivate::focusNextPrevChild_helper(toplevel: this, next,
6786 wrappingOccurred: &wrappingOccurred);
6787 if (!w) return false;
6788
6789 Qt::FocusReason reason = next ? Qt::TabFocusReason : Qt::BacktabFocusReason;
6790
6791 /* If we are about to wrap the focus chain, give the platform
6792 * implementation a chance to alter the wrapping behavior. This is
6793 * especially needed when the window is embedded in a window created by
6794 * another process.
6795 */
6796 if (wrappingOccurred) {
6797 QWindow *window = windowHandle();
6798 if (window != nullptr) {
6799 QWindowPrivate *winp = qt_window_private(window);
6800
6801 if (winp->platformWindow != nullptr) {
6802 QFocusEvent event(QEvent::FocusIn, reason);
6803 event.ignore();
6804 winp->platformWindow->windowEvent(event: &event);
6805 if (event.isAccepted()) return true;
6806 }
6807 }
6808 }
6809
6810 w->setFocus(reason);
6811 return true;
6812}
6813
6814/*!
6815 Returns the last child of this widget that setFocus had been
6816 called on. For top level widgets this is the widget that will get
6817 focus in case this window gets activated
6818
6819 This is not the same as QApplication::focusWidget(), which returns
6820 the focus widget in the currently active window.
6821*/
6822
6823QWidget *QWidget::focusWidget() const
6824{
6825 return const_cast<QWidget *>(d_func()->focus_child);
6826}
6827
6828/*!
6829 Returns the next widget in this widget's focus chain.
6830
6831 \sa previousInFocusChain()
6832*/
6833QWidget *QWidget::nextInFocusChain() const
6834{
6835 return const_cast<QWidget *>(d_func()->focus_next);
6836}
6837
6838/*!
6839 \brief The previousInFocusChain function returns the previous
6840 widget in this widget's focus chain.
6841
6842 \sa nextInFocusChain()
6843
6844 \since 4.6
6845*/
6846QWidget *QWidget::previousInFocusChain() const
6847{
6848 return const_cast<QWidget *>(d_func()->focus_prev);
6849}
6850
6851/*!
6852 \property QWidget::isActiveWindow
6853 \brief whether this widget's window is the active window
6854
6855 The active window is the window that contains the widget that has
6856 keyboard focus (The window may still have focus if it has no
6857 widgets or none of its widgets accepts keyboard focus).
6858
6859 When popup windows are visible, this property is \c true for both the
6860 active window \e and for the popup.
6861
6862 By default, this property is \c false.
6863
6864 \sa activateWindow(), QApplication::activeWindow()
6865*/
6866bool QWidget::isActiveWindow() const
6867{
6868 QWidget *tlw = window();
6869 if (tlw == QApplication::activeWindow() || (isVisible() && (tlw->windowType() == Qt::Popup)))
6870 return true;
6871
6872#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
6873 if (const auto &tlwExtra = tlw->d_func()->extra) {
6874 if (isVisible() && tlwExtra->proxyWidget)
6875 return tlwExtra->proxyWidget->isActiveWindow();
6876 }
6877#endif
6878
6879 if (style()->styleHint(stylehint: QStyle::SH_Widget_ShareActivation, opt: nullptr, widget: this)) {
6880 if (tlw->windowType() == Qt::Tool &&
6881 !tlw->isModal() &&
6882 (!tlw->parentWidget() || tlw->parentWidget()->isActiveWindow()))
6883 return true;
6884 QWidget *w = QApplication::activeWindow();
6885 while(w && tlw->windowType() == Qt::Tool &&
6886 !w->isModal() && w->parentWidget()) {
6887 w = w->parentWidget()->window();
6888 if (w == tlw)
6889 return true;
6890 }
6891 }
6892
6893 // Check for an active window container
6894 if (QWindow *ww = QGuiApplication::focusWindow()) {
6895 while (ww) {
6896 QWidgetWindow *qww = qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: ww);
6897 QWindowContainer *qwc = qww ? qobject_cast<QWindowContainer *>(object: qww->widget()) : 0;
6898 if (qwc && qwc->topLevelWidget() == tlw)
6899 return true;
6900 ww = ww->parent();
6901 }
6902 }
6903
6904 // Check if platform adaptation thinks the window is active. This is necessary for
6905 // example in case of ActiveQt servers that are embedded into another application.
6906 // Those are separate processes that are not part of the parent application Qt window/widget
6907 // hierarchy, so they need to rely on native methods to determine if they are part of the
6908 // active window.
6909 if (const QWindow *w = tlw->windowHandle()) {
6910 if (w->handle())
6911 return w->handle()->isActive();
6912 }
6913
6914 return false;
6915}
6916
6917/*!
6918 Puts the \a second widget after the \a first widget in the focus order.
6919
6920 It effectively removes the \a second widget from its focus chain and
6921 inserts it after the \a first widget.
6922
6923 Note that since the tab order of the \a second widget is changed, you
6924 should order a chain like this:
6925
6926 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 9
6927
6928 \e not like this:
6929
6930 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 10
6931
6932 If \a first or \a second has a focus proxy, setTabOrder()
6933 correctly substitutes the proxy.
6934
6935 \note Since Qt 5.10: A widget that has a child as focus proxy is understood as
6936 a compound widget. When setting a tab order between one or two compound widgets, the
6937 local tab order inside each will be preserved. This means that if both widgets are
6938 compound widgets, the resulting tab order will be from the last child inside
6939 \a first, to the first child inside \a second.
6940
6941 \sa setFocusPolicy(), setFocusProxy(), {Keyboard Focus in Widgets}
6942*/
6943void QWidget::setTabOrder(QWidget* first, QWidget *second)
6944{
6945 if (!first || !second || first == second
6946 || first->focusPolicy() == Qt::NoFocus
6947 || second->focusPolicy() == Qt::NoFocus)
6948 return;
6949
6950 if (Q_UNLIKELY(first->window() != second->window())) {
6951 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::setTabOrder: 'first' and 'second' must be in the same window");
6952 return;
6953 }
6954
6955 auto determineLastFocusChild = [](QWidget *target, QWidget *&lastFocusChild)
6956 {
6957 // Since we need to repeat the same logic for both 'first' and 'second', we add a function that
6958 // determines the last focus child for a widget, taking proxies and compound widgets into account.
6959 // If the target is not a compound widget (it doesn't have a focus proxy that points to a child),
6960 // 'lastFocusChild' will be set to the target itself.
6961 lastFocusChild = target;
6962
6963 QWidget *focusProxy = target->d_func()->deepestFocusProxy();
6964 if (!focusProxy || !target->isAncestorOf(child: focusProxy)) {
6965 // QTBUG-81097: Another case is possible here. We can have a child
6966 // widget, that sets its focusProxy() to the parent (target).
6967 // An example of such widget is a QLineEdit, nested into
6968 // a QAbstractSpinBox. In this case such widget should be considered
6969 // the last focus child.
6970 for (auto *object : target->children()) {
6971 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: object);
6972 if (w && w->focusProxy() == target) {
6973 lastFocusChild = w;
6974 break;
6975 }
6976 }
6977 return;
6978 }
6979
6980 lastFocusChild = focusProxy;
6981
6982 for (QWidget *focusNext = lastFocusChild->d_func()->focus_next;
6983 focusNext != focusProxy && target->isAncestorOf(child: focusNext) && focusNext->window() == focusProxy->window();
6984 focusNext = focusNext->d_func()->focus_next) {
6985 if (focusNext->focusPolicy() != Qt::NoFocus)
6986 lastFocusChild = focusNext;
6987 }
6988 };
6989 auto setPrev = [](QWidget *w, QWidget *prev)
6990 {
6991 w->d_func()->focus_prev = prev;
6992 };
6993 auto setNext = [](QWidget *w, QWidget *next)
6994 {
6995 w->d_func()->focus_next = next;
6996 };
6997
6998 // remove the second widget from the chain
6999 QWidget *lastFocusChildOfSecond;
7000 determineLastFocusChild(second, lastFocusChildOfSecond);
7001 {
7002 QWidget *oldPrev = second->d_func()->focus_prev;
7003 QWidget *prevWithFocus = oldPrev;
7004 while (prevWithFocus->focusPolicy() == Qt::NoFocus)
7005 prevWithFocus = prevWithFocus->d_func()->focus_prev;
7006 // only widgets between first and second -> all is fine
7007 if (prevWithFocus == first)
7008 return;
7009 QWidget *oldNext = lastFocusChildOfSecond->d_func()->focus_next;
7010 setPrev(oldNext, oldPrev);
7011 setNext(oldPrev, oldNext);
7012 }
7013
7014 // insert the second widget into the chain
7015 QWidget *lastFocusChildOfFirst;
7016 determineLastFocusChild(first, lastFocusChildOfFirst);
7017 {
7018 QWidget *oldNext = lastFocusChildOfFirst->d_func()->focus_next;
7019 setPrev(second, lastFocusChildOfFirst);
7020 setNext(lastFocusChildOfFirst, second);
7021 setPrev(oldNext, lastFocusChildOfSecond);
7022 setNext(lastFocusChildOfSecond, oldNext);
7023 }
7024}
7025
7026/*!\internal
7027
7028 Moves the relevant subwidgets of this widget from the \a oldtlw's
7029 tab chain to that of the new parent, if there's anything to move and
7030 we're really moving
7031
7032 This function is called from QWidget::reparent() *after* the widget
7033 has been reparented.
7034
7035 \sa reparent()
7036*/
7037
7038void QWidgetPrivate::reparentFocusWidgets(QWidget * oldtlw)
7039{
7040 Q_Q(QWidget);
7041 if (oldtlw == q->window())
7042 return; // nothing to do
7043
7044 if (focus_child)
7045 focus_child->clearFocus();
7046
7047 // separate the focus chain into new (children of myself) and old (the rest)
7048 QWidget *firstOld = nullptr;
7049 //QWidget *firstNew = q; //invariant
7050 QWidget *o = nullptr; // last in the old list
7051 QWidget *n = q; // last in the new list
7052
7053 bool prevWasNew = true;
7054 QWidget *w = focus_next;
7055
7056 //Note: for efficiency, we do not maintain the list invariant inside the loop
7057 //we append items to the relevant list, and we optimize by not changing pointers
7058 //when subsequent items are going into the same list.
7059 while (w != q) {
7060 bool currentIsNew = q->isAncestorOf(child: w);
7061 if (currentIsNew) {
7062 if (!prevWasNew) {
7063 //prev was old -- append to new list
7064 n->d_func()->focus_next = w;
7065 w->d_func()->focus_prev = n;
7066 }
7067 n = w;
7068 } else {
7069 if (prevWasNew) {
7070 //prev was new -- append to old list, if there is one
7071 if (o) {
7072 o->d_func()->focus_next = w;
7073 w->d_func()->focus_prev = o;
7074 } else {
7075 // "create" the old list
7076 firstOld = w;
7077 }
7078 }
7079 o = w;
7080 }
7081 w = w->d_func()->focus_next;
7082 prevWasNew = currentIsNew;
7083 }
7084
7085 //repair the old list:
7086 if (firstOld) {
7087 o->d_func()->focus_next = firstOld;
7088 firstOld->d_func()->focus_prev = o;
7089 }
7090
7091 if (!q->isWindow()) {
7092 QWidget *topLevel = q->window();
7093 //insert new chain into toplevel's chain
7094
7095 QWidget *prev = topLevel->d_func()->focus_prev;
7096
7097 topLevel->d_func()->focus_prev = n;
7098 prev->d_func()->focus_next = q;
7099
7100 focus_prev = prev;
7101 n->d_func()->focus_next = topLevel;
7102 } else {
7103 //repair the new list
