7104 n->d_func()->focus_next = q;
7105 focus_prev = n;
7106 }
7107
7108}
7109
7110/*!
7111 \property QWidget::frameSize
7112 \brief the size of the widget including any window frame
7113
7114 By default, this property contains a value that depends on the user's
7115 platform and screen geometry.
7116*/
7117QSize QWidget::frameSize() const
7118{
7119 Q_D(const QWidget);
7120 if (isWindow() && !(windowType() == Qt::Popup)) {
7121 QRect fs = d->frameStrut();
7122 return QSize(data->crect.width() + fs.left() + fs.right(),
7123 data->crect.height() + fs.top() + fs.bottom());
7124 }
7125 return data->crect.size();
7126}
7127
7128/*! \fn void QWidget::move(int x, int y)
7129
7130 \overload
7131
7132 This corresponds to move(QPoint(\a x, \a y)).
7133*/
7134
7135void QWidget::move(const QPoint &p)
7136{
7137 Q_D(QWidget);
7138 setAttribute(Qt::WA_Moved);
7139 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)) {
7140 if (isWindow())
7141 d->topData()->posIncludesFrame = false;
7142 d->setGeometry_sys(p.x() + geometry().x() - QWidget::x(),
7143 p.y() + geometry().y() - QWidget::y(),
7144 width(), height(), true);
7145 d->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
7146 } else {
7147 // no frame yet: see also QWidgetPrivate::fixPosIncludesFrame(), QWindowPrivate::PositionPolicy.
7148 if (isWindow())
7149 d->topData()->posIncludesFrame = true;
7150 data->crect.moveTopLeft(p); // no frame yet
7151 setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingMoveEvent);
7152 }
7153
7154 if (d->extra && d->extra->hasWindowContainer)
7155 QWindowContainer::parentWasMoved(parent: this);
7156}
7157
7158// move() was invoked with Qt::WA_WState_Created not set (frame geometry
7159// unknown), that is, crect has a position including the frame.
7160// If we can determine the frame strut, fix that and clear the flag.
7161// FIXME: This does not play well with window states other than
7162// Qt::WindowNoState, as we depend on calling setGeometry() on the
7163// platform window after fixing up the position so that the new
7164// geometry is reflected in the platform window, but when the frame
7165// comes in after the window has been shown (e.g. maximized), we're
7166// not in a position to do that kind of fixup.
7167void QWidgetPrivate::fixPosIncludesFrame()
7168{
7169 Q_Q(QWidget);
7170 if (QTLWExtra *te = maybeTopData()) {
7171 if (te->posIncludesFrame) {
7172 // For Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen, assume a frame of 0 (for
7173 // example, in QGraphicsProxyWidget).
7174 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
7175 te->posIncludesFrame = 0;
7176 } else {
7177 if (q->windowHandle() && q->windowHandle()->handle()) {
7178 updateFrameStrut();
7179 if (!q->data->fstrut_dirty) {
7180 data.crect.translate(dx: te->frameStrut.x(), dy: te->frameStrut.y());
7181 te->posIncludesFrame = 0;
7182 }
7183 } // windowHandle()
7184 } // !WA_DontShowOnScreen
7185 } // posIncludesFrame
7186 } // QTLWExtra
7187}
7188
7189/*! \fn void QWidget::resize(int w, int h)
7190 \overload
7191
7192 This corresponds to resize(QSize(\a w, \a h)).
7193*/
7194
7195void QWidget::resize(const QSize &s)
7196{
7197 Q_D(QWidget);
7198 setAttribute(Qt::WA_Resized);
7199 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)) {
7200 d->fixPosIncludesFrame();
7201 d->setGeometry_sys(geometry().x(), geometry().y(), s.width(), s.height(), false);
7202 d->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
7203 } else {
7204 const auto oldRect = data->crect;
7205 data->crect.setSize(s.boundedTo(otherSize: maximumSize()).expandedTo(otherSize: minimumSize()));
7206 if (oldRect != data->crect)
7207 setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent);
7208 }
7209}
7210
7211void QWidget::setGeometry(const QRect &r)
7212{
7213 Q_D(QWidget);
7214 setAttribute(Qt::WA_Resized);
7215 setAttribute(Qt::WA_Moved);
7216 if (isWindow())
7217 d->topData()->posIncludesFrame = 0;
7218 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)) {
7219 d->setGeometry_sys(r.x(), r.y(), r.width(), r.height(), true);
7220 d->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
7221 } else {
7222 const auto oldRect = data->crect;
7223 data->crect.setTopLeft(r.topLeft());
7224 data->crect.setSize(r.size().boundedTo(otherSize: maximumSize()).expandedTo(otherSize: minimumSize()));
7225 if (oldRect != data->crect) {
7226 setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingMoveEvent);
7227 setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent);
7228 }
7229 }
7230
7231 if (d->extra && d->extra->hasWindowContainer)
7232 QWindowContainer::parentWasMoved(parent: this);
7233}
7234
7235void QWidgetPrivate::setGeometry_sys(int x, int y, int w, int h, bool isMove)
7236{
7237 Q_Q(QWidget);
7238 if (extra) { // any size restrictions?
7239 w = qMin(a: w,b: extra->maxw);
7240 h = qMin(a: h,b: extra->maxh);
7241 w = qMax(a: w,b: extra->minw);
7242 h = qMax(a: h,b: extra->minh);
7243 }
7244
7245 if (q->isWindow() && q->windowHandle()) {
7246 QPlatformIntegration *integration = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformIntegration();
7247 if (!integration->hasCapability(cap: QPlatformIntegration::NonFullScreenWindows)) {
7248 x = 0;
7249 y = 0;
7250 w = q->windowHandle()->width();
7251 h = q->windowHandle()->height();
7252 }
7253 }
7254
7255 QPoint oldp = q->geometry().topLeft();
7256 QSize olds = q->size();
7257 QRect r(x, y, w, h);
7258
7259 bool isResize = olds != r.size();
7260 if (!isMove)
7261 isMove = oldp != r.topLeft();
7262
7263
7264 // We only care about stuff that changes the geometry, or may
7265 // cause the window manager to change its state
7266 if (r.size() == olds && oldp == r.topLeft())
7267 return;
7268
7269 if (!data.in_set_window_state) {
7270 q->data->window_state &= ~Qt::WindowMaximized;
7271 q->data->window_state &= ~Qt::WindowFullScreen;
7272 if (q->isWindow())
7273 topData()->normalGeometry = QRect(0, 0, -1, -1);
7274 }
7275
7276 QPoint oldPos = q->pos();
7277 data.crect = r;
7278
7279 bool needsShow = false;
7280
7281 if (q->isWindow() || q->windowHandle()) {
7282 if (!(data.window_state & Qt::WindowFullScreen) && (w == 0 || h == 0)) {
7283 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_OutsideWSRange, on: true);
7284 if (q->isVisible())
7285 hide_sys();
7286 data.crect = QRect(x, y, w, h);
7287 } else if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_OutsideWSRange)) {
7288 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_OutsideWSRange, on: false);
7289 needsShow = true;
7290 }
7291 }
7292
7293 if (q->isVisible()) {
7294 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen) && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_OutsideWSRange)) {
7295 if (QWindow *win = q->windowHandle()) {
7296 if (q->isWindow()) {
7297 if (isResize && !isMove)
7298 win->resize(w, h);
7299 else if (isMove && !isResize)
7300 win->setPosition(posx: x, posy: y);
7301 else
7302 win->setGeometry(q->geometry());
7303 } else {
7304 QPoint posInNativeParent = q->mapTo(parent: q->nativeParentWidget(),pos: QPoint());
7305 win->setGeometry(QRect(posInNativeParent,r.size()));
7306 }
7307
7308 if (needsShow)
7309 show_sys();
7310 }
7311
7312 if (!q->isWindow()) {
7313 if (renderToTexture) {
7314 QRegion updateRegion(q->geometry());
7315 updateRegion += QRect(oldPos, olds);
7316 q->parentWidget()->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(updateRegion);
7317 } else if (isMove && !isResize) {
7318 moveRect(QRect(oldPos, olds), dx: x - oldPos.x(), dy: y - oldPos.y());
7319 } else {
7320 invalidateBackingStore_resizeHelper(oldPos, oldSize: olds);
7321 }
7322 }
7323 }
7324
7325 if (isMove) {
7326 QMoveEvent e(q->pos(), oldPos);
7327 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7328 }
7329 if (isResize) {
7330 QResizeEvent e(r.size(), olds);
7331 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7332 if (q->windowHandle())
7333 q->update();
7334 }
7335 } else { // not visible
7336 if (isMove && q->pos() != oldPos)
7337 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingMoveEvent, on: true);
7338 if (isResize)
7339 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent, on: true);
7340 }
7341
7342}
7343
7344/*!
7345 \since 4.2
7346 Saves the current geometry and state for top-level widgets.
7347
7348 To save the geometry when the window closes, you can
7349 implement a close event like this:
7350
7351 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 11
7352
7353 See the \l{Window Geometry} documentation for an overview of geometry
7354 issues with windows.
7355
7356 Use QMainWindow::saveState() to save the geometry and the state of
7357 toolbars and dock widgets.
7358
7359 \sa restoreGeometry(), QMainWindow::saveState(), QMainWindow::restoreState()
7360*/
7361QByteArray QWidget::saveGeometry() const
7362{
7363 QByteArray array;
7364 QDataStream stream(&array, QIODevice::WriteOnly);
7365 stream.setVersion(QDataStream::Qt_4_0);
7366 const quint32 magicNumber = 0x1D9D0CB;
7367 // Version history:
7368 // - Qt 4.2 - 4.8.6, 5.0 - 5.3 : Version 1.0
7369 // - Qt 4.8.6 - today, 5.4 - today: Version 2.0, save screen width in addition to check for high DPI scaling.
7370 // - Qt 5.12 - today : Version 3.0, save QWidget::geometry()
7371 quint16 majorVersion = 3;
7372 quint16 minorVersion = 0;
7373 const int screenNumber = QGuiApplication::screens().indexOf(t: screen());
7374 stream << magicNumber
7375 << majorVersion
7376 << minorVersion
7377 << frameGeometry()
7378 << normalGeometry()
7379 << qint32(screenNumber)
7380 << quint8(windowState() & Qt::WindowMaximized)
7381 << quint8(windowState() & Qt::WindowFullScreen)
7382 << qint32(screen()->geometry().width()) // added in 2.0
7383 << geometry(); // added in 3.0
7384 return array;
7385}
7386
7387/*!
7388 \internal
7389
7390 Check a if \a restoredGeometry fits into \a availableGeometry
7391 This method is used to verify that a widget is restored to a geometry, which
7392 fits into the target screen.
7393
7394 \param frameHeight represents the height of the widget's title bar, which is expected
7395 to be on its top.
7396
7397 If the size of \a restoredGeometry exceeds \a availableGeometry, its height and width
7398 will be resized to be two pixels smaller than \a availableGeometry. An exact match would
7399 be full screen.
7400
7401 If at least one edge of \a restoredGeometry is outside \a availableGeometry,
7402 \a restoredGeometry will be moved
7403 \list
7404 \li down if its top is off screen
7405 \li up if its bottom is off screen
7406 \li right if its left edge is off screen
7407 \li left if its right edge is off screen
7408 \endlist
7409 */
7410void QWidgetPrivate::checkRestoredGeometry(const QRect &availableGeometry, QRect *restoredGeometry,
7411 int frameHeight)
7412{
7413 // compare with restored geometry's height increased by frameHeight
7414 const int height = restoredGeometry->height() + frameHeight;
7415
7416 // Step 1: Resize if necessary:
7417 // make height / width 2px smaller than screen, because an exact match would be fullscreen
7418 if (availableGeometry.height() <= height)
7419 restoredGeometry->setHeight(availableGeometry.height() - 2 - frameHeight);
7420 if (availableGeometry.width() <= restoredGeometry->width())
7421 restoredGeometry->setWidth(availableGeometry.width() - 2);
7422
7423 // Step 2: Move if necessary:
7424 // Construct a rectangle from restored Geometry adjusted by frameHeight
7425 const QRect restored = restoredGeometry->adjusted(xp1: 0, yp1: -frameHeight, xp2: 0, yp2: 0);
7426
7427 // Return if restoredGeometry (including frame) fits into screen
7428 if (availableGeometry.contains(r: restored))
7429 return;
7430
7431 // (size is correct, but at least one edge is off screen)
7432
7433 // Top out of bounds => move down
7434 if (restored.top() <= availableGeometry.top()) {
7435 restoredGeometry->moveTop(pos: availableGeometry.top() + 1 + frameHeight);
7436 } else if (restored.bottom() >= availableGeometry.bottom()) {
7437 // Bottom out of bounds => move up
7438 restoredGeometry->moveBottom(pos: availableGeometry.bottom() - 1);
7439 }
7440
7441 // Left edge out of bounds => move right
7442 if (restored.left() <= availableGeometry.left()) {
7443 restoredGeometry->moveLeft(pos: availableGeometry.left() + 1);
7444 } else if (restored.right() >= availableGeometry.right()) {
7445 // Right edge out of bounds => move left
7446 restoredGeometry->moveRight(pos: availableGeometry.right() - 1);
7447 }
7448}
7449
7450/*!
7451 \since 4.2
7452
7453 Restores the geometry and state of top-level widgets stored in the
7454 byte array \a geometry. Returns \c true on success; otherwise
7455 returns \c false.
7456
7457 If the restored geometry is off-screen, it will be modified to be
7458 inside the available screen geometry.
7459
7460 To restore geometry saved using QSettings, you can use code like
7461 this:
7462
7463 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 12
7464
7465 See the \l{Window Geometry} documentation for an overview of geometry
7466 issues with windows.
7467
7468 Use QMainWindow::restoreState() to restore the geometry and the
7469 state of toolbars and dock widgets.
7470
7471 \sa saveGeometry(), QSettings, QMainWindow::saveState(), QMainWindow::restoreState()
7472*/
7473bool QWidget::restoreGeometry(const QByteArray &geometry)
7474{
7475 if (geometry.size() < 4)
7476 return false;
7477 QDataStream stream(geometry);
7478 stream.setVersion(QDataStream::Qt_4_0);
7479
7480 const quint32 magicNumber = 0x1D9D0CB;
7481 quint32 storedMagicNumber;
7482 stream >> storedMagicNumber;
7483 if (storedMagicNumber != magicNumber)
7484 return false;
7485
7486 const quint16 currentMajorVersion = 3;
7487 quint16 majorVersion = 0;
7488 quint16 minorVersion = 0;
7489
7490 stream >> majorVersion >> minorVersion;
7491
7492 if (majorVersion > currentMajorVersion)
7493 return false;
7494 // (Allow all minor versions.)
7495
7496 QRect restoredFrameGeometry;
7497 QRect restoredGeometry;
7498 QRect restoredNormalGeometry;
7499 qint32 restoredScreenNumber;
7500 quint8 maximized;
7501 quint8 fullScreen;
7502 qint32 restoredScreenWidth = 0;
7503
7504 stream >> restoredFrameGeometry // Only used for sanity checks in version 0
7505 >> restoredNormalGeometry
7506 >> restoredScreenNumber
7507 >> maximized
7508 >> fullScreen;
7509
7510 if (majorVersion > 1)
7511 stream >> restoredScreenWidth;
7512 if (majorVersion > 2)
7513 stream >> restoredGeometry;
7514
7515 // ### Qt 6 - Perhaps it makes sense to dumb down the restoreGeometry() logic, see QTBUG-69104
7516
7517 if (restoredScreenNumber >= qMax(a: QGuiApplication::screens().size(), b: 1))
7518 restoredScreenNumber = 0;
7519 const QScreen *restoredScreen = QGuiApplication::screens().value(i: restoredScreenNumber, defaultValue: nullptr);
7520 const qreal screenWidthF = restoredScreen ? qreal(restoredScreen->geometry().width()) : 0;
7521 // Sanity check bailing out when large variations of screen sizes occur due to
7522 // high DPI scaling or different levels of DPI awareness.
7523 if (restoredScreenWidth) {
7524 const qreal factor = qreal(restoredScreenWidth) / screenWidthF;
7525 if (factor < 0.8 || factor > 1.25)
7526 return false;
7527 } else {
7528 // Saved by Qt 5.3 and earlier, try to prevent too large windows
7529 // unless the size will be adapted by maximized or fullscreen.
7530 if (!maximized && !fullScreen && qreal(restoredFrameGeometry.width()) / screenWidthF > 1.5)
7531 return false;
7532 }
7533
7534 const int frameHeight = QApplication::style()
7535 ? QApplication::style()->pixelMetric(metric: QStyle::PM_TitleBarHeight)
7536 : 20;
7537
7538 if (!restoredNormalGeometry.isValid())
7539 restoredNormalGeometry = QRect(QPoint(0, frameHeight), sizeHint());
7540 if (!restoredNormalGeometry.isValid()) {
7541 // use the widget's adjustedSize if the sizeHint() doesn't help
7542 restoredNormalGeometry.setSize(restoredNormalGeometry
7543 .size()
7544 .expandedTo(otherSize: d_func()->adjustedSize()));
7545 }
7546
7547 const QRect availableGeometry = restoredScreen ? restoredScreen->availableGeometry()
7548 : QRect();
7549
7550 // Modify the restored geometry if we are about to restore to coordinates
7551 // that would make the window "lost". This happens if:
7552 // - The restored geometry is completely or partly oustside the available geometry
7553 // - The title bar is outside the available geometry.
7554
7555 QWidgetPrivate::checkRestoredGeometry(availableGeometry, restoredGeometry: &restoredGeometry, frameHeight);
7556 QWidgetPrivate::checkRestoredGeometry(availableGeometry, restoredGeometry: &restoredNormalGeometry, frameHeight);
7557
7558 if (maximized || fullScreen) {
7559 // set geometry before setting the window state to make
7560 // sure the window is maximized to the right screen.
7561 Qt::WindowStates ws = windowState();
7562#ifndef Q_OS_WIN
7563 setGeometry(restoredNormalGeometry);
7564#else
7565 if (ws & Qt::WindowFullScreen) {
7566 // Full screen is not a real window state on Windows.
7567 move(availableGeometry.topLeft());
7568 } else if (ws & Qt::WindowMaximized) {
7569 // Setting a geometry on an already maximized window causes this to be
7570 // restored into a broken, half-maximized state, non-resizable state (QTBUG-4397).
7571 // Move the window in normal state if needed.
7572 if (restoredScreen != screen()) {
7573 setWindowState(Qt::WindowNoState);
7574 setGeometry(restoredNormalGeometry);
7575 }
7576 } else {
7577 setGeometry(restoredNormalGeometry);
7578 }
7579#endif // Q_OS_WIN
7580 if (maximized)
7581 ws |= Qt::WindowMaximized;
7582 if (fullScreen)
7583 ws |= Qt::WindowFullScreen;
7584 setWindowState(ws);
7585 d_func()->topData()->normalGeometry = restoredNormalGeometry;
7586 } else {
7587 setWindowState(windowState() & ~(Qt::WindowMaximized | Qt::WindowFullScreen));
7588
7589 // FIXME: Why fall back to restoredNormalGeometry if majorVersion <= 2?
7590 if (majorVersion > 2)
7591 setGeometry(restoredGeometry);
7592 else
7593 setGeometry(restoredNormalGeometry);
7594 }
7595 return true;
7596}
7597
7598/*!\fn void QWidget::setGeometry(int x, int y, int w, int h)
7599 \overload
7600
7601 This corresponds to setGeometry(QRect(\a x, \a y, \a w, \a h)).
7602*/
7603
7604/*!
7605 Sets the margins around the contents of the widget to have the sizes
7606 \a left, \a top, \a right, and \a bottom. The margins are used by
7607 the layout system, and may be used by subclasses to specify the area
7608 to draw in (e.g. excluding the frame).
7609
7610 Changing the margins will trigger a resizeEvent().
7611
7612 \sa contentsRect(), contentsMargins()
7613*/
7614void QWidget::setContentsMargins(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
7615{
7616 Q_D(QWidget);
7617 if (left == d->leftmargin && top == d->topmargin
7618 && right == d->rightmargin && bottom == d->bottommargin)
7619 return;
7620 d->leftmargin = left;
7621 d->topmargin = top;
7622 d->rightmargin = right;
7623 d->bottommargin = bottom;
7624
7625 d->updateContentsRect();
7626}
7627
7628/*!
7629 \overload
7630 \since 4.6
7631
7632 \brief The setContentsMargins function sets the margins around the
7633 widget's contents.
7634
7635 Sets the margins around the contents of the widget to have the
7636 sizes determined by \a margins. The margins are
7637 used by the layout system, and may be used by subclasses to
7638 specify the area to draw in (e.g. excluding the frame).
7639
7640 Changing the margins will trigger a resizeEvent().
7641
7642 \sa contentsRect(), contentsMargins()
7643*/
7644void QWidget::setContentsMargins(const QMargins &margins)
7645{
7646 setContentsMargins(left: margins.left(), top: margins.top(),
7647 right: margins.right(), bottom: margins.bottom());
7648}
7649
7650void QWidgetPrivate::updateContentsRect()
7651{
7652 Q_Q(QWidget);
7653
7654 if (layout)
7655 layout->update(); //force activate; will do updateGeometry
7656 else
7657 q->updateGeometry();
7658
7659 if (q->isVisible()) {
7660 q->update();
7661 QResizeEvent e(q->data->crect.size(), q->data->crect.size());
7662 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7663 } else {
7664 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent, on: true);
7665 }
7666
7667 QEvent e(QEvent::ContentsRectChange);
7668 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7669}
7670
7671/*!
7672 \since 4.6
7673
7674 \brief The contentsMargins function returns the widget's contents margins.
7675
7676 \sa setContentsMargins(), contentsRect()
7677 */
7678QMargins QWidget::contentsMargins() const
7679{
7680 Q_D(const QWidget);
7681 QMargins userMargins(d->leftmargin, d->topmargin, d->rightmargin, d->bottommargin);
7682 return testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_ContentsMarginsRespectsSafeArea) ?
7683 userMargins | d->safeAreaMargins() : userMargins;
7684}
7685
7686/*!
7687 Returns the area inside the widget's margins.
7688
7689 \sa setContentsMargins(), contentsMargins()
7690*/
7691QRect QWidget::contentsRect() const
7692{
7693 return rect() - contentsMargins();
7694}
7695
7696QMargins QWidgetPrivate::safeAreaMargins() const
7697{
7698 Q_Q(const QWidget);
7699 QWidget *nativeWidget = q->window();
7700 if (!nativeWidget->windowHandle())
7701 return QMargins();
7702
7703 QPlatformWindow *platformWindow = nativeWidget->windowHandle()->handle();
7704 if (!platformWindow)
7705 return QMargins();
7706
7707 QMargins safeAreaMargins = platformWindow->safeAreaMargins();
7708
7709 if (!q->isWindow()) {
7710 // In theory the native parent widget already has a contents rect reflecting
7711 // the safe area of that widget, but we can't be sure that the widget or child
7712 // widgets of that widget have respected the contents rect when setting their
7713 // geometry, so we need to manually compute the safe area.
7714
7715 // Unless the native widget doesn't have any margins, in which case there's
7716 // nothing for us to compute.
7717 if (safeAreaMargins.isNull())
7718 return QMargins();
7719
7720 // Or, if one of our ancestors are in a layout that does not have WA_LayoutOnEntireRect
7721 // set, then we know that the layout has already taken care of placing us inside the
7722 // safe area, by taking the contents rect of its parent widget into account.
7723 const QWidget *assumedSafeWidget = nullptr;
7724 for (const QWidget *w = q; w != nativeWidget; w = w->parentWidget()) {
7725 QWidget *parentWidget = w->parentWidget();
7726 if (parentWidget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_LayoutOnEntireRect))
7727 continue; // Layout not going to help us
7728
7729 QLayout *layout = parentWidget->layout();
7730 if (!layout)
7731 continue;
7732
7733 if (layout->geometry().isNull())
7734 continue; // Layout hasn't been activated yet
7735
7736 if (layout->indexOf(w) < 0)
7737 continue; // Widget is not in layout
7738
7739 assumedSafeWidget = w;
7740 break;
7741 }
7742
7743#if !defined(QT_DEBUG)
7744 if (assumedSafeWidget) {
7745 // We found a layout that we assume will take care of keeping us within the safe area
7746 // For debug builds we still map the safe area using the fallback logic, so that we
7747 // can detect any misbehaving layouts.
7748 return QMargins();
7749 }
7750#endif
7751
7752 // In all other cases we need to map the safe area of the native parent to the widget.
7753 // This depends on the widget being positioned and sized already, which means the initial
7754 // layout will be wrong, but the layout will then adjust itself.
7755 QPoint topLeftMargins = q->mapFrom(parent: nativeWidget, pos: QPoint(safeAreaMargins.left(), safeAreaMargins.top()));
7756 QRect widgetRect = q->isVisible() ? q->visibleRegion().boundingRect() : q->rect();
7757 QPoint bottomRightMargins = widgetRect.bottomRight() - q->mapFrom(parent: nativeWidget,
7758 pos: nativeWidget->rect().bottomRight() - QPoint(safeAreaMargins.right(), safeAreaMargins.bottom()));
7759
7760 // Margins should never be negative
7761 safeAreaMargins = QMargins(qMax(a: 0, b: topLeftMargins.x()), qMax(a: 0, b: topLeftMargins.y()),
7762 qMax(a: 0, b: bottomRightMargins.x()), qMax(a: 0, b: bottomRightMargins.y()));
7763
7764 if (!safeAreaMargins.isNull() && assumedSafeWidget) {
7765 QLayout *layout = assumedSafeWidget->parentWidget()->layout();
7766 qWarning() << layout << "is laying out" << assumedSafeWidget
7767 << "outside of the contents rect of" << layout->parentWidget();
7768 return QMargins(); // Return empty margin to visually highlight the error
7769 }
7770 }
7771
7772 return safeAreaMargins;
7773}
7774
7775/*!
7776 \fn void QWidget::customContextMenuRequested(const QPoint &pos)
7777
7778 This signal is emitted when the widget's \l contextMenuPolicy is
7779 Qt::CustomContextMenu, and the user has requested a context menu on
7780 the widget. The position \a pos is the position of the context menu
7781 event that the widget receives. Normally this is in widget
7782 coordinates. The exception to this rule is QAbstractScrollArea and
7783 its subclasses that map the context menu event to coordinates of the
7784 \l{QAbstractScrollArea::viewport()}{viewport()}.
7785
7786
7787 \sa mapToGlobal(), QMenu, contextMenuPolicy
7788*/
7789
7790
7791/*!
7792 \property QWidget::contextMenuPolicy
7793 \brief how the widget shows a context menu
7794
7795 The default value of this property is Qt::DefaultContextMenu,
7796 which means the contextMenuEvent() handler is called. Other values
7797 are Qt::NoContextMenu, Qt::PreventContextMenu,
7798 Qt::ActionsContextMenu, and Qt::CustomContextMenu. With
7799 Qt::CustomContextMenu, the signal customContextMenuRequested() is
7800 emitted.
7801
7802 \sa contextMenuEvent(), customContextMenuRequested(), actions()
7803*/
7804
7805Qt::ContextMenuPolicy QWidget::contextMenuPolicy() const
7806{
7807 return (Qt::ContextMenuPolicy)data->context_menu_policy;
7808}
7809
7810void QWidget::setContextMenuPolicy(Qt::ContextMenuPolicy policy)
7811{
7812 data->context_menu_policy = (uint) policy;
7813}
7814
7815/*!
7816 \property QWidget::focusPolicy
7817 \brief the way the widget accepts keyboard focus
7818
7819 The policy is Qt::TabFocus if the widget accepts keyboard
7820 focus by tabbing, Qt::ClickFocus if the widget accepts
7821 focus by clicking, Qt::StrongFocus if it accepts both, and
7822 Qt::NoFocus (the default) if it does not accept focus at
7823 all.
7824
7825 You must enable keyboard focus for a widget if it processes
7826 keyboard events. This is normally done from the widget's
7827 constructor. For instance, the QLineEdit constructor calls
7828 setFocusPolicy(Qt::StrongFocus).
7829
7830 If the widget has a focus proxy, then the focus policy will
7831 be propagated to it.
7832
7833 \sa focusInEvent(), focusOutEvent(), keyPressEvent(), keyReleaseEvent(), enabled
7834*/
7835
7836
7837Qt::FocusPolicy QWidget::focusPolicy() const
7838{
7839 return (Qt::FocusPolicy)data->focus_policy;
7840}
7841
7842void QWidget::setFocusPolicy(Qt::FocusPolicy policy)
7843{
7844 data->focus_policy = (uint) policy;
7845 Q_D(QWidget);
7846 if (d->extra && d->extra->focus_proxy)
7847 d->extra->focus_proxy->setFocusPolicy(policy);
7848}
7849
7850/*!
7851 \property QWidget::updatesEnabled
7852 \brief whether updates are enabled
7853
7854 An updates enabled widget receives paint events and has a system
7855 background; a disabled widget does not. This also implies that
7856 calling update() and repaint() has no effect if updates are
7857 disabled.
7858
7859 By default, this property is \c true.
7860
7861 setUpdatesEnabled() is normally used to disable updates for a
7862 short period of time, for instance to avoid screen flicker during
7863 large changes. In Qt, widgets normally do not generate screen
7864 flicker, but on X11 the server might erase regions on the screen
7865 when widgets get hidden before they can be replaced by other
7866 widgets. Disabling updates solves this.
7867
7868 Example:
7869 \snippet code/src_gui_kernel_qwidget.cpp 13
7870
7871 Disabling a widget implicitly disables all its children. Enabling a widget
7872 enables all child widgets \e except top-level widgets or those that
7873 have been explicitly disabled. Re-enabling updates implicitly calls
7874 update() on the widget.
7875
7876 \sa paintEvent()
7877*/
7878void QWidget::setUpdatesEnabled(bool enable)
7879{
7880 Q_D(QWidget);
7881 setAttribute(Qt::WA_ForceUpdatesDisabled, on: !enable);
7882 d->setUpdatesEnabled_helper(enable);
7883}
7884
7885/*!
7886 Shows the widget and its child widgets.
7887
7888 This is equivalent to calling showFullScreen(), showMaximized(), or setVisible(true),
7889 depending on the platform's default behavior for the window flags.
7890
7891 \sa raise(), showEvent(), hide(), setVisible(), showMinimized(), showMaximized(),
7892 showNormal(), isVisible(), windowFlags()
7893*/
7894void QWidget::show()
7895{
7896 Qt::WindowState defaultState = QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformIntegration()->defaultWindowState(data->window_flags);
7897 if (defaultState == Qt::WindowFullScreen)
7898 showFullScreen();
7899 else if (defaultState == Qt::WindowMaximized)
7900 showMaximized();
7901 else
7902 setVisible(true); // Don't call showNormal() as not to clobber Qt::Window(Max/Min)imized
7903}
7904
7905/*! \internal
7906
7907 Makes the widget visible in the isVisible() meaning of the word.
7908 It is only called for toplevels or widgets with visible parents.
7909 */
7910void QWidgetPrivate::show_recursive()
7911{
7912 Q_Q(QWidget);
7913 // polish if necessary
7914
7915 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
7916 createRecursively();
7917 q->ensurePolished();
7918
7919 if (!q->isWindow() && q->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout && !q->parentWidget()->data->in_show)
7920 q->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout->activate();
7921 // activate our layout before we and our children become visible
7922 if (layout)
7923 layout->activate();
7924
7925 show_helper();
7926}
7927
7928void QWidgetPrivate::sendPendingMoveAndResizeEvents(bool recursive, bool disableUpdates)
7929{
7930 Q_Q(QWidget);
7931
7932 disableUpdates = disableUpdates && q->updatesEnabled();
7933 if (disableUpdates)
7934 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_UpdatesDisabled);
7935
7936 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_PendingMoveEvent)) {
7937 QMoveEvent e(data.crect.topLeft(), data.crect.topLeft());
7938 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7939 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingMoveEvent, on: false);
7940 }
7941
7942 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent)) {
7943 QResizeEvent e(data.crect.size(), QSize());
7944 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
7945 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_PendingResizeEvent, on: false);
7946 }
7947
7948 if (disableUpdates)
7949 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_UpdatesDisabled, on: false);
7950
7951 if (!recursive)
7952 return;
7953
7954 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
7955 if (QWidget *child = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: children.at(i)))
7956 child->d_func()->sendPendingMoveAndResizeEvents(recursive, disableUpdates);
7957 }
7958}
7959
7960void QWidgetPrivate::activateChildLayoutsRecursively()
7961{
7962 sendPendingMoveAndResizeEvents(recursive: false, disableUpdates: true);
7963
7964 for (int i = 0; i < children.size(); ++i) {
7965 QWidget *child = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: children.at(i));
7966 if (!child || child->isHidden() || child->isWindow())
7967 continue;
7968
7969 child->ensurePolished();
7970
7971 // Activate child's layout
7972 QWidgetPrivate *childPrivate = child->d_func();
7973 if (childPrivate->layout)
7974 childPrivate->layout->activate();
7975
7976 // Pretend we're visible.
7977 const bool wasVisible = child->isVisible();
7978 if (!wasVisible)
7979 child->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Visible);
7980
7981 // Do the same for all my children.
7982 childPrivate->activateChildLayoutsRecursively();
7983
7984 // We're not cheating anymore.
7985 if (!wasVisible)
7986 child->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Visible, on: false);
7987 }
7988}
7989
7990void QWidgetPrivate::show_helper()
7991{
7992 Q_Q(QWidget);
7993 data.in_show = true; // qws optimization
7994 // make sure we receive pending move and resize events
7995 sendPendingMoveAndResizeEvents();
7996
7997 // become visible before showing all children
7998 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Visible);
7999
8000 // finally show all children recursively
8001 showChildren(spontaneous: false);
8002
8003
8004
8005 const bool isWindow = q->isWindow();
8006#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
8007 bool isEmbedded = isWindow && q->graphicsProxyWidget() != nullptr;
8008#else
8009 bool isEmbedded = false;
8010#endif
8011
8012 // popup handling: new popups and tools need to be raised, and
8013 // existing popups must be closed. Also propagate the current
8014 // windows's KeyboardFocusChange status.
8015 if (isWindow && !isEmbedded) {
8016 if ((q->windowType() == Qt::Tool) || (q->windowType() == Qt::Popup) || q->windowType() == Qt::ToolTip) {
8017 q->raise();
8018 if (q->parentWidget() && q->parentWidget()->window()->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange))
8019 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange);
8020 } else {
8021 while (QApplication::activePopupWidget()) {
8022 if (!QApplication::activePopupWidget()->close())
8023 break;
8024 }
8025 }
8026 }
8027
8028 // Automatic embedding of child windows of widgets already embedded into
8029 // QGraphicsProxyWidget when they are shown the first time.
8030#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
8031 if (isWindow) {
8032 if (!isEmbedded && !bypassGraphicsProxyWidget(p: q)) {
8033 QGraphicsProxyWidget *ancestorProxy = nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(origin: q->parentWidget());
8034 if (ancestorProxy) {
8035 isEmbedded = true;
8036 ancestorProxy->d_func()->embedSubWindow(q);
8037 }
8038 }
8039 }
8040#else
8041 Q_UNUSED(isEmbedded);
8042#endif
8043
8044 // send the show event before showing the window
8045 QShowEvent showEvent;
8046 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &showEvent);
8047
8048 show_sys();
8049
8050 if (!isEmbedded && q->windowType() == Qt::Popup)
8051 qApp->d_func()->openPopup(popup: q);
8052
8053#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
8054 if (q->windowType() != Qt::ToolTip) { // Tooltips are read aloud twice in MS narrator.
8055 QAccessibleEvent event(q, QAccessible::ObjectShow);
8056 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
8057 }
8058#endif
8059
8060 if (QApplicationPrivate::hidden_focus_widget == q) {
8061 QApplicationPrivate::hidden_focus_widget = nullptr;
8062 q->setFocus(Qt::OtherFocusReason);
8063 }
8064
8065 // Process events when showing a Qt::SplashScreen widget before the event loop
8066 // is spinnning; otherwise it might not show up on particular platforms.
8067 // This makes QSplashScreen behave the same on all platforms.
8068 if (!qApp->d_func()->in_exec && q->windowType() == Qt::SplashScreen)
8069 QCoreApplication::processEvents();
8070
8071 data.in_show = false; // reset qws optimization
8072}
8073
8074void QWidgetPrivate::show_sys()
8075{
8076 Q_Q(QWidget);
8077
8078 auto window = qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: windowHandle());
8079
8080 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
8081 invalidateBackingStore(q->rect());
8082 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Mapped);
8083 // add our window the modal window list (native dialogs)
8084 if (window && q->isWindow()
8085#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
8086 && (!extra || !extra->proxyWidget)
8087#endif
8088 && q->windowModality() != Qt::NonModal) {
8089 QGuiApplicationPrivate::showModalWindow(window);
8090 }
8091 return;
8092 }
8093
8094 if (renderToTexture && !q->isWindow())
8095 QCoreApplication::postEvent(receiver: q->parentWidget(), event: new QUpdateLaterEvent(q->geometry()));
8096 else
8097 QCoreApplication::postEvent(receiver: q, event: new QUpdateLaterEvent(q->rect()));
8098
8099 if ((!q->isWindow() && !q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NativeWindow))
8100 || q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_OutsideWSRange)) {
8101 return;
8102 }
8103
8104 if (window) {
8105 if (q->isWindow())
8106 fixPosIncludesFrame();
8107 QRect geomRect = q->geometry();
8108 if (!q->isWindow()) {
8109 QPoint topLeftOfWindow = q->mapTo(parent: q->nativeParentWidget(),pos: QPoint());
8110 geomRect.moveTopLeft(p: topLeftOfWindow);
8111 }
8112 const QRect windowRect = window->geometry();
8113 if (windowRect != geomRect) {
8114 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Moved)
8115 || !QGuiApplicationPrivate::platformIntegration()->hasCapability(cap: QPlatformIntegration::WindowManagement))
8116 window->setGeometry(geomRect);
8117 else
8118 window->resize(newSize: geomRect.size());
8119 }
8120
8121#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
8122 qt_qpa_set_cursor(w: q, force: false); // Needed in case cursor was set before show
8123#endif
8124 invalidateBackingStore(q->rect());
8125 window->setNativeWindowVisibility(true);
8126 // Was the window moved by the Window system or QPlatformWindow::initialGeometry() ?
8127 if (window->isTopLevel()) {
8128 const QPoint crectTopLeft = q->data->crect.topLeft();
8129 const QPoint windowTopLeft = window->geometry().topLeft();
8130 if (crectTopLeft == QPoint(0, 0) && windowTopLeft != crectTopLeft)
8131 q->data->crect.moveTopLeft(p: windowTopLeft);
8132 }
8133 }
8134}
8135
8136/*!
8137 Hides the widget. This function is equivalent to
8138 setVisible(false).
8139
8140
8141 \note If you are working with QDialog or its subclasses and you invoke
8142 the show() function after this function, the dialog will be displayed in
8143 its original position.
8144
8145 \sa hideEvent(), isHidden(), show(), setVisible(), isVisible(), close()
8146*/
8147void QWidget::hide()
8148{
8149 setVisible(false);
8150}
8151
8152/*!\internal
8153 */
8154void QWidgetPrivate::hide_helper()
8155{
8156 Q_Q(QWidget);
8157
8158 bool isEmbedded = false;
8159#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
8160 isEmbedded = q->isWindow() && !bypassGraphicsProxyWidget(p: q) && nearestGraphicsProxyWidget(origin: q->parentWidget()) != nullptr;
8161#else
8162 Q_UNUSED(isEmbedded);
8163#endif
8164
8165 if (!isEmbedded && (q->windowType() == Qt::Popup))
8166 qApp->d_func()->closePopup(popup: q);
8167
8168 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Mapped, on: false);
8169 hide_sys();
8170
8171 bool wasVisible = q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Visible);
8172
8173 if (wasVisible) {
8174 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Visible, on: false);
8175
8176 }
8177
8178 QHideEvent hideEvent;
8179 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &hideEvent);
8180 hideChildren(spontaneous: false);
8181
8182 // next bit tries to move the focus if the focus widget is now
8183 // hidden.
8184 if (wasVisible) {
8185 qApp->d_func()->sendSyntheticEnterLeave(widget: q);
8186 QWidget *fw = QApplication::focusWidget();
8187 while (fw && !fw->isWindow()) {
8188 if (fw == q) {
8189 q->focusNextPrevChild(next: true);
8190 break;
8191 }
8192 fw = fw->parentWidget();
8193 }
8194 }
8195
8196 if (QWidgetRepaintManager *repaintManager = maybeRepaintManager())
8197 repaintManager->removeDirtyWidget(w: q);
8198
8199#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
8200 if (wasVisible) {
8201 QAccessibleEvent event(q, QAccessible::ObjectHide);
8202 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
8203 }
8204#endif
8205}
8206
8207void QWidgetPrivate::hide_sys()
8208{
8209 Q_Q(QWidget);
8210
8211 auto window = qobject_cast<QWidgetWindow *>(object: windowHandle());
8212
8213 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
8214 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Mapped, on: false);
8215 // remove our window from the modal window list (native dialogs)
8216 if (window && q->isWindow()
8217#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
8218 && (!extra || !extra->proxyWidget)
8219#endif
8220 && q->windowModality() != Qt::NonModal) {
8221 QGuiApplicationPrivate::hideModalWindow(window);
8222 }
8223 // do not return here, if window non-zero, we must hide it
8224 }
8225
8226 deactivateWidgetCleanup();
8227
8228 if (!q->isWindow()) {
8229 QWidget *p = q->parentWidget();
8230 if (p &&p->isVisible()) {
8231 if (renderToTexture)
8232 p->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(q->geometry());
8233 else
8234 invalidateBackingStore(q->rect());
8235 }
8236 } else {
8237 invalidateBackingStore(q->rect());
8238 }
8239
8240 if (window)
8241 window->setNativeWindowVisibility(false);
8242}
8243
8244/*!
8245 \fn bool QWidget::isHidden() const
8246
8247 Returns \c true if the widget is hidden, otherwise returns \c false.
8248
8249 A hidden widget will only become visible when show() is called on
8250 it. It will not be automatically shown when the parent is shown.
8251
8252 To check visibility, use !isVisible() instead (notice the exclamation mark).
8253
8254 isHidden() implies !isVisible(), but a widget can be not visible
8255 and not hidden at the same time. This is the case for widgets that are children of
8256 widgets that are not visible.
8257
8258
8259 Widgets are hidden if:
8260 \list
8261 \li they were created as independent windows,
8262 \li they were created as children of visible widgets,
8263 \li hide() or setVisible(false) was called.
8264 \endlist
8265*/
8266
8267void QWidget::setVisible(bool visible)
8268{
8269 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide) && testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Hidden) == !visible)
8270 return;
8271
8272 // Remember that setVisible was called explicitly
8273 setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide);
8274
8275 Q_D(QWidget);
8276 d->setVisible(visible);
8277}
8278
8279// This method is called from QWidgetWindow in response to QWindow::setVisible,
8280// and should match the semantics of QWindow::setVisible. QWidget::setVisible on
8281// the other hand keeps track of WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide in addition.
8282void QWidgetPrivate::setVisible(bool visible)
8283{
8284 Q_Q(QWidget);
8285 if (visible) { // show
8286 // Designer uses a trick to make grabWidget work without showing
8287 if (!q->isWindow() && q->parentWidget() && q->parentWidget()->isVisible()
8288 && !q->parentWidget()->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
8289 q->parentWidget()->window()->d_func()->createRecursively();
8290
8291 //create toplevels but not children of non-visible parents
8292 QWidget *pw = q->parentWidget();
8293 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)
8294 && (q->isWindow() || pw->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))) {
8295 q->create();
8296 }
8297
8298 bool wasResized = q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_Resized);
8299 Qt::WindowStates initialWindowState = q->windowState();
8300
8301 // polish if necessary
8302 q->ensurePolished();
8303
8304 // whether we need to inform the parent widget immediately
8305 bool needUpdateGeometry = !q->isWindow() && q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Hidden);
8306 // we are no longer hidden
8307 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Hidden, on: false);
8308
8309 if (needUpdateGeometry)
8310 updateGeometry_helper(forceUpdate: true);
8311
8312 // activate our layout before we and our children become visible
8313 if (layout)
8314 layout->activate();
8315
8316 if (!q->isWindow()) {
8317 QWidget *parent = q->parentWidget();
8318 while (parent && parent->isVisible() && parent->d_func()->layout && !parent->data->in_show) {
8319 parent->d_func()->layout->activate();
8320 if (parent->isWindow())
8321 break;
8322 parent = parent->parentWidget();
8323 }
8324 if (parent)
8325 parent->d_func()->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
8326 }
8327
8328 // adjust size if necessary
8329 if (!wasResized
8330 && (q->isWindow() || !q->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout)) {
8331 if (q->isWindow()) {
8332 q->adjustSize();
8333 if (q->windowState() != initialWindowState)
8334 q->setWindowState(initialWindowState);
8335 } else {
8336 q->adjustSize();
8337 }
8338 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Resized, on: false);
8339 }
8340
8341 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_KeyboardFocusChange, on: false);
8342
8343 if (q->isWindow() || q->parentWidget()->isVisible()) {
8344 show_helper();
8345
8346 qApp->d_func()->sendSyntheticEnterLeave(widget: q);
8347 }
8348
8349 QEvent showToParentEvent(QEvent::ShowToParent);
8350 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &showToParentEvent);
8351 } else { // hide
8352 if (QApplicationPrivate::hidden_focus_widget == q)
8353 QApplicationPrivate::hidden_focus_widget = nullptr;
8354
8355 // hw: The test on getOpaqueRegion() needs to be more intelligent
8356 // currently it doesn't work if the widget is hidden (the region will
8357 // be clipped). The real check should be testing the cached region
8358 // (and dirty flag) directly.
8359 if (!q->isWindow() && q->parentWidget()) // && !d->getOpaqueRegion().isEmpty())
8360 q->parentWidget()->d_func()->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
8361
8362 if (!q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Hidden)) {
8363 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Hidden);
8364 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
8365 hide_helper();
8366 }
8367
8368 // invalidate layout similar to updateGeometry()
8369 if (!q->isWindow() && q->parentWidget()) {
8370 if (q->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout)
8371 q->parentWidget()->d_func()->layout->invalidate();
8372 else if (q->parentWidget()->isVisible())
8373 QCoreApplication::postEvent(receiver: q->parentWidget(), event: new QEvent(QEvent::LayoutRequest));
8374 }
8375
8376 QEvent hideToParentEvent(QEvent::HideToParent);
8377 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &hideToParentEvent);
8378 }
8379}
8380
8381/*!
8382 Convenience function, equivalent to setVisible(!\a hidden).
8383*/
8384void QWidget::setHidden(bool hidden)
8385{
8386 setVisible(!hidden);
8387}
8388
8389void QWidgetPrivate::_q_showIfNotHidden()
8390{
8391 Q_Q(QWidget);
8392 if ( !(q->isHidden() && q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide)) )
8393 q->setVisible(true);
8394}
8395
8396void QWidgetPrivate::showChildren(bool spontaneous)
8397{
8398 QList<QObject*> childList = children;
8399 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); ++i) {
8400 QWidget *widget = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: childList.at(i));
8401 if (widget && widget->windowHandle() && !widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide))
8402 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Hidden, on: false);
8403 if (!widget
8404 || widget->isWindow()
8405 || widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Hidden))
8406 continue;
8407 if (spontaneous) {
8408 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Mapped);
8409 widget->d_func()->showChildren(spontaneous: true);
8410 QShowEvent e;
8411 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &e);
8412 } else {
8413 if (widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_ExplicitShowHide))
8414 widget->d_func()->show_recursive();
8415 else
8416 widget->show();
8417 }
8418 }
8419}
8420
8421void QWidgetPrivate::hideChildren(bool spontaneous)
8422{
8423 Q_Q(QWidget);
8424 QList<QObject*> childList = children;
8425 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); ++i) {
8426 QWidget *widget = qobject_cast<QWidget*>(o: childList.at(i));
8427 if (!widget || widget->isWindow() || widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Hidden))
8428 continue;
8429
8430 if (spontaneous)
8431 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_Mapped, on: false);
8432 else
8433 widget->setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Visible, on: false);
8434 widget->d_func()->hideChildren(spontaneous);
8435 QHideEvent e;
8436 if (spontaneous) {
8437 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &e);
8438 } else {
8439 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: widget, event: &e);
8440 if (widget->internalWinId()
8441 && widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontCreateNativeAncestors)) {
8442 // hide_sys() on an ancestor won't have any affect on this
8443 // widget, so it needs an explicit hide_sys() of its own
8444 widget->d_func()->hide_sys();
8445 }
8446 }
8447 qApp->d_func()->sendSyntheticEnterLeave(widget);
8448#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
8449 if (!spontaneous) {
8450 QAccessibleEvent event(widget, QAccessible::ObjectHide);
8451 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
8452 }
8453#endif
8454 }
8455
8456 // If the window of this widget is not closed, then the leave event
8457 // will eventually handle the widget under mouse use case.
8458 // Otherwise, we need to explicitly handle it here.
8459 if (QWidget* widgetWindow = q->window();
8460 widgetWindow && widgetWindow->data->is_closing) {
8461 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_UnderMouse, on: false);
8462 }
8463}
8464
8465/*!
8466 \internal
8467
8468 For windows, this is called from the QWidgetWindow::handleCloseEvent implementation,
8469 which QWidget::close indirectly calls by closing the QWindow. \a mode will be
8470 CloseWithEvent if QWidgetWindow::handleCloseEvent is called indirectly by
8471 QWindow::close, and CloseWithSpontaneousEvent if the close event originates from the
8472 system (i.e. the user clicked the close button in the title bar).
8473
8474 QDialog calls this method directly in its hide() implementation, which might be
8475 called from the QDialog::closeEvent override. \a mode will be set to CloseNoEvent
8476 to prevent recursion.
8477
8478 For non-windows, this is called directly by QWidget::close, and \a mode will be
8479 CloseWithEvent.
8480
8481 The function is also called by the QWidget destructor, with \a mode set to CloseNoEvent.
8482*/
8483bool QWidgetPrivate::handleClose(CloseMode mode)
8484{
8485 if (data.is_closing)
8486 return true;
8487
8488 // We might not have initiated the close, so update the state now that we know
8489 data.is_closing = true;
8490
8491 Q_Q(QWidget);
8492 QPointer<QWidget> that = q;
8493
8494 if (data.in_destructor)
8495 mode = CloseNoEvent;
8496
8497 if (mode != CloseNoEvent) {
8498 QCloseEvent e;
8499 if (mode == CloseWithSpontaneousEvent)
8500 QApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
8501 else
8502 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: q, event: &e);
8503 if (!that.isNull() && !e.isAccepted()) {
8504 data.is_closing = false;
8505 return false;
8506 }
8507 }
8508
8509 // even for windows, make sure we deliver a hide event and that all children get hidden
8510 if (!that.isNull() && !q->isHidden())
8511 q->hide();
8512
8513 if (!that.isNull()) {
8514 data.is_closing = false;
8515 if (q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose)) {
8516 q->setAttribute(Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose, on: false);
8517 q->deleteLater();
8518 }
8519 }
8520 return true;
8521}
8522
8523
8524/*!
8525 Closes this widget. Returns \c true if the widget was closed;
8526 otherwise returns \c false.
8527
8528 First it sends the widget a QCloseEvent. The widget is
8529 \l{hide()}{hidden} if it \l{QEvent::accept()}{accepts}
8530 the close event. If it \l{QEvent::ignore()}{ignores}
8531 the event, nothing happens. The default
8532 implementation of QWidget::closeEvent() accepts the close event.
8533
8534 If the widget has the Qt::WA_DeleteOnClose flag, the widget
8535 is also deleted. A close events is delivered to the widget no
8536 matter if the widget is visible or not.
8537
8538 The \l QGuiApplication::lastWindowClosed() signal is emitted when the
8539 last visible primary window (i.e. window with no parent) with the
8540 Qt::WA_QuitOnClose attribute set is closed. By default this
8541 attribute is set for all widgets except transient windows such as
8542 splash screens, tool windows, and popup menus.
8543
8544*/
8545
8546bool QWidget::close()
8547{
8548 return d_func()->close();
8549}
8550
8551bool QWidgetPrivate::close()
8552{
8553 // FIXME: We're not setting is_closing here, even though that would
8554 // make sense, as the code below will not end up in handleClose to
8555 // reset is_closing when there's a QWindow, but no QPlatformWindow,
8556 // and we can't assume close is synchronous so we can't reset it here.
8557
8558 // Close native widgets via QWindow::close() in order to run QWindow
8559 // close code. The QWidget-specific close code in handleClose() will
8560 // in this case be called from the Close event handler in QWidgetWindow.
8561 if (QWindow *widgetWindow = windowHandle()) {
8562 if (widgetWindow->isTopLevel())
8563 return widgetWindow->close();
8564 }
8565
8566 return handleClose(mode: QWidgetPrivate::CloseWithEvent);
8567}
8568
8569/*!
8570 \property QWidget::visible
8571 \brief whether the widget is visible
8572
8573 Calling setVisible(true) or show() sets the widget to visible
8574 status if all its parent widgets up to the window are visible. If
8575 an ancestor is not visible, the widget won't become visible until
8576 all its ancestors are shown. If its size or position has changed,
8577 Qt guarantees that a widget gets move and resize events just
8578 before it is shown. If the widget has not been resized yet, Qt
8579 will adjust the widget's size to a useful default using
8580 adjustSize().
8581
8582 Calling setVisible(false) or hide() hides a widget explicitly. An
8583 explicitly hidden widget will never become visible, even if all
8584 its ancestors become visible, unless you show it.
8585
8586 A widget receives show and hide events when its visibility status
8587 changes. Between a hide and a show event, there is no need to
8588 waste CPU cycles preparing or displaying information to the user.
8589 A video application, for example, might simply stop generating new
8590 frames.
8591
8592 A widget that happens to be obscured by other windows on the
8593 screen is considered to be visible. The same applies to iconified
8594 windows and windows that exist on another virtual
8595 desktop (on platforms that support this concept). A widget
8596 receives spontaneous show and hide events when its mapping status
8597 is changed by the window system, e.g. a spontaneous hide event
8598 when the user minimizes the window, and a spontaneous show event
8599 when the window is restored again.
8600
8601 You almost never have to reimplement the setVisible() function. If
8602 you need to change some settings before a widget is shown, use
8603 showEvent() instead. If you need to do some delayed initialization
8604 use the Polish event delivered to the event() function.
8605
8606 \sa show(), hide(), isHidden(), isVisibleTo(), isMinimized(),
8607 showEvent(), hideEvent()
8608*/
8609
8610
8611/*!
8612 Returns \c true if this widget would become visible if \a ancestor is
8613 shown; otherwise returns \c false.
8614
8615 The true case occurs if neither the widget itself nor any parent
8616 up to but excluding \a ancestor has been explicitly hidden.
8617
8618 This function will still return true if the widget is obscured by
8619 other windows on the screen, but could be physically visible if it
8620 or they were to be moved.
8621
8622 isVisibleTo(0) is identical to isVisible().
8623
8624 \sa show(), hide(), isVisible()
8625*/
8626
8627bool QWidget::isVisibleTo(const QWidget *ancestor) const
8628{
8629 if (!ancestor)
8630 return isVisible();
8631 const QWidget * w = this;
8632 while (!w->isHidden()
8633 && !w->isWindow()
8634 && w->parentWidget()
8635 && w->parentWidget() != ancestor)
8636 w = w->parentWidget();
8637 return !w->isHidden();
8638}
8639
8640
8641/*!
8642 Returns the unobscured region where paint events can occur.
8643
8644 For visible widgets, this is an approximation of the area not
8645 covered by other widgets; otherwise, this is an empty region.
8646
8647 The repaint() function calls this function if necessary, so in
8648 general you do not need to call it.
8649
8650*/
8651QRegion QWidget::visibleRegion() const
8652{
8653 Q_D(const QWidget);
8654
8655 QRect clipRect = d->clipRect();
8656 if (clipRect.isEmpty())
8657 return QRegion();
8658 QRegion r(clipRect);
8659 d->subtractOpaqueChildren(source&: r, clipRect);
8660 d->subtractOpaqueSiblings(sourceRegion&: r);
8661 return r;
8662}
8663
8664
8665QSize QWidgetPrivate::adjustedSize() const
8666{
8667 Q_Q(const QWidget);
8668
8669 QSize s = q->sizeHint();
8670
8671 if (q->isWindow()) {
8672 Qt::Orientations exp;
8673 if (layout) {
8674 if (layout->hasHeightForWidth())
8675 s.setHeight(layout->totalHeightForWidth(w: s.width()));
8676 exp = layout->expandingDirections();
8677 } else
8678 {
8679 if (q->sizePolicy().hasHeightForWidth())
8680 s.setHeight(q->heightForWidth(s.width()));
8681 exp = q->sizePolicy().expandingDirections();
8682 }
8683 if (exp & Qt::Horizontal)
8684 s.setWidth(qMax(a: s.width(), b: 200));
8685 if (exp & Qt::Vertical)
8686 s.setHeight(qMax(a: s.height(), b: 100));
8687
8688 QRect screen;
8689 if (const QScreen *screenAtPoint = QGuiApplication::screenAt(point: q->pos()))
8690 screen = screenAtPoint->geometry();
8691 else
8692 screen = QGuiApplication::primaryScreen()->geometry();
8693
8694 s.setWidth(qMin(a: s.width(), b: screen.width()*2/3));
8695 s.setHeight(qMin(a: s.height(), b: screen.height()*2/3));
8696
8697 if (QTLWExtra *extra = maybeTopData())
8698 extra->sizeAdjusted = true;
8699 }
8700
8701 if (!s.isValid()) {
8702 QRect r = q->childrenRect(); // get children rectangle
8703 if (r.isNull())
8704 return s;
8705 s = r.size() + QSize(2 * r.x(), 2 * r.y());
8706 }
8707
8708 return s;
8709}
8710
8711/*!
8712 Adjusts the size of the widget to fit its contents.
8713
8714 This function uses sizeHint() if it is valid, i.e., the size hint's width
8715 and height are \>= 0. Otherwise, it sets the size to the children
8716 rectangle that covers all child widgets (the union of all child widget
8717 rectangles).
8718
8719 For windows, the screen size is also taken into account. If the sizeHint()
8720 is less than (200, 100) and the size policy is \l{QSizePolicy::Expanding}
8721 {expanding}, the window will be at least (200, 100). The maximum size of
8722 a window is 2/3 of the screen's width and height.
8723
8724 \sa sizeHint(), childrenRect()
8725*/
8726
8727void QWidget::adjustSize()
8728{
8729 Q_D(QWidget);
8730 ensurePolished();
8731 QSize s = d->adjustedSize();
8732
8733 if (d->layout)
8734 d->layout->activate();
8735
8736 if (s.isValid())
8737 resize(s);
8738}
8739
8740
8741/*!
8742 \property QWidget::sizeHint
8743 \brief the recommended size for the widget
8744
8745 If the value of this property is an invalid size, no size is
8746 recommended.
8747
8748 The default implementation of sizeHint() returns an invalid size
8749 if there is no layout for this widget, and returns the layout's
8750 preferred size otherwise.
8751
8752 \sa QSize::isValid(), minimumSizeHint(), sizePolicy(),
8753 setMinimumSize(), updateGeometry()
8754*/
8755
8756QSize QWidget::sizeHint() const
8757{
8758 Q_D(const QWidget);
8759 if (d->layout)
8760 return d->layout->totalSizeHint();
8761 return QSize(-1, -1);
8762}
8763
8764/*!
8765 \property QWidget::minimumSizeHint
8766 \brief the recommended minimum size for the widget
8767
8768 If the value of this property is an invalid size, no minimum size
8769 is recommended.
8770
8771 The default implementation of minimumSizeHint() returns an invalid
8772 size if there is no layout for this widget, and returns the
8773 layout's minimum size otherwise. Most built-in widgets reimplement
8774 minimumSizeHint().
8775
8776 \l QLayout will never resize a widget to a size smaller than the
8777 minimum size hint unless minimumSize() is set or the size policy is
8778 set to QSizePolicy::Ignore. If minimumSize() is set, the minimum
8779 size hint will be ignored.
8780
8781 \sa QSize::isValid(), resize(), setMinimumSize(), sizePolicy()
8782*/
8783QSize QWidget::minimumSizeHint() const
8784{
8785 Q_D(const QWidget);
8786 if (d->layout)
8787 return d->layout->totalMinimumSize();
8788 return QSize(-1, -1);
8789}
8790
8791
8792/*!
8793 \fn QWidget *QWidget::parentWidget() const
8794
8795 Returns the parent of this widget, or \nullptr if it does not have any
8796 parent widget.
8797*/
8798
8799
8800/*!
8801 Returns \c true if this widget is a parent, (or grandparent and so on
8802 to any level), of the given \a child, and both widgets are within
8803 the same window; otherwise returns \c false.
8804*/
8805
8806bool QWidget::isAncestorOf(const QWidget *child) const
8807{
8808 while (child) {
8809 if (child == this)
8810 return true;
8811 if (child->isWindow())
8812 return false;
8813 child = child->parentWidget();
8814 }
8815 return false;
8816}
8817
8818/*****************************************************************************
8819 QWidget event handling
8820 *****************************************************************************/
8821
8822/*!
8823 This is the main event handler; it handles event \a event. You can
8824 reimplement this function in a subclass, but we recommend using
8825 one of the specialized event handlers instead.
8826
8827 Key press and release events are treated differently from other
8828 events. event() checks for Tab and Shift+Tab and tries to move the
8829 focus appropriately. If there is no widget to move the focus to
8830 (or the key press is not Tab or Shift+Tab), event() calls
8831 keyPressEvent().
8832
8833 Mouse and tablet event handling is also slightly special: only
8834 when the widget is \l enabled, event() will call the specialized
8835 handlers such as mousePressEvent(); otherwise it will discard the
8836 event.
8837
8838 This function returns \c true if the event was recognized, otherwise
8839 it returns \c false. If the recognized event was accepted (see \l
8840 QEvent::accepted), any further processing such as event
8841 propagation to the parent widget stops.
8842
8843 \sa closeEvent(), focusInEvent(), focusOutEvent(), enterEvent(),
8844 keyPressEvent(), keyReleaseEvent(), leaveEvent(),
8845 mouseDoubleClickEvent(), mouseMoveEvent(), mousePressEvent(),
8846 mouseReleaseEvent(), moveEvent(), paintEvent(), resizeEvent(),
8847 QObject::event(), QObject::timerEvent()
8848*/
8849
8850bool QWidget::event(QEvent *event)
8851{
8852 Q_D(QWidget);
8853
8854 // ignore mouse and key events when disabled
8855 if (!isEnabled()) {
8856 switch(event->type()) {
8857 case QEvent::TabletPress:
8858 case QEvent::TabletRelease:
8859 case QEvent::TabletMove:
8860 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
8861 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
8862 case QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick:
8863 case QEvent::MouseMove:
8864 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
8865 case QEvent::TouchUpdate:
8866 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
8867 case QEvent::TouchCancel:
8868 case QEvent::ContextMenu:
8869 case QEvent::KeyPress:
8870 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
8871#if QT_CONFIG(wheelevent)
8872 case QEvent::Wheel:
8873#endif
8874 return false;
8875 default:
8876 break;
8877 }
8878 }
8879 switch (event->type()) {
8880 case QEvent::PlatformSurface: {
8881 // Sync up QWidget's view of whether or not the widget has been created
8882 switch (static_cast<QPlatformSurfaceEvent*>(event)->surfaceEventType()) {
8883 case QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceCreated:
8884 if (!testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
8885 create();
8886 break;
8887 case QPlatformSurfaceEvent::SurfaceAboutToBeDestroyed:
8888 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)) {
8889 // Child windows have already been destroyed by QWindow,
8890 // so we skip them here.
8891 destroy(destroyWindow: false, destroySubWindows: false);
8892 }
8893 break;
8894 }
8895 break;
8896 }
8897 case QEvent::MouseMove:
8898 mouseMoveEvent(event: (QMouseEvent*)event);
8899 break;
8900
8901 case QEvent::MouseButtonPress:
8902 mousePressEvent(event: (QMouseEvent*)event);
8903 break;
8904
8905 case QEvent::MouseButtonRelease:
8906 mouseReleaseEvent(event: (QMouseEvent*)event);
8907 break;
8908
8909 case QEvent::MouseButtonDblClick:
8910 mouseDoubleClickEvent(event: (QMouseEvent*)event);
8911 break;
8912#if QT_CONFIG(wheelevent)
8913 case QEvent::Wheel:
8914 wheelEvent(event: (QWheelEvent*)event);
8915 break;
8916#endif
8917#if QT_CONFIG(tabletevent)
8918 case QEvent::TabletMove:
8919 if (static_cast<QTabletEvent *>(event)->buttons() == Qt::NoButton && !testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_TabletTracking))
8920 break;
8921 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
8922 case QEvent::TabletPress:
8923 case QEvent::TabletRelease:
8924 tabletEvent(event: (QTabletEvent*)event);
8925 break;
8926#endif
8927 case QEvent::KeyPress: {
8928 QKeyEvent *k = static_cast<QKeyEvent *>(event);
8929 bool res = false;
8930 if (!(k->modifiers() & (Qt::ControlModifier | Qt::AltModifier))) { //### Add MetaModifier?
8931 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Backtab
8932 || (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab && (k->modifiers() & Qt::ShiftModifier)))
8933 res = focusNextPrevChild(next: false);
8934 else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Tab)
8935 res = focusNextPrevChild(next: true);
8936 if (res)
8937 break;
8938 }
8939 keyPressEvent(event: k);
8940#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
8941 if (!k->isAccepted() && QApplication::keypadNavigationEnabled()
8942 && !(k->modifiers() & (Qt::ControlModifier | Qt::AltModifier | Qt::ShiftModifier))) {
8943 if (QApplication::navigationMode() == Qt::NavigationModeKeypadTabOrder) {
8944 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Up)
8945 res = focusNextPrevChild(false);
8946 else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Down)
8947 res = focusNextPrevChild(true);
8948 } else if (QApplication::navigationMode() == Qt::NavigationModeKeypadDirectional) {
8949 if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Up)
8950 res = QWidgetPrivate::navigateToDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionNorth);
8951 else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Right)
8952 res = QWidgetPrivate::navigateToDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionEast);
8953 else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Down)
8954 res = QWidgetPrivate::navigateToDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionSouth);
8955 else if (k->key() == Qt::Key_Left)
8956 res = QWidgetPrivate::navigateToDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionWest);
8957 }
8958 if (res) {
8959 k->accept();
8960 break;
8961 }
8962 }
8963#endif
8964#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
8965 if (!k->isAccepted()
8966 && k->modifiers() & Qt::ShiftModifier && k->key() == Qt::Key_F1
8967 && d->whatsThis.size()) {
8968 QWhatsThis::showText(pos: mapToGlobal(inputMethodQuery(Qt::ImCursorRectangle).toRect().center()), text: d->whatsThis, w: this);
8969 k->accept();
8970 }
8971#endif
8972 }
8973 break;
8974
8975 case QEvent::KeyRelease:
8976 keyReleaseEvent(event: (QKeyEvent*)event);
8977 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
8978 case QEvent::ShortcutOverride:
8979 break;
8980
8981 case QEvent::InputMethod:
8982 inputMethodEvent((QInputMethodEvent *) event);
8983 break;
8984
8985 case QEvent::InputMethodQuery: {
8986 QInputMethodQueryEvent *query = static_cast<QInputMethodQueryEvent *>(event);
8987 Qt::InputMethodQueries queries = query->queries();
8988 for (uint i = 0; i < 32; ++i) {
8989 Qt::InputMethodQuery q = (Qt::InputMethodQuery)(int)(queries & (1<<i));
8990 if (q) {
8991 QVariant v = inputMethodQuery(q);
8992 if (q == Qt::ImEnabled && !v.isValid() && isEnabled()) {
8993 // Qt:ImEnabled was added in Qt 5.3. So not all widgets support it, even
8994 // if they implement IM otherwise (by overriding inputMethodQuery()). Instead
8995 // they set the widget attribute Qt::WA_InputMethodEnabled. But this attribute
8996 // will only be set if the widget supports IM _and_ is not read-only. So for
8997 // read-only widgets, not all IM features will be supported when ImEnabled is
8998 // not implemented explicitly (e.g selection handles for read-only widgets on iOS).
8999 v = QVariant(testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_InputMethodEnabled));
9000 }
9001 query->setValue(query: q, value: v);
9002 }
9003 }
9004 query->accept();
9005 }
9006 break;
9007
9008 case QEvent::PolishRequest:
9009 ensurePolished();
9010 break;
9011
9012 case QEvent::Polish: {
9013 style()->polish(widget: this);
9014 setAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Polished);
9015 if (!QApplication::font(this).isCopyOf(QApplication::font()))
9016 d->resolveFont();
9017 if (!QApplication::palette(this).isCopyOf(p: QGuiApplication::palette()))
9018 d->resolvePalette();
9019 }
9020 break;
9021
9022 case QEvent::ApplicationWindowIconChange:
9023 if (isWindow() && !testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_SetWindowIcon)) {
9024 d->setWindowIcon_sys();
9025 d->setWindowIcon_helper();
9026 }
9027 break;
9028 case QEvent::FocusIn:
9029 focusInEvent(event: (QFocusEvent*)event);
9030 d->updateWidgetTransform(event);
9031 break;
9032
9033 case QEvent::FocusOut:
9034 focusOutEvent(event: (QFocusEvent*)event);
9035 break;
9036
9037 case QEvent::Enter:
9038#if QT_CONFIG(statustip)
9039 if (d->statusTip.size()) {
9040 QStatusTipEvent tip(d->statusTip);
9041 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: const_cast<QWidget *>(this), event: &tip);
9042 }
9043#endif
9044 enterEvent(event: static_cast<QEnterEvent*>(event));
9045 break;
9046
9047 case QEvent::Leave:
9048#if QT_CONFIG(statustip)
9049 if (d->statusTip.size()) {
9050 QString empty;
9051 QStatusTipEvent tip(empty);
9052 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: const_cast<QWidget *>(this), event: &tip);
9053 }
9054#endif
9055 leaveEvent(event);
9056 break;
9057
9058 case QEvent::HoverEnter:
9059 case QEvent::HoverLeave:
9060 update();
9061 break;
9062
9063 case QEvent::Paint:
9064 // At this point the event has to be delivered, regardless
9065 // whether the widget isVisible() or not because it
9066 // already went through the filters
9067 paintEvent(event: (QPaintEvent*)event);
9068 break;
9069
9070 case QEvent::Move:
9071 moveEvent(event: (QMoveEvent*)event);
9072 d->updateWidgetTransform(event);
9073 break;
9074
9075 case QEvent::Resize:
9076 resizeEvent(event: (QResizeEvent*)event);
9077 d->updateWidgetTransform(event);
9078 break;
9079
9080 case QEvent::Close:
9081 closeEvent(event: (QCloseEvent *)event);
9082 break;
9083
9084#ifndef QT_NO_CONTEXTMENU
9085 case QEvent::ContextMenu:
9086 switch (data->context_menu_policy) {
9087 case Qt::PreventContextMenu:
9088 break;
9089 case Qt::DefaultContextMenu:
9090 contextMenuEvent(event: static_cast<QContextMenuEvent *>(event));
9091 break;
9092 case Qt::CustomContextMenu:
9093 emit customContextMenuRequested(pos: static_cast<QContextMenuEvent *>(event)->pos());
9094 break;
9095#if QT_CONFIG(menu)
9096 case Qt::ActionsContextMenu:
9097 if (d->actions.size()) {
9098 QMenu::exec(actions: d->actions, pos: static_cast<QContextMenuEvent *>(event)->globalPos(),
9099 at: nullptr, parent: this);
9100 break;
9101 }
9102 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
9103#endif
9104 default:
9105 event->ignore();
9106 break;
9107 }
9108 break;
9109#endif // QT_NO_CONTEXTMENU
9110
9111#if QT_CONFIG(draganddrop)
9112 case QEvent::Drop:
9113 dropEvent(event: (QDropEvent*) event);
9114 break;
9115
9116 case QEvent::DragEnter:
9117 dragEnterEvent(event: (QDragEnterEvent*) event);
9118 break;
9119
9120 case QEvent::DragMove:
9121 dragMoveEvent(event: (QDragMoveEvent*) event);
9122 break;
9123
9124 case QEvent::DragLeave:
9125 dragLeaveEvent(event: (QDragLeaveEvent*) event);
9126 break;
9127#endif
9128
9129 case QEvent::Show:
9130 showEvent(event: (QShowEvent*) event);
9131 break;
9132
9133 case QEvent::Hide:
9134 hideEvent(event: (QHideEvent*) event);
9135 break;
9136
9137 case QEvent::ShowWindowRequest:
9138 if (!isHidden())
9139 d->show_sys();
9140 break;
9141
9142 case QEvent::ApplicationFontChange:
9143 d->resolveFont();
9144 break;
9145 case QEvent::ApplicationPaletteChange:
9146 if (!(windowType() == Qt::Desktop))
9147 d->resolvePalette();
9148 break;
9149
9150 case QEvent::ToolBarChange:
9151 case QEvent::ActivationChange:
9152 case QEvent::EnabledChange:
9153 case QEvent::FontChange:
9154 case QEvent::StyleChange:
9155 case QEvent::PaletteChange:
9156 case QEvent::WindowTitleChange:
9157 case QEvent::IconTextChange:
9158 case QEvent::ModifiedChange:
9159 case QEvent::MouseTrackingChange:
9160 case QEvent::TabletTrackingChange:
9161 case QEvent::ParentChange:
9162 case QEvent::LocaleChange:
9163 case QEvent::MacSizeChange:
9164 case QEvent::ContentsRectChange:
9165 case QEvent::ThemeChange:
9166 case QEvent::ReadOnlyChange:
9167 changeEvent(event);
9168 break;
9169
9170 case QEvent::WindowStateChange: {
9171 const bool wasMinimized = static_cast<const QWindowStateChangeEvent *>(event)->oldState() & Qt::WindowMinimized;
9172 if (wasMinimized != isMinimized()) {
9173 QWidget *widget = const_cast<QWidget *>(this);
9174 if (wasMinimized) {
9175 // Always send the spontaneous events here, otherwise it can break the application!
9176 if (!d->childrenShownByExpose) {
9177 // Show widgets only when they are not yet shown by the expose event
9178 d->showChildren(spontaneous: true);
9179 QShowEvent showEvent;
9180 QCoreApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &showEvent);
9181 }
9182 d->childrenHiddenByWState = false; // Set it always to "false" when window is restored
9183 } else {
9184 QHideEvent hideEvent;
9185 QCoreApplication::sendSpontaneousEvent(receiver: widget, event: &hideEvent);
9186 d->hideChildren(spontaneous: true);
9187 d->childrenHiddenByWState = true;
9188 }
9189 d->childrenShownByExpose = false; // Set it always to "false" when window state changes
9190 }
9191 changeEvent(event);
9192 }
9193 break;
9194
9195 case QEvent::WindowActivate:
9196 case QEvent::WindowDeactivate: {
9197 if (isVisible() && !palette().isEqual(cr1: QPalette::Active, cr2: QPalette::Inactive))
9198 update();
9199 QList<QObject*> childList = d->children;
9200 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); ++i) {
9201 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: childList.at(i));
9202 if (w && w->isVisible() && !w->isWindow())
9203 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event);
9204 }
9205 break; }
9206
9207 case QEvent::LanguageChange:
9208 changeEvent(event);
9209 {
9210 QList<QObject*> childList = d->children;
9211 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); ++i) {
9212 QObject *o = childList.at(i);
9213 if (o)
9214 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: o, event);
9215 }
9216 }
9217 update();
9218 break;
9219
9220 case QEvent::ApplicationLayoutDirectionChange:
9221 d->resolveLayoutDirection();
9222 break;
9223
9224 case QEvent::LayoutDirectionChange:
9225 if (d->layout)
9226 d->layout->invalidate();
9227 update();
9228 changeEvent(event);
9229 break;
9230 case QEvent::UpdateRequest:
9231 d->syncBackingStore();
9232 break;
9233 case QEvent::UpdateLater:
9234 update(static_cast<QUpdateLaterEvent*>(event)->region());
9235 break;
9236 case QEvent::StyleAnimationUpdate:
9237 if (isVisible() && !window()->isMinimized()) {
9238 event->accept();
9239 update();
9240 }
9241 break;
9242
9243 case QEvent::WindowBlocked:
9244 case QEvent::WindowUnblocked:
9245 if (!d->children.isEmpty()) {
9246 QWidget *modalWidget = QApplication::activeModalWidget();
9247 for (int i = 0; i < d->children.size(); ++i) {
9248 QObject *o = d->children.at(i);
9249 if (o && o != modalWidget && o->isWidgetType()) {
9250 QWidget *w = static_cast<QWidget *>(o);
9251 // do not forward the event to child windows; QApplication does this for us
9252 if (!w->isWindow())
9253 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event);
9254 }
9255 }
9256 }
9257 break;
9258#if QT_CONFIG(tooltip)
9259 case QEvent::ToolTip:
9260 if (!d->toolTip.isEmpty())
9261 QToolTip::showText(pos: static_cast<QHelpEvent*>(event)->globalPos(), text: d->toolTip, w: this, rect: QRect(), msecShowTime: d->toolTipDuration);
9262 else
9263 event->ignore();
9264 break;
9265#endif
9266#if QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
9267 case QEvent::WhatsThis:
9268 if (d->whatsThis.size())
9269 QWhatsThis::showText(pos: static_cast<QHelpEvent *>(event)->globalPos(), text: d->whatsThis, w: this);
9270 else
9271 event->ignore();
9272 break;
9273 case QEvent::QueryWhatsThis:
9274 if (d->whatsThis.isEmpty())
9275 event->ignore();
9276 break;
9277#endif
9278 case QEvent::EmbeddingControl:
9279 d->topData()->frameStrut.setCoords(xp1: 0 ,yp1: 0, xp2: 0, yp2: 0);
9280 data->fstrut_dirty = false;
9281 break;
9282#ifndef QT_NO_ACTION
9283 case QEvent::ActionAdded:
9284 case QEvent::ActionRemoved:
9285 case QEvent::ActionChanged:
9286 actionEvent(event: (QActionEvent*)event);
9287 break;
9288#endif
9289
9290 case QEvent::KeyboardLayoutChange:
9291 {
9292 changeEvent(event);
9293
9294 // inform children of the change
9295 QList<QObject*> childList = d->children;
9296 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); ++i) {
9297 QWidget *w = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: childList.at(i));
9298 if (w && w->isVisible() && !w->isWindow())
9299 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: w, event);
9300 }
9301 break;
9302 }
9303 case QEvent::TouchBegin:
9304 case QEvent::TouchUpdate:
9305 case QEvent::TouchEnd:
9306 case QEvent::TouchCancel:
9307 {
9308 event->ignore();
9309 break;
9310 }
9311#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
9312 case QEvent::Gesture:
9313 event->ignore();
9314 break;
9315#endif
9316 case QEvent::ScreenChangeInternal:
9317 if (const QTLWExtra *te = d->maybeTopData()) {
9318 const QWindow *win = te->window;
9319 d->setWinId((win && win->handle()) ? win->handle()->winId() : 0);
9320 }
9321 if (d->data.fnt.d->dpi != logicalDpiY())
9322 d->updateFont(font: d->data.fnt);
9323 d->renderToTextureReallyDirty = 1;
9324 break;
9325 case QEvent::DynamicPropertyChange: {
9326 const QByteArray &propName = static_cast<QDynamicPropertyChangeEvent *>(event)->propertyName();
9327 if (propName.size() == 13 && !qstrncmp(str1: propName, str2: "_q_customDpi", len: 12)) {
9328 uint value = property(name: propName.constData()).toUInt();
9329 if (!d->extra)
9330 d->createExtra();
9331 const char axis = propName.at(i: 12);
9332 if (axis == 'X')
9333 d->extra->customDpiX = value;
9334 else if (axis == 'Y')
9335 d->extra->customDpiY = value;
9336 d->updateFont(font: d->data.fnt);
9337 }
9338 if (windowHandle() && !qstrncmp(str1: propName, str2: "_q_platform_", len: 12))
9339 windowHandle()->setProperty(name: propName, value: property(name: propName));
9340 Q_FALLTHROUGH();
9341 }
9342 default:
9343 return QObject::event(event);
9344 }
9345 return true;
9346}
9347
9348/*!
9349 This event handler can be reimplemented to handle state changes.
9350
9351 The state being changed in this event can be retrieved through the \a event
9352 supplied.
9353
9354 Change events include: QEvent::ToolBarChange,
9355 QEvent::ActivationChange, QEvent::EnabledChange, QEvent::FontChange,
9356 QEvent::StyleChange, QEvent::PaletteChange,
9357 QEvent::WindowTitleChange, QEvent::IconTextChange,
9358 QEvent::ModifiedChange, QEvent::MouseTrackingChange,
9359 QEvent::ParentChange, QEvent::WindowStateChange,
9360 QEvent::LanguageChange, QEvent::LocaleChange,
9361 QEvent::LayoutDirectionChange, QEvent::ReadOnlyChange.
9362
9363*/
9364void QWidget::changeEvent(QEvent * event)
9365{
9366 switch(event->type()) {
9367 case QEvent::EnabledChange: {
9368 update();
9369#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
9370 QAccessible::State s;
9371 s.disabled = true;
9372 QAccessibleStateChangeEvent event(this, s);
9373 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
9374#endif
9375 break;
9376 }
9377
9378 case QEvent::FontChange:
9379 case QEvent::StyleChange: {
9380 Q_D(QWidget);
9381 update();
9382 updateGeometry();
9383 if (d->layout)
9384 d->layout->invalidate();
9385 break;
9386 }
9387
9388 case QEvent::PaletteChange:
9389 update();
9390 break;
9391
9392 case QEvent::ThemeChange:
9393 if (QGuiApplication::desktopSettingsAware() && windowType() != Qt::Desktop
9394 && qApp && !QCoreApplication::closingDown()) {
9395 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Polished))
9396 QApplication::style()->unpolish(widget: this);
9397 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Polished))
9398 QApplication::style()->polish(widget: this);
9399 QEvent styleChangedEvent(QEvent::StyleChange);
9400 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &styleChangedEvent);
9401 if (isVisible())
9402 update();
9403 }
9404 break;
9405
9406#ifdef Q_OS_MAC
9407 case QEvent::MacSizeChange:
9408 updateGeometry();
9409 break;
9410#endif
9411
9412 default:
9413 break;
9414 }
9415}
9416
9417/*!
9418 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a
9419 subclass to receive mouse move events for the widget.
9420
9421 If mouse tracking is switched off, mouse move events only occur if
9422 a mouse button is pressed while the mouse is being moved. If mouse
9423 tracking is switched on, mouse move events occur even if no mouse
9424 button is pressed.
9425
9426 QMouseEvent::pos() reports the position of the mouse cursor,
9427 relative to this widget. For press and release events, the
9428 position is usually the same as the position of the last mouse
9429 move event, but it might be different if the user's hand shakes.
9430 This is a feature of the underlying window system, not Qt.
9431
9432 If you want to show a tooltip immediately, while the mouse is
9433 moving (e.g., to get the mouse coordinates with QMouseEvent::pos()
9434 and show them as a tooltip), you must first enable mouse tracking
9435 as described above. Then, to ensure that the tooltip is updated
9436 immediately, you must call QToolTip::showText() instead of
9437 setToolTip() in your implementation of mouseMoveEvent().
9438
9439 \sa setMouseTracking(), mousePressEvent(), mouseReleaseEvent(),
9440 mouseDoubleClickEvent(), event(), QMouseEvent, {Scribble Example}
9441*/
9442
9443void QWidget::mouseMoveEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
9444{
9445 event->ignore();
9446}
9447
9448/*!
9449 This event handler, for event \a event, can be reimplemented in a
9450 subclass to receive mouse press events for the widget.
9451
9452 If you create new widgets in the mousePressEvent() the
