11615 d->whatsThis = s;
11616}
11617
11618QString QWidget::whatsThis() const
11619{
11620 Q_D(const QWidget);
11621 return d->whatsThis;
11622}
11623#endif // QT_CONFIG(whatsthis)
11624
11625#if QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
11626/*!
11627 \property QWidget::accessibleName
11628
11629 \brief the widget's name as seen by assistive technologies
11630
11631 This is the primary name by which assistive technology such as screen readers
11632 announce this widget. For most widgets setting this property is not required.
11633 For example for QPushButton the button's text will be used.
11634
11635 It is important to set this property when the widget does not provide any
11636 text. For example a button that only contains an icon needs to set this
11637 property to work with screen readers.
11638 The name should be short and equivalent to the visual information conveyed
11639 by the widget.
11640
11641 This property has to be \l{Internationalization with Qt}{localized}.
11642
11643 By default, this property contains an empty string.
11644
11645 \sa QWidget::accessibleDescription, QAccessibleInterface::text()
11646*/
11647void QWidget::setAccessibleName(const QString &name)
11648{
11649 Q_D(QWidget);
11650 d->accessibleName = name;
11651 QAccessibleEvent event(this, QAccessible::NameChanged);
11652 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
11653}
11654
11655QString QWidget::accessibleName() const
11656{
11657 Q_D(const QWidget);
11658 return d->accessibleName;
11659}
11660
11661/*!
11662 \property QWidget::accessibleDescription
11663
11664 \brief the widget's description as seen by assistive technologies
11665
11666 The accessible description of a widget should convey what a widget does.
11667 While the \l accessibleName should be a short and concise string (e.g. \gui{Save}),
11668 the description should give more context, such as \gui{Saves the current document}.
11669
11670 This property has to be \l{Internationalization with Qt}{localized}.
11671
11672 By default, this property contains an empty string and Qt falls back
11673 to using the tool tip to provide this information.
11674
11675 \sa QWidget::accessibleName, QAccessibleInterface::text()
11676*/
11677void QWidget::setAccessibleDescription(const QString &description)
11678{
11679 Q_D(QWidget);
11680 d->accessibleDescription = description;
11681 QAccessibleEvent event(this, QAccessible::DescriptionChanged);
11682 QAccessible::updateAccessibility(event: &event);
11683}
11684
11685QString QWidget::accessibleDescription() const
11686{
11687 Q_D(const QWidget);
11688 return d->accessibleDescription;
11689}
11690#endif // QT_CONFIG(accessibility)
11691
11692#ifndef QT_NO_SHORTCUT
11693/*!
11694 Adds a shortcut to Qt's shortcut system that watches for the given
11695 \a key sequence in the given \a context. If the \a context is
11696 Qt::ApplicationShortcut, the shortcut applies to the application as a
11697 whole. Otherwise, it is either local to this widget, Qt::WidgetShortcut,
11698 or to the window itself, Qt::WindowShortcut.
11699
11700 If the same \a key sequence has been grabbed by several widgets,
11701 when the \a key sequence occurs a QEvent::Shortcut event is sent
11702 to all the widgets to which it applies in a non-deterministic
11703 order, but with the ``ambiguous'' flag set to true.
11704
11705 \warning You should not normally need to use this function;
11706 instead create \l{QAction}s with the shortcut key sequences you
11707 require (if you also want equivalent menu options and toolbar
11708 buttons), or create \l{QShortcut}s if you just need key sequences.
11709 Both QAction and QShortcut handle all the event filtering for you,
11710 and provide signals which are triggered when the user triggers the
11711 key sequence, so are much easier to use than this low-level
11712 function.
11713
11714 \sa releaseShortcut(), setShortcutEnabled()
11715*/
11716int QWidget::grabShortcut(const QKeySequence &key, Qt::ShortcutContext context)
11717{
11718 Q_ASSERT(qApp);
11719 if (key.isEmpty())
11720 return 0;
11721 setAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_GrabbedShortcut);
11722 return QGuiApplicationPrivate::instance()->shortcutMap.addShortcut(owner: this, key, context, matcher: qWidgetShortcutContextMatcher);
11723}
11724
11725/*!
11726 Removes the shortcut with the given \a id from Qt's shortcut
11727 system. The widget will no longer receive QEvent::Shortcut events
11728 for the shortcut's key sequence (unless it has other shortcuts
11729 with the same key sequence).
11730
11731 \warning You should not normally need to use this function since
11732 Qt's shortcut system removes shortcuts automatically when their
11733 parent widget is destroyed. It is best to use QAction or
11734 QShortcut to handle shortcuts, since they are easier to use than
11735 this low-level function. Note also that this is an expensive
11736 operation.
11737
11738 \sa grabShortcut(), setShortcutEnabled()
11739*/
11740void QWidget::releaseShortcut(int id)
11741{
11742 Q_ASSERT(qApp);
11743 if (id)
11744 QGuiApplicationPrivate::instance()->shortcutMap.removeShortcut(id, owner: this, key: 0);
11745}
11746
11747/*!
11748 If \a enable is true, the shortcut with the given \a id is
11749 enabled; otherwise the shortcut is disabled.
11750
11751 \warning You should not normally need to use this function since
11752 Qt's shortcut system enables/disables shortcuts automatically as
11753 widgets become hidden/visible and gain or lose focus. It is best
11754 to use QAction or QShortcut to handle shortcuts, since they are
11755 easier to use than this low-level function.
11756
11757 \sa grabShortcut(), releaseShortcut()
11758*/
11759void QWidget::setShortcutEnabled(int id, bool enable)
11760{
11761 Q_ASSERT(qApp);
11762 if (id)
11763 QGuiApplicationPrivate::instance()->shortcutMap.setShortcutEnabled(enable, id, owner: this, key: 0);
11764}
11765
11766/*!
11767 \since 4.2
11768
11769 If \a enable is true, auto repeat of the shortcut with the
11770 given \a id is enabled; otherwise it is disabled.
11771
11772 \sa grabShortcut(), releaseShortcut()
11773*/
11774void QWidget::setShortcutAutoRepeat(int id, bool enable)
11775{
11776 Q_ASSERT(qApp);
11777 if (id)
11778 QGuiApplicationPrivate::instance()->shortcutMap.setShortcutAutoRepeat(on: enable, id, owner: this, key: 0);
11779}
11780#endif // QT_NO_SHORTCUT
11781
11782/*!
11783 Updates the widget's micro focus and informs input methods
11784 that the state specified by \a query has changed.
11785*/
11786void QWidget::updateMicroFocus(Qt::InputMethodQuery query)
11787{
11788 if (this == QGuiApplication::focusObject())
11789 QGuiApplication::inputMethod()->update(queries: query);
11790}
11791
11792/*!
11793 Raises this widget to the top of the parent widget's stack.
11794
11795 After this call the widget will be visually in front of any
11796 overlapping sibling widgets.
11797
11798 \note When using activateWindow(), you can call this function to
11799 ensure that the window is stacked on top.
11800
11801 \sa lower(), stackUnder()
11802*/
11803
11804void QWidget::raise()
11805{
11806 Q_D(QWidget);
11807 if (!isWindow()) {
11808 QWidget *p = parentWidget();
11809 const int parentChildCount = p->d_func()->children.size();
11810 if (parentChildCount < 2)
11811 return;
11812 const int from = p->d_func()->children.indexOf(t: this);
11813 Q_ASSERT(from >= 0);
11814 // Do nothing if the widget is already in correct stacking order _and_ created.
11815 if (from != parentChildCount -1)
11816 p->d_func()->children.move(from, to: parentChildCount - 1);
11817 if (!testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created) && p->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11818 create();
11819 else if (from == parentChildCount - 1)
11820 return;
11821
11822 QRegion region(rect());
11823 d->subtractOpaqueSiblings(sourceRegion&: region);
11824 d->invalidateBackingStore(region);
11825 }
11826 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11827 d->raise_sys();
11828
11829 if (d->extra && d->extra->hasWindowContainer)
11830 QWindowContainer::parentWasRaised(parent: this);
11831
11832 QEvent e(QEvent::ZOrderChange);
11833 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &e);
11834}
11835
11836void QWidgetPrivate::raise_sys()
11837{
11838 Q_Q(QWidget);
11839 if (q->isWindow() || q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NativeWindow)) {
11840 q->windowHandle()->raise();
11841 } else if (renderToTexture) {
11842 if (QWidget *p = q->parentWidget()) {
11843 setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
11844 p->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(effectiveRectFor(rect: q->geometry()));
11845 }
11846 }
11847}
11848
11849/*!
11850 Lowers the widget to the bottom of the parent widget's stack.
11851
11852 After this call the widget will be visually behind (and therefore
11853 obscured by) any overlapping sibling widgets.
11854
11855 \sa raise(), stackUnder()
11856*/
11857
11858void QWidget::lower()
11859{
11860 Q_D(QWidget);
11861 if (!isWindow()) {
11862 QWidget *p = parentWidget();
11863 const int parentChildCount = p->d_func()->children.size();
11864 if (parentChildCount < 2)
11865 return;
11866 const int from = p->d_func()->children.indexOf(t: this);
11867 Q_ASSERT(from >= 0);
11868 // Do nothing if the widget is already in correct stacking order _and_ created.
11869 if (from != 0)
11870 p->d_func()->children.move(from, to: 0);
11871 if (!testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created) && p->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11872 create();
11873 else if (from == 0)
11874 return;
11875 }
11876 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11877 d->lower_sys();
11878
11879 if (d->extra && d->extra->hasWindowContainer)
11880 QWindowContainer::parentWasLowered(parent: this);
11881
11882 QEvent e(QEvent::ZOrderChange);
11883 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &e);
11884}
11885
11886void QWidgetPrivate::lower_sys()
11887{
11888 Q_Q(QWidget);
11889 if (q->isWindow() || q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NativeWindow)) {
11890 Q_ASSERT(q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_WState_Created));
11891 q->windowHandle()->lower();
11892 } else if (QWidget *p = q->parentWidget()) {
11893 setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
11894 p->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(effectiveRectFor(rect: q->geometry()));
11895 }
11896}
11897
11898/*!
11899 Places the widget under \a w in the parent widget's stack.
11900
11901 To make this work, the widget itself and \a w must be siblings.
11902
11903 \sa raise(), lower()
11904*/
11905void QWidget::stackUnder(QWidget* w)
11906{
11907 Q_D(QWidget);
11908 QWidget *p = parentWidget();
11909 if (!w || isWindow() || p != w->parentWidget() || this == w)
11910 return;
11911 if (p) {
11912 int from = p->d_func()->children.indexOf(t: this);
11913 int to = p->d_func()->children.indexOf(t: w);
11914 Q_ASSERT(from >= 0);
11915 Q_ASSERT(to >= 0);
11916 if (from < to)
11917 --to;
11918 // Do nothing if the widget is already in correct stacking order _and_ created.
11919 if (from != to)
11920 p->d_func()->children.move(from, to);
11921 if (!testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created) && p->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11922 create();
11923 else if (from == to)
11924 return;
11925 }
11926 if (testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11927 d->stackUnder_sys(w);
11928
11929 QEvent e(QEvent::ZOrderChange);
11930 QCoreApplication::sendEvent(receiver: this, event: &e);
11931}
11932
11933void QWidgetPrivate::stackUnder_sys(QWidget*)
11934{
11935 Q_Q(QWidget);
11936 if (QWidget *p = q->parentWidget()) {
11937 setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
11938 p->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(effectiveRectFor(rect: q->geometry()));
11939 }
11940}
11941
11942/*!
11943 \fn bool QWidget::isTopLevel() const
11944 \deprecated
11945
11946 Use isWindow() instead.
11947*/
11948
11949/*!
11950 \fn bool QWidget::isRightToLeft() const
11951 \internal
11952*/
11953
11954/*!
11955 \fn bool QWidget::isLeftToRight() const
11956 \internal
11957*/
11958
11959/*!
11960 \macro QWIDGETSIZE_MAX
11961 \relates QWidget
11962
11963 Defines the maximum size for a QWidget object.
11964
11965 The largest allowed size for a widget is QSize(QWIDGETSIZE_MAX,
11966 QWIDGETSIZE_MAX), i.e. QSize (16777215,16777215).
11967
11968 \sa QWidget::setMaximumSize()
11969*/
11970
11971/*!
11972 \fn QWidget::setupUi(QWidget *widget)
11973
11974 Sets up the user interface for the specified \a widget.
11975
11976 \note This function is available with widgets that derive from user
11977 interface descriptions created using \l{uic}.
11978
11979 \sa {Using a Designer UI File in Your Application}
11980*/
11981
11982QRect QWidgetPrivate::frameStrut() const
11983{
11984 Q_Q(const QWidget);
11985 if (!q->isWindow() || (q->windowType() == Qt::Desktop) || q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_DontShowOnScreen)) {
11986 // x2 = x1 + w - 1, so w/h = 1
11987 return QRect(0, 0, 1, 1);
11988 }
11989
11990 if (data.fstrut_dirty
11991 // ### Fix properly for 4.3
11992 && q->isVisible()
11993 && q->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
11994 const_cast<QWidgetPrivate *>(this)->updateFrameStrut();
11995
11996 return maybeTopData() ? maybeTopData()->frameStrut : QRect();
11997}
11998
11999void QWidgetPrivate::updateFrameStrut()
12000{
12001 Q_Q(QWidget);
12002 if (q->data->fstrut_dirty) {
12003 if (QTLWExtra *te = maybeTopData()) {
12004 if (te->window && te->window->handle()) {
12005 const QMargins margins = te->window->frameMargins();
12006 if (!margins.isNull()) {
12007 te->frameStrut.setCoords(xp1: margins.left(), yp1: margins.top(), xp2: margins.right(), yp2: margins.bottom());
12008 q->data->fstrut_dirty = false;
12009 }
12010 }
12011 }
12012 }
12013}
12014
12015#ifdef QT_KEYPAD_NAVIGATION
12016/*!
12017 \internal
12018
12019 Changes the focus from the current focusWidget to a widget in
12020 the \a direction.
12021
12022 Returns \c true, if there was a widget in that direction
12023*/
12024bool QWidgetPrivate::navigateToDirection(Direction direction)
12025{
12026 QWidget *targetWidget = widgetInNavigationDirection(direction);
12027 if (targetWidget)
12028 targetWidget->setFocus();
12029 return (targetWidget != 0);
12030}
12031
12032/*!
12033 \internal
12034
12035 Searches for a widget that is positioned in the \a direction, starting
12036 from the current focusWidget.
12037
12038 Returns the pointer to a found widget or \nullptr, if there was no widget
12039 in that direction.
12040*/
12041QWidget *QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(Direction direction)
12042{
12043 const QWidget *sourceWidget = QApplication::focusWidget();
12044 if (!sourceWidget)
12045 return nullptr;
12046 const QRect sourceRect = sourceWidget->rect().translated(sourceWidget->mapToGlobal(QPoint()));
12047 const int sourceX =
12048 (direction == DirectionNorth || direction == DirectionSouth) ?
12049 (sourceRect.left() + (sourceRect.right() - sourceRect.left()) / 2)
12050 :(direction == DirectionEast ? sourceRect.right() : sourceRect.left());
12051 const int sourceY =
12052 (direction == DirectionEast || direction == DirectionWest) ?
12053 (sourceRect.top() + (sourceRect.bottom() - sourceRect.top()) / 2)
12054 :(direction == DirectionSouth ? sourceRect.bottom() : sourceRect.top());
12055 const QPoint sourcePoint(sourceX, sourceY);
12056 const QPoint sourceCenter = sourceRect.center();
12057 const QWidget *sourceWindow = sourceWidget->window();
12058
12059 QWidget *targetWidget = nullptr;
12060 int shortestDistance = INT_MAX;
12061
12062 const auto targetCandidates = QApplication::allWidgets();
12063 for (QWidget *targetCandidate : targetCandidates) {
12064
12065 const QRect targetCandidateRect = targetCandidate->rect().translated(targetCandidate->mapToGlobal(QPoint()));
12066
12067 // For focus proxies, the child widget handling the focus can have keypad navigation focus,
12068 // but the owner of the proxy cannot.
12069 // Additionally, empty widgets should be ignored.
12070 if (targetCandidate->focusProxy() || targetCandidateRect.isEmpty())
12071 continue;
12072
12073 // Only navigate to a target widget that...
12074 if ( targetCandidate != sourceWidget
12075 // ...takes the focus,
12076 && targetCandidate->focusPolicy() & Qt::TabFocus
12077 // ...is above if DirectionNorth,
12078 && !(direction == DirectionNorth && targetCandidateRect.bottom() > sourceRect.top())
12079 // ...is on the right if DirectionEast,
12080 && !(direction == DirectionEast && targetCandidateRect.left() < sourceRect.right())
12081 // ...is below if DirectionSouth,
12082 && !(direction == DirectionSouth && targetCandidateRect.top() < sourceRect.bottom())
12083 // ...is on the left if DirectionWest,
12084 && !(direction == DirectionWest && targetCandidateRect.right() > sourceRect.left())
12085 // ...is enabled,
12086 && targetCandidate->isEnabled()
12087 // ...is visible,
12088 && targetCandidate->isVisible()
12089 // ...is in the same window,
12090 && targetCandidate->window() == sourceWindow) {
12091 const int targetCandidateDistance = [](const QPoint &sourcePoint,
12092 const QRect &targetCandidateRect) {
12093 int dx = 0;
12094 int dy = 0;
12095 if (p.x() < r.left())
12096 dx = r.left() - p.x();
12097 else if (p.x() > r.right())
12098 dx = p.x() - r.right();
12099 if (p.y() < r.top())
12100 dy = r.top() - p.y();
12101 else if (p.y() > r.bottom())
12102 dy = p.y() - r.bottom();
12103 return dx + dy;
12104 }();
12105 if (targetCandidateDistance < shortestDistance) {
12106 shortestDistance = targetCandidateDistance;
12107 targetWidget = targetCandidate;
12108 }
12109 }
12110 }
12111 return targetWidget;
12112}
12113
12114/*!
12115 \internal
12116
12117 Tells us if it there is currently a reachable widget by keypad navigation in
12118 a certain \a orientation.
12119 If no navigation is possible, occurring key events in that \a orientation may
12120 be used to interact with the value in the focused widget, even though it
12121 currently has not the editFocus.
12122
12123 \sa QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(), QWidget::hasEditFocus()
12124*/
12125bool QWidgetPrivate::canKeypadNavigate(Qt::Orientation orientation)
12126{
12127 return orientation == Qt::Horizontal?
12128 (QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionEast)
12129 || QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionWest))
12130 :(QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionNorth)
12131 || QWidgetPrivate::widgetInNavigationDirection(QWidgetPrivate::DirectionSouth));
12132}
12133/*!
12134 \internal
12135
12136 Checks, if the \a widget is inside a QTabWidget. If is is inside
12137 one, left/right key events will be used to switch between tabs in keypad
12138 navigation. If there is no QTabWidget, the horizontal key events can be used
12139to
12140 interact with the value in the focused widget, even though it currently has
12141 not the editFocus.
12142
12143 \sa QWidget::hasEditFocus()
12144*/
12145bool QWidgetPrivate::inTabWidget(QWidget *widget)
12146{
12147 for (QWidget *tabWidget = widget; tabWidget; tabWidget = tabWidget->parentWidget())
12148 if (qobject_cast<const QTabWidget*>(tabWidget))
12149 return true;
12150 return false;
12151}
12152#endif
12153
12154/*!
12155 \since 5.0
12156 \internal
12157
12158 Sets the backing store to be the \a store specified.
12159 The QWidget will take ownership of the \a store.
12160*/
12161void QWidget::setBackingStore(QBackingStore *store)
12162{
12163 // ### createWinId() ??
12164
12165 if (!isWindow())
12166 return;
12167
12168 Q_D(QWidget);
12169
12170 QTLWExtra *topData = d->topData();
12171 if (topData->backingStore == store)
12172 return;
12173
12174 QBackingStore *oldStore = topData->backingStore;
12175 deleteBackingStore(d);
12176 topData->backingStore = store;
12177
12178 QWidgetRepaintManager *repaintManager = d->maybeRepaintManager();
12179 if (!repaintManager)
12180 return;
12181
12182 if (isWindow()) {
12183 if (repaintManager->backingStore() != oldStore && repaintManager->backingStore() != store)
12184 delete repaintManager->backingStore();
12185 repaintManager->setBackingStore(store);
12186 }
12187}
12188
12189/*!
12190 \since 5.0
12191
12192 Returns the QBackingStore this widget will be drawn into.
12193*/
12194QBackingStore *QWidget::backingStore() const
12195{
12196 Q_D(const QWidget);
12197 QTLWExtra *extra = d->maybeTopData();
12198 if (extra && extra->backingStore)
12199 return extra->backingStore;
12200
12201 QWidgetRepaintManager *repaintManager = d->maybeRepaintManager();
12202 return repaintManager ? repaintManager->backingStore() : nullptr;
12203}
12204
12205void QWidgetPrivate::getLayoutItemMargins(int *left, int *top, int *right, int *bottom) const
12206{
12207 if (left)
12208 *left = (int)leftLayoutItemMargin;
12209 if (top)
12210 *top = (int)topLayoutItemMargin;
12211 if (right)
12212 *right = (int)rightLayoutItemMargin;
12213 if (bottom)
12214 *bottom = (int)bottomLayoutItemMargin;
12215}
12216
12217void QWidgetPrivate::setLayoutItemMargins(int left, int top, int right, int bottom)
12218{
12219 if (leftLayoutItemMargin == left
12220 && topLayoutItemMargin == top
12221 && rightLayoutItemMargin == right
12222 && bottomLayoutItemMargin == bottom)
12223 return;
12224
12225 Q_Q(QWidget);
12226 leftLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)left;
12227 topLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)top;
12228 rightLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)right;
12229 bottomLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)bottom;
12230 q->updateGeometry();
12231}
12232
12233void QWidgetPrivate::setLayoutItemMargins(QStyle::SubElement element, const QStyleOption *opt)
12234{
12235 Q_Q(QWidget);
12236 QStyleOption myOpt;
12237 if (!opt) {
12238 myOpt.initFrom(w: q);
12239 myOpt.rect.setRect(ax: 0, ay: 0, aw: 32768, ah: 32768); // arbitrary
12240 opt = &myOpt;
12241 }
12242
12243 QRect liRect = q->style()->subElementRect(subElement: element, option: opt, widget: q);
12244 if (liRect.isValid()) {
12245 leftLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)(opt->rect.left() - liRect.left());
12246 topLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)(opt->rect.top() - liRect.top());
12247 rightLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)(liRect.right() - opt->rect.right());
12248 bottomLayoutItemMargin = (signed char)(liRect.bottom() - opt->rect.bottom());
12249 } else {
12250 leftLayoutItemMargin = 0;
12251 topLayoutItemMargin = 0;
12252 rightLayoutItemMargin = 0;
12253 bottomLayoutItemMargin = 0;
12254 }
12255}
12256// resets the Qt::WA_QuitOnClose attribute to the default value for transient widgets.
12257void QWidgetPrivate::adjustQuitOnCloseAttribute()
12258{
12259 Q_Q(QWidget);
12260
12261 if (!q->parentWidget()) {
12262 Qt::WindowType type = q->windowType();
12263 if (type == Qt::Widget || type == Qt::SubWindow)
12264 type = Qt::Window;
12265 if (type != Qt::Widget && type != Qt::Window && type != Qt::Dialog)
12266 q->setAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_QuitOnClose, on: false);
12267 }
12268}
12269
12270void QWidgetPrivate::sendComposeStatus(QWidget *w, bool end)
12271{
12272 QWidgetPrivate *wd = QWidgetPrivate::get(w);
12273 if (!wd->textureChildSeen)
12274 return;
12275 if (end)
12276 wd->endCompose();
12277 else
12278 wd->beginCompose();
12279 for (int i = 0; i < wd->children.size(); ++i) {
12280 w = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: wd->children.at(i));
12281 if (w && !w->isWindow() && !w->isHidden() && QWidgetPrivate::get(w)->textureChildSeen)
12282 sendComposeStatus(w, end);
12283 }
12284}
12285
12286Q_WIDGETS_EXPORT QWidgetData *qt_qwidget_data(QWidget *widget)
12287{
12288 return widget->data;
12289}
12290
12291Q_WIDGETS_EXPORT QWidgetPrivate *qt_widget_private(QWidget *widget)
12292{
12293 return widget->d_func();
12294}
12295
12296
12297#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
12298/*!
12299 \since 4.5
12300
12301 Returns the proxy widget for the corresponding embedded widget in a graphics
12302 view; otherwise returns \nullptr.
12303
12304 \sa QGraphicsProxyWidget::createProxyForChildWidget(),
12305 QGraphicsScene::addWidget()
12306 */
12307QGraphicsProxyWidget *QWidget::graphicsProxyWidget() const
12308{
12309 Q_D(const QWidget);
12310 if (d->extra) {
12311 return d->extra->proxyWidget;
12312 }
12313 return nullptr;
12314}
12315#endif
12316
12317#ifndef QT_NO_GESTURES
12318/*!
12319 Subscribes the widget to a given \a gesture with specific \a flags.
12320
12321 \sa ungrabGesture(), QGestureEvent
12322 \since 4.6
12323*/
12324void QWidget::grabGesture(Qt::GestureType gesture, Qt::GestureFlags flags)
12325{
12326 Q_D(QWidget);
12327 d->gestureContext.insert(key: gesture, value: flags);
12328 (void)QGestureManager::instance(); // create a gesture manager
12329}
12330
12331/*!
12332 Unsubscribes the widget from a given \a gesture type
12333
12334 \sa grabGesture(), QGestureEvent
12335 \since 4.6
12336*/
12337void QWidget::ungrabGesture(Qt::GestureType gesture)
12338{
12339 // if you modify this function, check the inlined version in ~QWidget, too
12340 Q_D(QWidget);
12341 if (d->gestureContext.remove(key: gesture)) {
12342 if (QGestureManager *manager = QGestureManager::instance())
12343 manager->cleanupCachedGestures(target: this, type: gesture);
12344 }
12345}
12346#endif // QT_NO_GESTURES
12347
12348/*!
12349 \fn void QWidget::destroy(bool destroyWindow, bool destroySubWindows)
12350
12351 Frees up window system resources. Destroys the widget window if \a
12352 destroyWindow is true.
12353
12354 destroy() calls itself recursively for all the child widgets,
12355 passing \a destroySubWindows for the \a destroyWindow parameter.
12356 To have more control over destruction of subwidgets, destroy
12357 subwidgets selectively first.
12358
12359 This function is usually called from the QWidget destructor.
12360*/
12361void QWidget::destroy(bool destroyWindow, bool destroySubWindows)
12362{
12363 Q_D(QWidget);
12364
12365 d->aboutToDestroy();
12366 if (!isWindow() && parentWidget())
12367 parentWidget()->d_func()->invalidateBackingStore(d->effectiveRectFor(rect: geometry()));
12368 d->deactivateWidgetCleanup();
12369
12370 if ((windowType() == Qt::Popup) && qApp)
12371 qApp->d_func()->closePopup(popup: this);
12372
12373 if (this == QApplicationPrivate::active_window)
12374 QApplicationPrivate::setActiveWindow(nullptr);
12375 if (QWidget::mouseGrabber() == this)
12376 releaseMouse();
12377 if (QWidget::keyboardGrabber() == this)
12378 releaseKeyboard();
12379
12380 setAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created, on: false);
12381
12382 if (windowType() != Qt::Desktop) {
12383 if (destroySubWindows) {
12384 QObjectList childList(children());
12385 for (int i = 0; i < childList.size(); i++) {
12386 QWidget *widget = qobject_cast<QWidget *>(o: childList.at(i));
12387 if (widget && widget->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_NativeWindow)) {
12388 if (widget->windowHandle()) {
12389 widget->destroy();
12390 }
12391 }
12392 }
12393 }
12394 if (destroyWindow) {
12395 d->deleteTLSysExtra();
12396 } else {
12397 if (parentWidget() && parentWidget()->testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created)) {
12398 d->hide_sys();
12399 }
12400 }
12401
12402 d->setWinId(0);
12403 }
12404}
12405
12406/*!
12407 \fn QPaintEngine *QWidget::paintEngine() const
12408
12409 Returns the widget's paint engine.
12410
12411 Note that this function should not be called explicitly by the
12412 user, since it's meant for reimplementation purposes only. The
12413 function is called by Qt internally, and the default
12414 implementation may not always return a valid pointer.
12415*/
12416QPaintEngine *QWidget::paintEngine() const
12417{
12418 qWarning(msg: "QWidget::paintEngine: Should no longer be called");
12419
12420#ifdef Q_OS_WIN
12421 // We set this bit which is checked in setAttribute for
12422 // Qt::WA_PaintOnScreen. We do this to allow these two scenarios:
12423 //
12424 // 1. Users accidentally set Qt::WA_PaintOnScreen on X and port to
12425 // Windows which would mean suddenly their widgets stop working.
12426 //
12427 // 2. Users set paint on screen and subclass paintEngine() to
12428 // return 0, in which case we have a "hole" in the backingstore
12429 // allowing use of GDI or DirectX directly.
12430 //
12431 // 1 is WRONG, but to minimize silent failures, we have set this
12432 // bit to ignore the setAttribute call. 2. needs to be
12433 // supported because its our only means of embedding native
12434 // graphics stuff.
12435 const_cast<QWidgetPrivate *>(d_func())->noPaintOnScreen = 1;
12436#endif
12437
12438 return nullptr; //##### @@@
12439}
12440
12441// Do not call QWindow::mapToGlobal() until QPlatformWindow is properly showing.
12442static inline bool canMapPosition(QWindow *window)
12443{
12444 return window->handle() && !qt_window_private(window)->resizeEventPending;
12445}
12446
12447#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
12448static inline QGraphicsProxyWidget *graphicsProxyWidget(const QWidget *w)
12449{
12450 QGraphicsProxyWidget *result = nullptr;
12451 const QWidgetPrivate *d = qt_widget_private(widget: const_cast<QWidget *>(w));
12452 if (d->extra)
12453 result = d->extra->proxyWidget;
12454 return result;
12455}
12456#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
12457
12458struct MapToGlobalTransformResult {
12459 QTransform transform;
12460 QWindow *window;
12461};
12462
12463static MapToGlobalTransformResult mapToGlobalTransform(const QWidget *w)
12464{
12465 MapToGlobalTransformResult result;
12466 result.window = nullptr;
12467 for ( ; w ; w = w->parentWidget()) {
12468#if QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
12469 if (QGraphicsProxyWidget *qgpw = graphicsProxyWidget(w)) {
12470 if (const QGraphicsScene *scene = qgpw->scene()) {
12471 const QList <QGraphicsView *> views = scene->views();
12472 if (!views.isEmpty()) {
12473 result.transform *= qgpw->sceneTransform();
12474 result.transform *= views.first()->viewportTransform();
12475 w = views.first()->viewport();
12476 }
12477 }
12478 }
12479#endif // QT_CONFIG(graphicsview)
12480 QWindow *window = w->windowHandle();
12481 if (window && canMapPosition(window)) {
12482 result.window = window;
12483 break;
12484 }
12485
12486 const QPoint topLeft = w->geometry().topLeft();
12487 result.transform.translate(dx: topLeft.x(), dy: topLeft.y());
12488 if (w->isWindow())
12489 break;
12490 }
12491 return result;
12492}
12493
12494/*!
12495 \fn QPointF QWidget::mapToGlobal(const QPointF &pos) const
12496
12497 Translates the widget coordinate \a pos to global screen
12498 coordinates. For example, \c{mapToGlobal(QPointF(0,0))} would give
12499 the global coordinates of the top-left pixel of the widget.
12500
12501 \sa mapFromGlobal(), mapTo(), mapToParent()
12502 \since 6.0
12503*/
12504QPointF QWidget::mapToGlobal(const QPointF &pos) const
12505{
12506 const MapToGlobalTransformResult t = mapToGlobalTransform(w: this);
12507 const QPointF g = t.transform.map(p: pos);
12508 return t.window ? t.window->mapToGlobal(pos: g) : g;
12509}
12510
12511/*!
12512 \overload
12513*/
12514QPoint QWidget::mapToGlobal(const QPoint &pos) const
12515{
12516 return mapToGlobal(pos: QPointF(pos)).toPoint();
12517}
12518
12519/*!
12520 \fn QPointF QWidget::mapFromGlobal(const QPointF &pos) const
12521
12522 Translates the global screen coordinate \a pos to widget
12523 coordinates.
12524
12525 \sa mapToGlobal(), mapFrom(), mapFromParent()
12526 \since 6.0
12527*/
12528QPointF QWidget::mapFromGlobal(const QPointF &pos) const
12529{
12530 const MapToGlobalTransformResult t = mapToGlobalTransform(w: this);
12531 const QPointF windowLocal = t.window ? t.window->mapFromGlobal(pos) : pos;
12532 return t.transform.inverted().map(p: windowLocal);
12533}
12534
12535/*!
12536 \overload
12537*/
12538QPoint QWidget::mapFromGlobal(const QPoint &pos) const
12539{
12540 return mapFromGlobal(pos: QPointF(pos)).toPoint();
12541}
12542
12543QWidget *qt_pressGrab = nullptr;
12544QWidget *qt_mouseGrb = nullptr;
12545static bool mouseGrabWithCursor = false;
12546static QWidget *keyboardGrb = nullptr;
12547
12548static inline QWindow *grabberWindow(const QWidget *w)
12549{
12550 QWindow *window = w->windowHandle();
12551 if (!window)
12552 if (const QWidget *nativeParent = w->nativeParentWidget())
12553 window = nativeParent->windowHandle();
12554 return window;
12555}
12556
12557#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
12558static void grabMouseForWidget(QWidget *widget, const QCursor *cursor = nullptr)
12559#else
12560static void grabMouseForWidget(QWidget *widget)
12561#endif
12562{
12563 if (qt_mouseGrb)
12564 qt_mouseGrb->releaseMouse();
12565
12566 mouseGrabWithCursor = false;
12567 if (QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: widget)) {
12568#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
12569 if (cursor) {
12570 mouseGrabWithCursor = true;
12571 QGuiApplication::setOverrideCursor(*cursor);
12572 }
12573#endif // !QT_NO_CURSOR
12574 window->setMouseGrabEnabled(true);
12575 }
12576
12577 qt_mouseGrb = widget;
12578 qt_pressGrab = nullptr;
12579}
12580
12581static void releaseMouseGrabOfWidget(QWidget *widget)
12582{
12583 if (qt_mouseGrb == widget) {
12584 if (QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: widget)) {
12585#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
12586 if (mouseGrabWithCursor) {
12587 QGuiApplication::restoreOverrideCursor();
12588 mouseGrabWithCursor = false;
12589 }
12590#endif // !QT_NO_CURSOR
12591 window->setMouseGrabEnabled(false);
12592 }
12593 }
12594 qt_mouseGrb = nullptr;
12595}
12596
12597/*!
12598 \fn void QWidget::grabMouse()
12599
12600 Grabs the mouse input.
12601
12602 This widget receives all mouse events until releaseMouse() is
12603 called; other widgets get no mouse events at all. Keyboard
12604 events are not affected. Use grabKeyboard() if you want to grab
12605 that.
12606
12607 \warning Bugs in mouse-grabbing applications very often lock the
12608 terminal. Use this function with extreme caution, and consider
12609 using the \c -nograb command line option while debugging.
12610
12611 It is almost never necessary to grab the mouse when using Qt, as
12612 Qt grabs and releases it sensibly. In particular, Qt grabs the
12613 mouse when a mouse button is pressed and keeps it until the last
12614 button is released.
12615
12616 \note Only visible widgets can grab mouse input. If isVisible()
12617 returns \c false for a widget, that widget cannot call grabMouse().
12618
12619 \note On Windows, grabMouse() only works when the mouse is inside a window
12620 owned by the process.
12621 On \macos, grabMouse() only works when the mouse is inside the frame of that widget.
12622
12623 \sa releaseMouse(), grabKeyboard(), releaseKeyboard()
12624*/
12625void QWidget::grabMouse()
12626{
12627 grabMouseForWidget(widget: this);
12628}
12629
12630/*!
12631 \fn void QWidget::grabMouse(const QCursor &cursor)
12632 \overload grabMouse()
12633
12634 Grabs the mouse input and changes the cursor shape.
12635
12636 The cursor will assume shape \a cursor (for as long as the mouse
12637 focus is grabbed) and this widget will be the only one to receive
12638 mouse events until releaseMouse() is called().
12639
12640 \warning Grabbing the mouse might lock the terminal.
12641
12642 \note See the note in QWidget::grabMouse().
12643
12644 \sa releaseMouse(), grabKeyboard(), releaseKeyboard(), setCursor()
12645*/
12646#ifndef QT_NO_CURSOR
12647void QWidget::grabMouse(const QCursor &cursor)
12648{
12649 grabMouseForWidget(widget: this, cursor: &cursor);
12650}
12651#endif
12652
12653bool QWidgetPrivate::stealMouseGrab(bool grab)
12654{
12655 // This is like a combination of grab/releaseMouse() but with error checking
12656 // and it has no effect on the result of mouseGrabber().
12657 Q_Q(QWidget);
12658 QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: q);
12659 return window ? window->setMouseGrabEnabled(grab) : false;
12660}
12661
12662/*!
12663 \fn void QWidget::releaseMouse()
12664
12665 Releases the mouse grab.
12666
12667 \sa grabMouse(), grabKeyboard(), releaseKeyboard()
12668*/
12669void QWidget::releaseMouse()
12670{
12671 releaseMouseGrabOfWidget(widget: this);
12672}
12673
12674/*!
12675 \fn void QWidget::grabKeyboard()
12676
12677 Grabs the keyboard input.
12678
12679 This widget receives all keyboard events until releaseKeyboard()
12680 is called; other widgets get no keyboard events at all. Mouse
12681 events are not affected. Use grabMouse() if you want to grab that.
12682
12683 The focus widget is not affected, except that it doesn't receive
12684 any keyboard events. setFocus() moves the focus as usual, but the
12685 new focus widget receives keyboard events only after
12686 releaseKeyboard() is called.
12687
12688 If a different widget is currently grabbing keyboard input, that
12689 widget's grab is released first.
12690
12691 \sa releaseKeyboard(), grabMouse(), releaseMouse(), focusWidget()
12692*/
12693void QWidget::grabKeyboard()
12694{
12695 if (keyboardGrb)
12696 keyboardGrb->releaseKeyboard();
12697 if (QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: this))
12698 window->setKeyboardGrabEnabled(true);
12699 keyboardGrb = this;
12700}
12701
12702bool QWidgetPrivate::stealKeyboardGrab(bool grab)
12703{
12704 // This is like a combination of grab/releaseKeyboard() but with error
12705 // checking and it has no effect on the result of keyboardGrabber().
12706 Q_Q(QWidget);
12707 QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: q);
12708 return window ? window->setKeyboardGrabEnabled(grab) : false;
12709}
12710
12711/*!
12712 \fn void QWidget::releaseKeyboard()
12713
12714 Releases the keyboard grab.
12715
12716 \sa grabKeyboard(), grabMouse(), releaseMouse()
12717*/
12718void QWidget::releaseKeyboard()
12719{
12720 if (keyboardGrb == this) {
12721 if (QWindow *window = grabberWindow(w: this))
12722 window->setKeyboardGrabEnabled(false);
12723 keyboardGrb = nullptr;
12724 }
12725}
12726
12727/*!
12728 \fn QWidget *QWidget::mouseGrabber()
12729
12730 Returns the widget that is currently grabbing the mouse input.
12731
12732 If no widget in this application is currently grabbing the mouse,
12733 \nullptr is returned.
12734
12735 \sa grabMouse(), keyboardGrabber()
12736*/
12737QWidget *QWidget::mouseGrabber()
12738{
12739 if (qt_mouseGrb)
12740 return qt_mouseGrb;
12741 return qt_pressGrab;
12742}
12743
12744/*!
12745 \fn QWidget *QWidget::keyboardGrabber()
12746
12747 Returns the widget that is currently grabbing the keyboard input.
12748
12749 If no widget in this application is currently grabbing the
12750 keyboard, \nullptr is returned.
12751
12752 \sa grabMouse(), mouseGrabber()
12753*/
12754QWidget *QWidget::keyboardGrabber()
12755{
12756 return keyboardGrb;
12757}
12758
12759/*!
12760 \fn void QWidget::activateWindow()
12761
12762 Sets the top-level widget containing this widget to be the active
12763 window.
12764
12765 An active window is a visible top-level window that has the
12766 keyboard input focus.
12767
12768 This function performs the same operation as clicking the mouse on
12769 the title bar of a top-level window. On X11, the result depends on
12770 the Window Manager. If you want to ensure that the window is
12771 stacked on top as well you should also call raise(). Note that the
12772 window must be visible, otherwise activateWindow() has no effect.
12773
12774 On Windows, if you are calling this when the application is not
12775 currently the active one then it will not make it the active
12776 window. It will change the color of the taskbar entry to indicate
12777 that the window has changed in some way. This is because Microsoft
12778 does not allow an application to interrupt what the user is currently
12779 doing in another application.
12780
12781 \sa isActiveWindow(), window(), show()
12782*/
12783void QWidget::activateWindow()
12784{
12785 QWindow *const wnd = window()->windowHandle();
12786
12787 if (wnd)
12788 wnd->requestActivate();
12789}
12790
12791/*!
12792
12793 Internal implementation of the virtual QPaintDevice::metric()
12794 function.
12795
12796 \a m is the metric to get.
12797*/
12798int QWidget::metric(PaintDeviceMetric m) const
12799{
12800 QScreen *screen = this->screen();
12801
12802 if (!screen) {
12803 if (m == PdmDpiX || m == PdmDpiY)
12804 return 72;
12805 return QPaintDevice::metric(metric: m);
12806 }
12807
12808 auto resolveDevicePixelRatio = [this, screen]() -> qreal {
12809
12810 // Note: keep in sync with QBackingStorePrivate::backingStoreDevicePixelRatio()!
12811 static bool downscale = qEnvironmentVariableIntValue(varName: "QT_WIDGETS_HIGHDPI_DOWNSCALE") > 0;
12812 QWindow *window = this->window()->windowHandle();
12813 if (window)
12814 return downscale ? std::ceil(x: window->devicePixelRatio()) : window->devicePixelRatio();
12815 return screen->devicePixelRatio();
12816 };
12817
12818 switch (m) {
12819 case PdmWidth:
12820 return data->crect.width();
12821 case PdmWidthMM:
12822 return data->crect.width() * screen->physicalSize().width() / screen->geometry().width();
12823 case PdmHeight:
12824 return data->crect.height();
12825 case PdmHeightMM:
12826 return data->crect.height() * screen->physicalSize().height() / screen->geometry().height();
12827 case PdmDepth:
12828 return screen->depth();
12829 case PdmDpiX:
12830 for (const QWidget *p = this; p; p = p->parentWidget()) {
12831 if (p->d_func()->extra && p->d_func()->extra->customDpiX)
12832 return p->d_func()->extra->customDpiX;
12833 }
12834 return qRound(d: screen->logicalDotsPerInchX());
12835 case PdmDpiY:
12836 for (const QWidget *p = this; p; p = p->parentWidget()) {
12837 if (p->d_func()->extra && p->d_func()->extra->customDpiY)
12838 return p->d_func()->extra->customDpiY;
12839 }
12840 return qRound(d: screen->logicalDotsPerInchY());
12841 case PdmPhysicalDpiX:
12842 return qRound(d: screen->physicalDotsPerInchX());
12843 case PdmPhysicalDpiY:
12844 return qRound(d: screen->physicalDotsPerInchY());
12845 case PdmDevicePixelRatio:
12846 return resolveDevicePixelRatio();
12847 case PdmDevicePixelRatioScaled:
12848 return QPaintDevice::devicePixelRatioFScale() * resolveDevicePixelRatio();
12849 default:
12850 break;
12851 }
12852 return QPaintDevice::metric(metric: m);
12853}
12854
12855/*!
12856 Initializes the \a painter pen, background and font to the same as
12857 the given widget's. This function is called automatically when the
12858 painter is opened on a QWidget.
12859*/
12860void QWidget::initPainter(QPainter *painter) const
12861{
12862 const QPalette &pal = palette();
12863 painter->d_func()->state->pen = QPen(pal.brush(cr: foregroundRole()), 1);
12864 painter->d_func()->state->bgBrush = pal.brush(cr: backgroundRole());
12865 QFont f(font(), const_cast<QWidget *>(this));
12866 painter->d_func()->state->deviceFont = f;
12867 painter->d_func()->state->font = f;
12868}
12869
12870/*!
12871 \internal
12872
12873 Do PaintDevice rendering with the specified \a offset.
12874*/
12875QPaintDevice *QWidget::redirected(QPoint *offset) const
12876{
12877 return d_func()->redirected(offset);
12878}
12879
12880/*!
12881 \internal
12882
12883 A painter that is shared among other instances of QPainter.
12884*/
12885QPainter *QWidget::sharedPainter() const
12886{
12887 // Someone sent a paint event directly to the widget
12888 if (!d_func()->redirectDev)
12889 return nullptr;
12890
12891 QPainter *sp = d_func()->sharedPainter();
12892 if (!sp || !sp->isActive())
12893 return nullptr;
12894
12895 if (sp->paintEngine()->paintDevice() != d_func()->redirectDev)
12896 return nullptr;
12897
12898 return sp;
12899}
12900
12901/*!
12902 \fn void QWidget::setMask(const QRegion &region)
12903 \overload
12904
12905 Causes only the parts of the widget which overlap \a region to be
12906 visible. If the region includes pixels outside the rect() of the
12907 widget, window system controls in that area may or may not be
12908 visible, depending on the platform.
12909
12910 Note that this effect can be slow if the region is particularly
12911 complex.
12912
12913 \sa windowOpacity
12914*/
12915void QWidget::setMask(const QRegion &newMask)
12916{
12917 Q_D(QWidget);
12918
12919 d->createExtra();
12920 if (newMask == d->extra->mask)
12921 return;
12922
12923#ifndef QT_NO_BACKINGSTORE
12924 const QRegion oldMask(d->extra->mask);
12925#endif
12926
12927 d->extra->mask = newMask;
12928 d->extra->hasMask = !newMask.isEmpty();
12929
12930 if (!testAttribute(attribute: Qt::WA_WState_Created))
12931 return;
12932
12933 d->setMask_sys(newMask);
12934
12935#ifndef QT_NO_BACKINGSTORE
12936 if (!isVisible())
12937 return;
12938
12939 if (!d->extra->hasMask) {
12940 // Mask was cleared; update newly exposed area.
12941 QRegion expose(rect());
12942 expose -= oldMask;
12943 if (!expose.isEmpty()) {
12944 d->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
12945 update(rgn: expose);
12946 }
12947 return;
12948 }
12949
12950 if (!isWindow()) {
12951 // Update newly exposed area on the parent widget.
12952 QRegion parentExpose(rect());
12953 parentExpose -= newMask;
12954 if (!parentExpose.isEmpty()) {
12955 d->setDirtyOpaqueRegion();
12956 parentExpose.translate(p: data->crect.topLeft());
12957 parentWidget()->update(rgn: parentExpose);
12958 }
12959
12960 // Update newly exposed area on this widget
12961 if (!oldMask.isEmpty())
12962 update(rgn: newMask - oldMask);
12963 }
12964#endif
12965}
12966
12967void QWidgetPrivate::setMask_sys(const QRegion &region)
12968{
12969 Q_Q(QWidget);
12970 if (QWindow *window = q->windowHandle())
12971 window->setMask(region);
12972}
12973
12974/*!
12975 \fn void QWidget::setMask(const QBitmap &bitmap)
12976
12977 Causes only the pixels of the widget for which \a bitmap has a
12978 corresponding 1 bit to be visible. If the region includes pixels
12979 outside the rect() of the widget, window system controls in that
12980 area may or may not be visible, depending on the platform.
12981
12982 Note that this effect can be slow if the region is particularly
12983 complex.
12984
12985 The following code shows how an image with an alpha channel can be
12986 used to generate a mask for a widget:
12987
12988 \snippet widget-mask/main.cpp 0
12989
12990 The label shown by this code is masked using the image it contains,
12991 giving the appearance that an irregularly-shaped image is being drawn
12992 directly onto the screen.
12993
12994 Masked widgets receive mouse events only on their visible
12995 portions.
12996
12997 \sa clearMask(), windowOpacity(), {Shaped Clock Example}
12998*/
12999void QWidget::setMask(const QBitmap &bitmap)
13000{
13001 setMask(QRegion(bitmap));
13002}
13003
13004/*!
13005 \fn void QWidget::clearMask()
13006
13007 Removes any mask set by setMask().
13008
13009 \sa setMask()
13010*/
13011void QWidget::clearMask()
13012{
13013 Q_D(QWidget);
13014 if (!d->extra || !d->extra->hasMask)
13015 return;
13016 setMask(QRegion());
13017}
13018
13019void QWidgetPrivate::setWidgetParentHelper(QObject *widgetAsObject, QObject *newParent)
13020{
13021 Q_ASSERT(widgetAsObject->isWidgetType());
13022 Q_ASSERT(!newParent || newParent->isWidgetType());
13023 QWidget *widget = static_cast<QWidget*>(widgetAsObject);
13024 widget->setParent(static_cast<QWidget*>(newParent));
13025}
13026
13027std::string QWidgetPrivate::flagsForDumping() const
13028{
13029 Q_Q(const QWidget);
13030 std::string flags = QObjectPrivate::flagsForDumping();
13031 if (QApplication::focusWidget() == q)
13032 flags += 'F';
13033 if (q->isVisible()) {
13034 std::stringstream s;
13035 s << '<'
13036 << q->width() << 'x' << q->height()
13037 << std::showpos << q->x() << q->y()
13038 << '>';
13039 flags += s.str();
13040 } else {
13041 flags += 'I';
13042 }
13043 return flags;
13044}
13045
13046void QWidgetPrivate::setNetWmWindowTypes(bool skipIfMissing)
13047{
13048#if QT_CONFIG(xcb)
13049 Q_Q(QWidget);
13050
13051 if (!q->windowHandle())
13052 return;
13053
13054 QXcbWindow::WindowTypes wmWindowType = QXcbWindow::None;
13055 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDesktop))
13056 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Desktop;
13057 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDock))
13058 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Dock;
13059 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeToolBar))
13060 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Toolbar;
13061 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeMenu))
13062 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Menu;
13063 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeUtility))
13064 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Utility;
13065 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeSplash))
13066 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Splash;
13067 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDialog))
13068 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Dialog;
13069 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDropDownMenu))
13070 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::DropDownMenu;
13071 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypePopupMenu))
13072 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::PopupMenu;
13073 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeToolTip))
13074 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Tooltip;
13075 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeNotification))
13076 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Notification;
13077 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeCombo))
13078 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Combo;
13079 if (q->testAttribute(Qt::WA_X11NetWmWindowTypeDND))
13080 wmWindowType |= QXcbWindow::Dnd;
13081
13082 if (wmWindowType == QXcbWindow::None && skipIfMissing)
13083 return;
13084
13085 if (auto *xcbWindow = dynamic_cast<QXcbWindow*>(q->windowHandle()->handle()))
13086 xcbWindow->setWindowType(wmWindowType);
13087#else
13088 Q_UNUSED(skipIfMissing);
13089#endif
13090}
13091
13092#ifndef QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
13093
13094static inline void formatWidgetAttributes(QDebug debug, const QWidget *widget)
13095{
13096 const QMetaObject *qtMo = qt_getEnumMetaObject(Qt::WA_AttributeCount);
13097 const QMetaEnum me = qtMo->enumerator(index: qtMo->indexOfEnumerator(name: "WidgetAttribute"));
13098 debug << ", attributes=[";
13099 int count = 0;
13100 for (int a = 0; a < Qt::WA_AttributeCount; ++a) {
13101 if (widget->testAttribute(attribute: static_cast<Qt::WidgetAttribute>(a))) {
13102 if (count++)
13103 debug << ',';
13104 debug << me.valueToKey(value: a);
13105 }
13106 }
13107 debug << ']';
13108}
13109
13110QDebug operator<<(QDebug debug, const QWidget *widget)
13111{
13112 const QDebugStateSaver saver(debug);
13113 debug.nospace();
13114 if (widget) {
13115 debug << widget->metaObject()->className() << '(' << (const void *)widget;
13116 if (!widget->objectName().isEmpty())
13117 debug << ", name=" << widget->objectName();
13118 if (debug.verbosity() > 2) {
13119 const QRect geometry = widget->geometry();
13120 const QRect frameGeometry = widget->frameGeometry();
13121 if (widget->isVisible())
13122 debug << ", visible";
13123 if (!widget->isEnabled())
13124 debug << ", disabled";
13125 debug << ", states=" << widget->windowState()
13126 << ", type=" << widget->windowType() << ", flags=" << widget->windowFlags();
13127 formatWidgetAttributes(debug, widget);
13128 if (widget->isWindow())
13129 debug << ", window";
13130 debug << ", " << geometry.width() << 'x' << geometry.height()
13131 << Qt::forcesign << geometry.x() << geometry.y() << Qt::noforcesign;
13132 if (frameGeometry != geometry) {
13133 const QMargins margins(geometry.x() - frameGeometry.x(),
13134 geometry.y() - frameGeometry.y(),
13135 frameGeometry.right() - geometry.right(),
13136 frameGeometry.bottom() - geometry.bottom());
13137 debug << ", margins=" << margins;
13138 }
13139 debug << ", devicePixelRatio=" << widget->devicePixelRatio();
13140 if (const WId wid = widget->internalWinId())
13141 debug << ", winId=0x" << Qt::hex << wid << Qt::dec;
13142 }
13143 debug << ')';
13144 } else {
13145 debug << "QWidget(0x0)";
13146 }
13147 return debug;
13148}
13149#endif // !QT_NO_DEBUG_STREAM
13150
13151QT_END_NAMESPACE
